text:
50 cl. can @ Home. 
Aroma: not very intense aromas of toasted malts, caramel, malts, bread crust, biscuits. Only very subtle hops overtones. Hints of alcohol.
Appearance: deep amber to brown color with high head thickness. Very creamy foam. Beige head made of mid to big sized bubbles. Low to medium hazyness. Very high retention. Medium Brussels lacing.
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of toasted malts, caramel, bread crust, biscuits. Burnt caramel and roasted malts overtones. Balance is towards the sweetness. No much perceived bitternessat first. Sweet at first and more bitter towards the end. Alcohol level is noticeable in the flavor. 
Palate: medium body, oily to creamy texture, low to medium carbonation, very long bittersweet (more bitter than sweet and increasingly bitter) finish with flavors of toasted malts, caramel, hints of burnt caramel and roasted malts. The bitterness is slightly astringent.
Overall: very good color and appearance. Not very intense but good toasted malts and caramel aromas. Good flavors too. Not much noticeable hops in aroma or flavor. A very good beer. Pretty pleasant and drinkable. Very complex mix of flavors. Intriguing.

Une bière brune, aux reflets rubis, avec une grosse carbonatation et une bonne effervescence. Au nez, caramel, toffee, réglisse noire, et un espèce de côté de grain fumé bizarre que jai jamais senti auparavant dans une bière. En bouche, on remarque tout de suite une absence totale deffervescence, mes yeux me jouent des tours. Cest fort malté! Le gout de toffee est fort present, le côté caramélisé de lalcool également. Il y a également une petite amertume... ca me fait somme toute penser à un barleywine à laméricaine... avec peut-être un peu moins de corps. Lamertume se fait certainement autant présente quun petit côté fumé qui ne démord pas. Pas mon style préféré, mais définitivement une bière complexe qui mérite dêtre essayé au moins une fois.
Can. Pours dark amber with lovely fluffy light brown head. Aroma is caramel, alcohol, candy, somewhat metallic. Taste is sweet with caramel, alcohol, somewhat spicey.

beautiful appearance of clear dark amber to mahogany colour, extremely huge, dense beige-ish head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of dried fruity and resiny notes, some toasted bread and biscuits; taste of intensive hoppy bitterness, malty-syrupy sweetness, some dried fruits and orange zest; great beer but still, will not be my favourite...anyway, its appearance is really one of the best Ive ever seen so far!

I don't know much about beer rating but this is a great beer if your a beer person. Definitely will drink again 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Heerlijke strong ale: bitter, moutig, caramel, hops. Mooie zacht bittere afdronk. Heerlijk
Chocolade bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, moutig, citrus. Smaakt fruitig, zoetig, suiker. Veel koolzuur.

50cl-blik van bij Dranken de Caigny te Essen. U: Donkerkoperkleurig met een licht beige schuimkraag. G: Hoppig, karamel en bessen. S: Karamelzoet met een stevige hopbitterheid. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

Dark garnet beer with a short beige head. Roasted aromas, red fruits, caramel-licorice, bitter of hop. The taste is actually intense, very roasted and dry, with a strong hoppy presence, earthy and citrus-pine. Note of coffee, grounds, wood, dry fruits and herbs. A good industrial beer in spite of the arrogance which we try to rig out.

Bruin, roodbruin bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, C-hop. Smaak: bitter, hopbitter, groene hop, wat harsachtig, reete strak + nog wat toffee! Lekker! Medium volmondig. Zachte koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: lang, bitter.

16floz can ($2, COD: 08.04.2016, BBD: 12.02.2016) poured into an imperial nonic glass. It looks great, a reddish-brown with a creamy head, and some sediment that settles to the bottom. Caramel, fig, and currants compose the aroma profile. Full body and hoppy, strong rustic flavoring of well toasted bread and sharp cheddar. Perhaps my tastes have changed, since the abundance of hoppy beers mean that those were on vanguard dont stick out as much and there is a now more of a desire to have maltier beers to juxtapose hop beer overload. Regardless it is still good, even when past its BBD. Allso, I could go into a meandering rant about Arrogant Brewing and Stone Brewing, but Ill save it.
Stærk sprittet. Stor sødme der desværre ikke smager så meget at andet end lys malt.

Kolor ciemnoczerowny, piana obfita, grubooczkowa, trwała. W aromacie karmel, żywica, lekkie owocei alkohol. W smaku więcej karmelu, ciemne i ciężkie owoce w tle. Goryczka wysoka, ziołowa i alkoholowa. Dość słodkie i gładkie, alkohol rozgrzewający.

This is a pretty decent ale, not yhe best one Ive ever had but decent. Or maybe "It is quite doubtful that" I " have the taste or sophistication to be able to appreciate an ale of this quality and depth" or so the wording 6-pack carrier states...
Pours dark rouge with lasting off white lacing. As described, an aggressive beer, big hop forward sophistication of depth is required to like this bad boy . Well named!

Nos: karmel, trochę ziół, sporo żywicy od chmielu. W smaku dość konkretna podbudowa słodowa, lekkie miodowe nuty utlenienia, jednak z drugiej strony atakuje ziołowa goryczka. Pod koniec picia czuć też delikatnie obecność alkoholu, który nie drapie po gardle jak wóda, dość szybko odparowuje, przypominając tylko o mocy piwa. Piwo nie zaliczę do tych kładących na łopatki, ale jest dobrze zbalansowane i nie ma większych wad.
Rotbraun mit einer sehr stabilen hellbraunen Schaumkrone. Geruch ist malzig kräuterig. Der Antrunk ist kräftig malzig, leicht süßlich, dann aber enorm bitter, kräuterig leicht medizinisch.
50cl can from Germany. dark amber. medium to big beige head. hops, malts, spices, caramel, medium bitterness that lingers on. low to medium carbonation.

Copenhagen 28/5 2017. 50 cl can from Meny. Kind of Arrogant looking Devil with a mug of beer - of course - on the label. Pours hazy ruby with slighty off-white head. Settles as thin transparent layer of foam. No lacing. Aroma is heavy sweet. Fermented - almost decayed - fruit, sulfur, caramel and very distinct alcohol. Light carbonation and thick oily palate. Flavor is quite well balanced. Heavy sweetness followed by aggressive fruity bitterness. Quite a mouthful - but a pleasant one.
Didnt like this at all. Completely unbalanced with strange bitterness reminiscent of vomit. It didnt get the lowest rating due to some nice malty flavors lurking in the back.

pours rich ruby amber with a medium off white head. Rich floral and tropical fruity aroma. Bitter from the start and all the way through. Dark fruits come through as the bitter fades. Big beer that punches above its 7.2. Good, but I wouldnt session it.

Aroma: pine, caramel, resin, herbal, some red fruits
Taste: medium bitter, moderate sweet, pine, resin, caramel, honey, floral, fruity

Hazy amber color with tall off-white head. Aroma is very hoppy, some caramel and toffee. Taste is heavy bitter with sweetish notes. Dry finish. I wasnt very excited on this beer at first, but it gets better the more I drink it. Pretty good.

Zaskakujące piwo, aczkolwiek przesadzone w swym ekstremiźmie. Prezentuje się bardzo ładnie, tworzy gęstą, drobnopęcherzykową pianę, a samo ma kolor miedziany. W aromacie sporo nut słodowych kojarzących się herbatnikami. Całość dopełniają subtelne nuty owocowe - głównie wiśniowe. W smaku jest wytrawnie. Początkowa delikatna słodycz słodowa zostaje gwałtownie przełamana bardzo agresywną żywiczną, ale noszącą znamiona tępości - goryczką. Z tyłu przewijają się delikatne nuty syropowe. Całość jest gęsta, umiarkowanie nasycona i niezbalansowana - aczkolwiek chyba o to chodziło. Mimo że zaskoczyło to ostatecznie ani pali, ani chłodzi.
Słodowy ulepek w smaku i zapachu. Do tego mocno przegazowany i z tępą, zalegającą goryczką. Taki Vip czy inne mocne, tyle że zamiast z biedry to z usej. Czy tam z Niemiec. Raczej ciekawostka.

Miedziane, praktycznie klarowne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie sporej warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat przyjemny, słodowy, owoce tropikalne. W smaku gęste, lekko słodkie, owocowe, lekko żywiczne. Goryczka wysoka,krótka, szlachetna, żywiczna. Ogólnie świetne piwo, treściwe, goryczkowe, fajnie czuć chmiel, a przy tym dość pijalne.
Kastanienfarben mit wuchtiger Schaumkrone. Röstmalziger Antrunk, extrem bitterer crapefruitartiger Mittelteil, sehr stark gehopft. Trocken im Abgang.

light body, bitter, very bitter, medium sourness, 
Not too impressed. Slogan is great but the taste or description on the bottle leaves much to answer for. 
I would place this as an IPA, not the strong american ale.
Honestly going wash my mouth out with Bud Light now

Aroma is some caramel, maybe a touch of citrus, almost nonpresent - probably the weakest thing about the beer. Pours reddish mahogany with large off-white head. In taste maltiness including some dark malt & caramel (malt balance reminds me of bocks), with plenty of hoppy citrus and maybe some resin. Relatively high bitterness, though its herbal/seedy/ash-like and feels partially derived from alcohol - a bit unpleasant. Full body with nice mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Gets better (more balanced) as it warms up. Its alright, but I expected far more from all the hype.
spruce, citrus, earthy, alcohol, skunky, amber, cloudy, frothy, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter. Some may like it. I did not!
In lattina. Ambra carico con riglessi mogano e abbondante schiuma crema. Al naso caramello e pane nero. Al palato un buon corpo e soprattutto il motivo per cui è nata: lamaro che permane a lungo.
0,5l Dose. Dunkelrotes Bier mit toller Schaumkrone. Geruch nach trockenen Früchten und Citrusaroma. Es schmeckt nach Toffee, Citrusaroma, etwas nach Bitterschokolade und reifen Früchten.

A really lovely clear mahogany color with a fine tan head. Looks good and inviting. Fine lacing also. Quite moderate intensity in the aroma. Mostly caramel malt in the nose. Not that inviting. Medium + body and a fine carbonation level. Easy to drink. Not enough sweetness to back up the bitterness. A bit unbalanced actually.

Can from bierlinie. Pours dark Red. Nose is citrus, red fruits, toffee. Palate is bitter chocolate, dried fruit, wood. Very bitter. Thought this would be crazier. A bit disappointed, but would probably liked it less if it would be crazier.

Im surprised this beer has an almost 10/10 rating but Im not surprised at the same time because their marketing stragedy is very good "if you dont like this beer keep it too yourself" its a chugging beer. All who rated 10/10 on this poor excuse of an ale are all a bunch of middle aged alcoholics who use the guise of being a sophisticated conisour to be a bunch of drunks but also to cover up the fact that this beer tasted like shit and youre simply conforming to what you preceive as cool thanks to theyre amazing ad compaign.
Fajnie si? rozlewa po gardle, wysoka goryczka, bogaty smak. Kojarzy mi si? z barley wine. Aromat s?odki, owocowy
50cl blik. Helder robijnrood kleur, fijne romige licht bruine schuimkraag. Aroma van karamel en noten. Smaak is zoet, citrus, karamel en noten. Vol Lichaam, Veel koolzuur.

Na samym początku zdziwiła mnie ciemnobursztynowa barwa, spodziewałem się czegoś jaśniejszego. Trochę też zmartwiła bo nie przepadam za karmelem w mocno chmielonych piwach, ale tu zaskoczenie na plus. Wróćmy do aromatu, jest karmel, są cytrusy, dosyć intensywny, przyjemny. Piana skąpa, utrzymująca się. W smaku jest pełne, karmelowe, ale nie słodkie. Goryczka cytrusowa, średnia do wysokiej stanowi przyjemną kontrę do karmelowości. Wysycenie niskie, alkoholu brak. Bardzo fajne piwo, wydaje mi się że karmel tu pasuje przez to że jest konkret goryczkowe, nie jest jak w wielu IPA dodany żeby trochę ugrzecznić piwo tylko stanowi jego podstawę. American Amber Ale to najbardziej zbliżony styl dla tego piwa.
tap. Aroma of nuts, caramel malts, light hoppy and light fruit esters. Beer has got agressive unpleasant bitterness, Imagine that uve got mouth full of aspirine, blee
Zapach przyjemny, slodkawy, karmelowy, lekko palony. W smaku również słodycz, karmel. Bardzo dobre

Aspetto perfetto, ma per il resto mi aspetto di meglio. Gradevole al naso, ma non fa impazzire. In bocca si avverte soprattutto l'amaro e il biscottato, ma poco altro.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
300ml on tap at the RedHot Munich. Aroma is green walnut, malt, light citrus. Appearance is dark brown with a brown foam. Taste is bitter and very light sweet. Dry. Good.

Can. Dark copper, beige head. Nose is caramel, dark dried fruits, toasted malts. Medium body, light carbonation. Taste: medium sweet and medium-high bitter. Burnt sugar, caramel, dried fruits, bitterness. Long dry bitter finish. Good.
The beer has gpt a deep dark brown colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of hops and pine. Taste of hops, pine, spruce, woods, biscuits, grass and citrus. Dry-hoppy finish.

Puszka, barwa rubinowa, gęsta, kremowa piana która utrzymuje się dosyć długo i estetycznie oblepia szkło. Aromat nie jest zbyt intensywny, pachnie tak karmelowo-herbatnikowo, trochę jak bitter. W smaku na początku wyczuwa się dosyć intensywną goryczkę, która dominuje wszystko inne. W tle pałęta się trochę karmelu i jak ja to nazywam "kremowości". Śladów intesywnego chmielenia nie stwierdzono ani w smaku, ani w aromacie. Jest ok, ale nic specjalnego.
Pours dark copper with an off white head. Aroma is citrus, pine and carmel malt. Full bodied with a good sweet and bitter balance. It has every right to be arrogant.

Poured from the 0.5 liter can, Stone Berlin. Hazy brown, immediate boozy aromas upon openning, beige head. Some biscuity notes, hops (but a mixture of floral and little bit of citrus) and booze on the nose. The carbonation is too high in my opinion. When the beer warms and is less carbonated it gets pretty drinkable, like a mix of english ipa with some american hops. The bitterness is more floral than citrussy and not so high quality. Overall the beer is ok but not my style.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 Shared can at Arne & Ulrike?s. Unfortunately almost at best before date, brewed in Berlin. Pours reddish brown with beige head. Aroma of pine needles, sherry, caramel, citrus, cherries. Tastes sweet with a good load of bitterness. Medium bodied, bitter finish.
Clear brown with a medium white head. Aroma is malt, pine and raisin.Taste is hops, caramel and malt

Puszka. Piwo lekko metne w kolorze brazowym nalewa sie z obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana ktora zostawia ladne zdobienia na szkle. W aromacie nuty ziolo-korzenne z domieszka ciemnego chleba. Czuc tez zywice i troche grejpfruta. W smaku orzechy,karmel i troche owocow cytrusowych. Wysycenie i goryczka na srednim poziomie. Polpelne cialo i wyrazny alkohol, raczej nie bede fanem tego piwa.

Puszka z carrefoura. W aromacie zabrakło mi tego co w piwie określa przymiotnik - amerykański. Czyli chmieli. Nieobecne w zapachu za to intensywne w smaku. Jest goryczka cytrusowa. Wyraźna. Ciemna bursztynowa barwa. Nierównomierna ale trwała piana.
floral, clear, brown, white foam, medium bitterness, lively, medium body, dry finish,
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Klares dunkelrot mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, Karamell, Nüsse, leicht fruchtig, Blutorange, harzig, bitter.

Tap at Beer Salon Prague 2017.
Deep amber, lingering head. Aroma herbal. Palate medium, high carbonation. Taste grapefruit, elderflower, bit of harsh earthiness. Long lasting biterness. Not very enjoyed, possibly spoiled keg shipped from overseas.
You read the label and you rated it below 100%, then this beer isnt for you. Go back to your amber piss water!

Amber kleurig boer met een beige kleurige dikke schuimkraag erop.

Aroma: fruitig, karamel

Smaak: fruitig, karamel, moutig, klein beetje alcohol en een bittere afdronk.

Lekker!

Bomber. Ruby color with a brown hue. Light khaki head. Woody, spicy, hoppy aroma and fig maltiness. Strong backbone. Dense malts, everything about this beer seems big. Quite a bit of pine bitterness, cake, brown bread, dark dried fruit. Full body. Bitterness and alcohol in the finish.
0,5l blik van bierwinkel alkmaar. donker bruin met een creme kraag. Tarwe brood en donker en rood fruit. Laurier in de afdronk
In a can - brewed in Berlin. Malty aroma. Appearance, beige/brown head, hazy, dark red colour. A very bitter taste, heavy. A long lasting bitter aftertaste. I have always enjoyed this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 Barwa mahoniowa, piana średnia. Aromat karmelowy, cytrusowy, chmielowy. W smaku słodkawe, tytoniowe, przyprawowe ze świetną, mocną goryczką na koniec. Fajnie wykleja i grzeje gardło. Alko nie wyczuwalne.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa in Rome-Italy. Reddish amber clear, tick ivory foam. Nose: mild notes of mou, rich amber maltiness, a bit caramel. Mouth is East Amber, clean, with a pungent and peppery aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Stone Berlin. Mahogany brown. Nice head. Smells of big caramel, nectar, tropical hops. Medium body. Dry taste. Caramel, nuts. Tropical fruit. Medium bitterness. Very good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours nice in a red amber deep colour with firm head. Nose is very malty with light sweetness and roundness. Taste is very rich, herbal with lots of hops. Bitterness with clear classic notes. Palate is loooong and bitter. Real cool beer.
0,5l can. Pours dark copper with medium sized white head. Toasted caramel malts, strong hoppy piney character. Love the bitterness.

Canette - De couleur brune avec une mousse fauve moyenne qui tient bien - Au nez énormément de houblon, énormément de résine, agrumes, pin, herbacé, caramel, fruits rouge, figue - En bouche toujours autant de houblons, beaucoup de malt, caramel, biscuit, torréfaction, en fin de bouche ca tabasse du houblon, une grosse amertume se développe progressivement - Corp moyen, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, amère et sucrée, final amère et herbacée - Un standart, mais carrément trop

Canned. Pours deep amber with huge beige head. Basically both the aroma and taste are dominated by prominently bitter hops that are underpinned with well balanced sweet malty/caramel notes. On the palate its bittersweet first and laters turns to lingering bitterness. Not an overcomplicated beer, but surely a well made one.

L - Deep amber with a copper head
S - Rich malt and hops with a twinge of booze on the nose 
T - Huge flavors. Similar to the nose with rich, tasty malts and hops - very hoppy. Roasty and toasty with caramel notes with a bit of booze on the back end. Its like a greatest hits of IPA, barleywine, and an amber ale. 
F - Full bodied with medium carbonation - very smooth 
O - All beers from Stone are typically on point but this one is just one of my all time favorites. Its somewhat like an IPA, somewhat like a barelywine, somewhat like an Amber - its near perfect. If Double Bastard didnt exist Id say this was near perfection when it comes to American Strong Ales

Berlin version, 0.5l can. Pours deep dark amber-brown with a big fluffy head. Nose is toasted toffee, a little yeast and spice, distant red fruit, cola and cocoa. Toasty, resinous, slightly sweet and very, very bitter.

Can. Dark ruby to brown, little bit hazy with nice, big, very solid, frothy, white head and good lacing. Reach, sweet malty aroma with some resin, bread and maybe citrus tones. Medium body, roasted in taste with significant bitterness in the finish, sticky and pleasant mouth feel. Its strong in taste and in aroma, its solid, its good!

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 Tap. Deep beautiful amber colour. Small head. Fresh citrus start, heavy great fulfilled body with a slightly higher maltiness than expected from the type. Great balanced, but heavy bitter aftertaste.

50cl can, Geers. Pours dark red / mahogany. Very thick beige head. Large bubbles on top. Nose is hops and cara malts, gives a candy blend. Als cookies in the nose. Aroma of hoppelletcake and bitter biscuits. Taste is only sweet in scent, bitter throughout the rest of it. Slight wood finish or maybe its the cara roast. Its somewhat like an IPA, with the lack of yeast profile/esters and with the bold bitterness. But its less dryhopped and has a malty backbone.
(Berlin version, 1 pint can) imagine a perfect strong lager beer. No extravagancy. Nice head, Nice Color and texture. Hoppy and fruity but not too much. Wunderbar.

50 cl can, brewed in Berlin. Poured in to a Snifter. Dark amber colour with a medium sized, lightly tanned head. Fruity aroma with citrus, resins, caramel malts, toasted notes and pines. Taste is very bitter. Medium to full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with citrus, resin and pines. Nothing but subtle, as the writings on the can also suggests. Rather hopforward, which I like.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Can 500 ml, pours clear dark amber with high beige head. Very flat aroma with some notes of wet paper with hints of honey citrus peel, sweat, some very light fruitiness and resin. In taste very earthy, dry and completely dominated by a long ashy bitterness. Im not sure if the european can version is so much different from the original but this is by far not what I call a good beer.

Poured from a 50cl can at home. Dark brown-amber-red with a bone coloured, frothy head with good lacing. Slightly caramel and smoky malt aroma. Medium to medium-strong bitterness. Mild sweetness. Quite full bodied. Lasting bitterness and smoky aftertaste.

Canned 500ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Marko, thanks. Nice amber/brown coloured, medium sized beige head that stays for a while, light dried fruits in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel, hops, dried fruits and alcohol with touch of herbs and wood in the finish. Good beer but nothing thrilling here.

On tap at Craft Beer Gallery. Dark reddish amber colour, rich aroma full of hops, caramel. Very rich taste - high on bitterness, coffee, hops, blackberries. Long fruity finish. Another magnificent beer.

On tap at B33R Gallery. 
World class you say. Well, its not bad after all. Very bitter and hoppy. Now trying to remember my last double but whatever I think it was not so aggressive. You bloody basrard!

This bastard is a big bold beer full of hops and flavours and has a slightly peppered smoked finish on the palette. This beer is full of itself. It looks down on you and is condescending towards you. You feel intimidated and thats the way he wants it.

Berlin version, 0.5l can, ffrom Ludo, shared with ogivlado. Dry, heavy aroma, woody, some oniony and fruity hoppiness. caramel, initially too dry, gets better as it opens up. Taste... woody, earthy, slightly nutty dry maltiness, a touch of caramel, ashy, herbal hoppiness, onion. Full, well balanced really, but Im not thrilled. Medium bitter finish. I might not be worthy, but this isnt worthy of a rave review from me either, so I guess were even.
Huge Carmel and toffy and nutty kick, lots of tasty bitter hops on the back end. Strong but not overwhelming. This is pretty good stuff!
bomber pours dark brown with tan head aroma is sweet and roasted malt taste follows smooth drinking

Aroma - pleasant and complex, predominantly with caramelized malt, caramel, toffee, chocolate with milk and nuts, honey, some dried fruits, a bit of yeasts. Taste - identical with aroma, with some fresh grounded grains and a log and pleasant bitterness. Very good!

Can from beer52 beer club. Fabulous beer, dark and malty and you can taste the caramel in there. Not as hoppy as I was expecting to find but great nonetheless. Very strong, you know youve had a tin of this!

Can from Wine Rack, Burpham. The EU version. Hops and malts, slightly pungent - not as strong an aroma as I was expecting. A medium chestnut. Light beige head, creamy but it soon recedes. Bitter, but the hops are never over the top. Medium bodied. Oily. A lot of carbonation going on there. Long but restrained finish. I like that warming sensation you get from a beer of this ABV but not really getting much of that. I like it but this mutha is not as up in my face as I was expecting.
This beer is quite hoppy; hoppy in a way that kind of distracts from what else is going on with it. Its good, but its got a dry finish thats almost overstated.

Stone Berlin, puszka, data do 01.04.2017 r. Barwa bursztynowa, zmętnienie dość spore, bardzo ładna, trwała piana, zdobiąca szkło. W aromacie dominuje miód, gdzieś w tle słody, karmel, kwiaty. W smaku bardzo podobnie, jest dość słodko, wszystko kontrowane wysoką goryczką. Bez szału.
World class brew. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma.

Aromas of caramel, toffee, slight pine and lemon citrus. Taste is as it smells: caramel, toffee, lemon. Although, a stronger grapefruit rind presence builds as it travels down the tongue; and pine notes appear in the finish and after taste as well.

can @ home
clear brown, cappuccino head
cream, butterscotch, spices, nutmeg, clows, liquour, hops
bitter, caramel, herbaceous, dry hoppy bitter finish
very drinkable

Somehow Ive never rated this one, though Ive had it several times over the past 15 years or so. Anyway, Heavy malty nose, medium roast, herbs, berries, tree bark, and light smoke. Dark amber/brown color, with a large rocky head and very thick, sticky lace. Roast malt, tangy and piney, caramel, quite herbal, tiny bit of smoke, and moderate back-end bitterness. Medium body. Very tasty.

Keg Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2009, Parsons Green, London in July 2009 - Mahogany Red in colour. Aggressively hopped; citrus piney oily hops. Solid malts; roasty malty, caramel, toffee. Fruity; citrus. Sweetish throughout with a bitter hoppy finish. (2009-07)

0,5 l can (From the Berlin Brewery) shared.
Appearance:Clear brown body ,with a rough creamy white head. 
Aroma: Hughe, a lot malt, caramel, toffee, witha lot of pine and resin, some fruity tones.Taste: Is moderate sweet and heavy bitter while still finding a balance. Allmost full body, average carbonation.

Quality ? Yes..
Depth ?, Hmm, Imho I would say no, because this is one big power house.Going in agressive and hard, but lacking the nuances to make it really great. Still for people who are all for richness and still drinkable this is one beer to get.

Can 0,5 l. I have no idea if really produced in California as I bougth it in the supermarekt in Warsaw, Poand. The beer is unfortunatelly very dissapointing. Not really interesting beer. Just strong bitterness, moldy and caramel aroma and taste. Too long bitter finish. Once again: dissapointing.
Nice and strong American Ale. Really bitter but it fits perfectly to the citrus and caramel notes. Enjoyed it but you have to be in the mud to drink it

50 cl Berlin can. Dark, deep red colour with a good off-white head. Aromas of toffee, sweet bread, malts, alcohol, grass. Flavour and palate are pretty straight-forward, low carbonation with fairly strong bitterness all throughout. Flavours are not very distinct, overpowered by the bitterness. Good malty body, but cant find much else. Overall quite good, the right kind of sweet aroma, a little too bitter in the style for my taste, but the malty body makes up for it a bit.

Poured from a pint can into a tulip glass. The beer is a nice dark brown red that lets you know you are in for a hoppy ride. The smell is perhaps the weakest aspect of this classic beer. It doesnt give you much to work with and is pretty indistinct. Tastewise this doesnt quite seem like the facepunch of hops that it felt like 10+ years ago, but it is still a tasty combo of hops with a malty backbone. Overall, this is a classic beer that I have enjoyed for many years and still pick up semi-regularly. I like that it is available in cans now, too!
50cl can. Hazy brown amber with a small tan head. Caramel, citrus and light piny. Nice.
Malty in the nose. Pours brown amber. Malty bready taste gives way to hoppy bitterness that lingers. Overall very palateable.

Can. Amber color, medium white head. Aroma is hoppy, zesty and piney, light citrusy with floral notes. Taste starts malty, light caramely, zest and pines, decent citrusy and floral with long hoppy finish

0.5l can. Hopy aroma, pine, flowers. Clear copper color, pale beige head. Hopy taste malty notes, pine, floral notes, high, but pleasant bitter. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and dry, bitter finish. Very good.

A most fitting inauguration beer. Heres to you Donald, may your reign be short and forgettable! Malty, sweet and strong aroma of dark dried fruits, lightly roasted malt and caramel, with some brown sugar in the back. The flavour is surprisingly hoppy, with distinct notes of grapefruit and even some grass that easily balances the dark dried fruits and caramel. Also hints of spices in the back. Moderate sweet taste with a rather heavy bitter finish. Medium body, smooth and dry texture and fairly soft carbonation. This arrogant bastard is a nice one (as opposed the other arrogant bastard that is currently polluting my TV screen).
[50 cl can, enjoyed 7 months after canning, trade with an Untappd dude]

Can 0,5.
Brown color, hazy. Aroma: caramel, nuts, dark berries. Taste: bitter start, hoppy, quite strong ABV feels, long bitter finish. Good beer.

Vierte ámbar oscuro con media cabeza de espuma beige de larga retención; aromas a malta tostada, caramelo, fruta madura, lúpulo, resina y licor, en boca entrada potente, maltosa y ligeramente amarga y muy seca, notas terrosas y a resina, largo retrogusto, maltoso, amargo y seco, cuerpo medio y correcto carbónico, cerveza con carácter que puede gustar o no, el lúpulo está equilibrado con la malta.
Can from Liquor Barn. Lots of piny hop and malt aroma. Very aggressive as stated.

Cerveza color ámbar rojizo. Aromas de predominio cítrico, con toques acaramelados. Al paladar se perciben lúpulos cítricos, con un poco de toque a caramelo con el retrogusto amargo característico de esta cervecería, el cual perdura unos minutos. Excelente cerveza. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Pivný raj. Clear Amber colour, Light beige head. Aroma is piny, resiny hops, caramel and some roasty malty notes. Taste is piny hops, caramel, malts. Hops and Very high bitterness in aftertaste. Pleasant carbonation. Good.

Can from Berlin - BB May 2017. Malty aroma of dark fruits. So flat in taste... some grass, some herbs, tea (?), earth and nothing much more. Bitter, disturbing aftertaste. Huge disappointment. What the fuck with this legendary ale???

Can. Dark amber, large tan head. Aroma earthy, malts, caramel, hints if grass and citrus. Medium full body. Taste mainly hoppy with subtle sweet caramel tones. Bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Très agressive - comme son nom lindique - une expérience originale au demeurant.
Malty, heavy aroma with some hoppy resin notes. Heavy herbal and resin bitterness. Felt some disappointment after tasting. Well its a Bastard.

Stone Berlin. Puszka 500ml. Barwa rubinowa, piwo opalizujące. Piana bardzo obfita, zbita, kremowa w kolorze beżowym. Wygląda pięknie. Aromat jest bardzo ciekawy. Ciemne owoce, rodzynki - przypomina belgijskiego quadrupla. Do tego dochodzi fajna chmielowość: żywica, igły sosnowe. Na słodko. Piwo w smaku jest również bardzo ciekawe, są rodzynki, ciemne owoce, karmel i chmiel. Za tym idzie konkretna goryczka, grejpfrutowo-żywiczna. Wysoka i przyjemna. Piwo bardzo ciekawe, warte sprobowania.

WoW an Arrogant Bastard just popped up right in front of me. And a big waring on the can that I might not like this. Ha ha it is surely a solid lovely brew. Everyone likes this.A really lovely clear mahogany color with a fine tan head. Looks good and inviting. Fine lacing also. Quite moderate intensity in the aroma. Mostly caramel malt in the nose. Not that inviting. Medium + body and a fine carbonation level. Easy to drink. Not enough sweetness to back up the bitterness. A bit unbalanced actually. Caramel bomb de lux. It actually kills the grapefruit hoppy goodies almost completely. Not good. Also some dried fruit in the flavor.The warning was right. I did not like this.[Can from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge in Oslo, Norway]

Can from Salt Horse. Murky ruby body with a dense beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of caramel and earth. Flavour of cranberry, stewed tea and a bitter finish. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Mega hoppy - which I normally love - but I found this beer to be, frankly, quite boring. I expected much more based on previous reviews.
Pours a dark caramel color. Aroma has some wood and toffee notes. Taste has caramel, dark fruits and some booze. Strong hop presence as well. Lingering bitterness. Very complex, very tasty
Plechovka, silné výborné pivo. Greg Koch umí, můj první kousek, ale zaujal.
Rødbrun klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter tørket frukt, karamell og korn. Mye bitterhet. Grape og sitrusskall, noe brent karamell. Middels lang.

Pours dark ruby colour with full beige head. Aroma is caramel and hops. Taste is, appropriately, bitter from the start. Notes of caramel and citrus, lots of grassy, fruity hops with a bit of malt cutting through. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. Not an overly complex taste, but its jammed full of flavour.

16/20 really interesting taste with bitterness and citrus. Really malty too. Smooth. Good alcohol hit

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy, brown. pours brown head. Aroma: wooden, malt, caramel, and maybe some citra hops. Taste: oak, caramel,malt, brown sugar, medium sweet, medium bitter. Palate: medium to full body. Overall: its very good :)

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2017 Can. Opaque brown with a nice tan head with ample lacing. Malty aroma with flavors of caramel, dark fruits and brown sugar. It is like a good Belgian Quad with the extra bitterness of an American IPA.

Poured from a 16 ounce can. This was a gusher, really Stone? Lame. Pours clear amber/brown with a tan head. This is a malty strong beer. The alcohol is noticeable and warming. The hop bitterness is firm and helps clear away the maltiness. The bitterness lingers.

Mørk brunrød farge med litt kremete Lys beige skum. Lukter av humle/grape, krydder, sødme og karamell. Medium fylde og medium karbonert. Smaker sødme samtidig sitrus/grape smak. Bitter avslutning. God:-)
Nice fruity hop aroma, amber and really clear. Malty hoppy a little sweet on mouth. Intense hop finish. A great beer
Can. Pours mahogany Brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, plums, syrup, hops and brown sugar. Taste of hops, dark fruits, caramel, grains and slight citrus.
Tapp. Mørk brun farge, moderat karbonert med fyldig skumtopp. Smaker karamell mørk frukt sitrus

Can, Berlin version. Nice, ruby colour, caramel, dried fruit, plums, ripe apples, subtle and spicy hoppy notes, a hint of cinnamon, and a rough, unpleasant bitterness that makes the beer fall out of balance. Interesting stuff, were it not for the bitterness.

Can. Brown with huge pale brown head. I wasn´t very impressed with this, for sure an agressive beer but lacks complexity. Aroma mainly malt caramel, not much hopps. The bb data was 04.2017 I wonder if it was a bit old, but I´ve just bought it. Taste dry and bitter with a good malty bode.Bitter finish.

Color marrón oscuro, con reflejos rojizos, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). No mucha carbonatación. Ahora maltoso y resinoso, muy profundo. El sabor soy incapaz de definirlo, me parece un despropósito de elementos que no soy capaz de discernir. Según entra parece dulce, con notas de café, después se nota algo más lupulada y alcohólica; y una vez ya tragada, llega el amargor, in crescendo entre trago y trago. Lo más reseñable, aparte de su impecable aspecto, es eso, el amargor. Y, aun asi, no me convence del todo, porque es tan fuerte que inhibe mi paladar y no me permite saborear nada a partir del tercer o cuatro trago ¿Es una birra agresiva? Sí. Y no me gusta. No creo que haya que ser sofisticado para disfrutarla, más bien lo contrario. Ruda, extraña, pretenciosa y lejos de las expectativas creadas, pero, ¡eh!, esto me pasa casi a diario y parece que a todo el mundo le gusta. So, try it.

Can. Stone Berlin. Thick brownish red. Small but nice and lasting head. The strong aroma of malts bursts out of the can and immediately makes me wanna drink a scotch single malt...malts, dark berries, malts, hops. honey and more malts. Taste is fruity, malty and bitter piney hops. Caramell, raisins, honey and grapefruits. Theres a hint of sweetness beneath the hops overload. Highly carbonated. The aftertaste is extremely bitter and seems to last forever. A very aggressive and equally impressive beer. Complex and full of BAM! I love it but the beer snob elite marketing is childish.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Caramel and citrus fruitiness. Clear brown with a cream head. Rather bitter with a lot of caramel present over the citric bitterness of a grapefruit on the finish the pine kicks in. Well made IIPA but I was expecting more from this legendary beer.
Densa, color oxido, malteada, muchas notas de regaliz y poco se nota su elevado alcohol, muy rica

Almost a chocolate licorice roasted malt aroma with piney hop finish. Taste is a malt bomb, but not sticky palate, with piney bitter hop balance. Finish is bitter dry piney. This is a full flavored beer with some great flavors, but the bitter hops overpower. It is good, and aggressive is what they are going for, but it is not the most hoppy beer, just very hoppy on the piney bitter side of the spectrum.

Murky ruby color with a smallish tan, dissipating head. Very little lacing. Aroma is fruity hops and at the same time malty. Resin, caramel and cheese. Taste is medium bitter which evolves towards the end. Resin, dark fruits, a bit vinous, notes of cough syrup and spices. Medium body, medium carbonation, long bitter finish. An interesting beer.

(can, 50cl) Hazy, ruby colour with a firm and mid-sized tanned foamy head. Earthy and mildly fruity hops with shades of resin, accompanied by mildly nutty and sugary malty accents, caramel and yeasty notes. Quite bitter and slightly sweet flavour, full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Dark and nutty cara-malt character with earthy hoppy notes, spruce and pine as well as subtle fruity notes; bitter hoppy and mildly sweet finish with lingering earthy and piney hops, hints of caramel in the aftertaste. Well-embedded alcoholic strength. Superb. 03.XII.16

Can. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Almost as good as expected, and I expected a lot.....World class brew.

Can
Aroma-fruits, citrus
Appearance-amber, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

650ml bomber. Pours clear dark ruby/chestnut brown with a big foamy tan head. Aroma: sweet dark fruity malt, caramel. Taste: rich, sweet, dark fruits, caramel, toffee, plum, a little warming alcohol, pine. Slightly bitter finish. Medium body, low carbonation. Silky smooth. Really nice.

Kolor: Mahoń, klarowne. 
Piana: Obfita, oblepia szkło, długo się utrzymuje.
Zapach: Karmel, zioła. Przyjemny, klasyczny.
Smak: Pełne, karmelowe. Goryczka wysoka, ostra, tytoniowa, zostająca długo ale przyjemna.
Wysycenie: Średnie, OK.
Opakowanie: Przyciągająca wzrok etykieta, niedokładny skład. 
Uwagi: Warka 17.04.17 Klasyczne angielskie ale z wysoką goryczką.

Berlin canned version. Hazy brownish color with off-white head. Aroma has some caramel, orange, nutty malt and earthy hops. Taste is also nutty with some earthy hops on the finish. Medium body, quite smooth on the palate. Overall its quite good and easy to drink for its ABV.
Ganz schön arrogant im Glas, in der Nase Malz und Frucht, soweit schonmal sehr lecker. Im Trunk alkoholisch, leichte Süße, Karamell. Im Abgang langer alkoholischer Nachklang, nussig, holzig.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2016 Can, Stone Berlin: great artwork. Chestnut brown, beige head. Roasted malty caramel and espresso and aggressively bitter, tropical fruity and resinous hops, clove, nutmeg, earthy, dry, a tat herbal/liquorice. Good body, lively carbonation.

amber met witte kraag. aroma van caramel, hoppig, toffee, geroosterd. Smaken zijn zwak zoet, mout, geroosterde mouten, caramel, donker fruit, gras, iets droge afdronk, den, medium body, zachte co2, ok

500ml can from House of trembling Madness, York. Deep ruby brown with a dense tan head. Aroma of bread and walnuts. Banana bread, nuts and spice flavour. Bitter on the tongue. Silky palate astringent finish. Pleasant enough, but I wanted to REALLY like this, and was a bit underwhelmed.

Hard to find fresh in T. but when you do, drink it. Still a classic and has not disappointed. Big bitter bite with big malt and rich nutty body. Mild spice and bread aromas deceive the big bite in the finish.

Can 50 cl. Pours a clear red to opaque with a medium yellowish off-white head and an aroma of roasted malts, lemon, toffee, syrup, dried plums, earth, dried leaves, alcohol, cloves, grassy hops, coffee and pine. The taste is medium sweet with a long bitter, coffee like finish. I do like it!
A well balanced double IPA with citrus and resinous hops. Medium body with slight bread character. Excellent brew.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Opaque, dark amber brown color with a tanned, dense foam head. Aroma is heavy hops, mainly citrus, some floral. Huge malts presence in the aroma. Flavor is moderated sweet, with a powerful and really long bitter end. Body is medium, texture is oily, average carbonation.
Can from mchughs. Pours tea brown with thin foam head. Aroma is spice, pine, dough, tea, wood, earth. Flavour is is a earthy caramel with a dry spiced alcohol finish.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 500 ml can. Clear dark red beer, firm beige head, some of it lasting long. Aroma is caramel, grass, pine, grapefruit and hints of dark fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter, caramel, grapefruit, leading to a grassy, long bitter finish. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Yes, this is an aggressive beer.

Nice marketing :) Ruby with little brown head. Aroma of aroma hops (Citra?), that is Papaya, some other tropic fruit, caramel, a little roast and wax, brown sugar, maybe even mocha or coffee. Taste is lots of everything, spicy pepper, hop bitterness, dark chocolate bitterness, not much sweetness though. Finish is like after a cup of coffee, with some additional sour fruity stuff. Light and watery on the tongue. Medium body. Not so heavy actually. Complex and deep. Not bad.

Can at home. Pours a hazy deep mahogany colour and a big beige head. Aroma of pine, oak, wild berries, chocolate, spices, dried fruit, ammonia and grass. The flavour has more hops with grapefruit, pine, grass and some chocolate and wild berries. A little dry in the end. Has a slick mouth feel, medium to heavy body, and solid bitterness. A pretty hoppy and powerful ale, and the aroma is more complex than the flavour.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 Tap. Pours brown with lazing tan head. Aroma has malt, grain, straw, caramel and nutty notes and a grassy hoppiness with hints of pine. Taste is malty with dark malts, grain and straw, caramel, walnuts and is hoppy with grass and notes of pine. Finish is malty, hoppy and quite bitter.

Halve liter blik van craft beer winkel in Lobberich. Donkerbruinrode kleur
Ruikt vooral moutig maar ook wat citrusfruitigs. Smaak is bitterhoppig met een flinke mout bijsmaak. Bittere afdronk. Gebalanceerd.

Bottle. Hazy, brown. Medium light brown head. Aroma has oak, honey, malt and citrus. 

Taste has malt, pine, citrus, oak, caramel, brown sugar. Layered with interesting tastes. Smooth. Proper aftertaste.
Caramel, pine, grapefruit, maybe some passion fruit, a very strong character that has a great palate, just legendary.

Color marrone con riflessi aranciati, schiuma beige fine non abbondante e nemmeno troppo persistente. Al naso sentori maltati e terrosi, leggermente agrumati ed erbacei. Corpo pieno e pulito, carbonazione nella media. Al palato entra subito decisa con lamaro che quasi soffoca le papille. intensità di aromi che virano verso lerbaceo pesantemente e verso il terroso. Il biscottato contrasta a tratti questa sensazione.

Caramel and alcohol, reddish amber with a good ocher head, medium body, medium carbonation, intense but elegant bitterness that remains for few minutes...probably not so bitter like the original version but a very bastard ale.

Can, brewed in Berlin. Stunned this is not rated. Nose is malt, yeast, toffee, herbal hops, sweet tropical note, hint of vanilla. Taste is malt, toffee, rye, caramel, bread, leading to a bitter grapefruit, pith and herbal, pine hop note. Mouthfeel is exceptionally smooth. I rarely bother commenting on appearance, but this is a beautiful beer, deep amber, chestnut with a pillow head. Its not my favourite style but an exceptional example, though I always slightly wish I was drinking a BA version.
Mørkt, herlig øl med fint skum. Dufter sterkt av kaffe, lakris og mørke Bær. Fruktig smak med sterk bitterhet sammen med kaffen. Tommel opp.

Nice dark ruby red hue, slight creamy tan foam. Aroma is a bit malty - caramel, brown sugar, cherry, plum. Taste is also malty with bready notes and sweet to start and dry to finish. Notes of vanilla, black cherry, caramel, rye toast. Assertively bitter. Theres a somewhat of a cough syrup taste in the finish, but beyond that, this is exceptional.

Can 0,5ltr: Dark brown colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of caramel, grapefruit, oranges, honey and pine. On the legendary list too, this one from California (Its really from Aberdeenshire, Scotland).

Dark, caramely brown in colour with thick brownish head. Sweet, hoppy and smoky on the nose. Initially very bitter taste, followed by smokiness, then bitter sweet on the end. Also quite carbonated. Big, tasty bastard of a beer.

Very acceptable aroma and a delightful deep rusty orange amber appearance. Carbonation is perfect and this one slides down the pipes quite easily. I was very pleased with this one and found myself wondering exactly why I hadnt had it before now....Proof my tastes are being honed and changing as well...upon researching, I found I had this one a year or so ago before I was rating here. I sure wouldnt have given it a fair shake then so it worked out well because its def a brew that will be in my glass often after this tasty experience.
1pt bottle. Dark reddish brown with a beige head. The aroma is sweet caramel and syrup. The taste is heavy sweet, syrupy and medium bitter. Piny hops. Over rated and priced.

50cl can. Dark red brown color, thick head. Earthy hop aroma, toffee and dark caramel (kind of like a beefed up ESP?). More citrus and bitter hop resin in the flavor, nice maltiness. A great beer all around.
Deep copper pour with a tan head.Flavour is rich caramel malt, citrus, pine. Lingering pithy bitterness. Great stuff.

On tap @ Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours mahogany, with a big creamy, off white head. Aroma is hoppy notes, with resin and citrusy notes of orange peel and grapefruit, as well as roasted malts with bread and honey. Medium body, with soft to average carbonation. Flavour is bitter, with resin, citrusy orange peel and grapefruit, as well as malts with cereals and toffee. Lingering bitter finish. Balanced and quaffable.
Bottle. Pours an amber colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, pine, some hops. Taste is similar, some spices and herbs.
First arrogant bastard Ive drinken in a long time. Very happy about how delicious it is.

On can. Pours an amber-reddish colour, with a big off white head. Medium retention and a good lace. Aroma of wood, caramel, pine, spices, quinine, hops. Medium body, with a great carbonation and astringent texture. Taste of caramel, spices, herbs, resines, quinine. AStringent finish. Aggresive and great beer.

16 oz can. Pours deep mahogany with a huge tan head that lingers leaving huge lacing. Aroma of overripe fruit, sweet malt and a hint of cinammon. Fruity, sweet malt flavor, quickly giving way to long, herby and piney hops linger, leaving tongue a bit numb. Thick and oily mouthfeel with lots of warm alcohol linger. Overall, liking the balance. Not as aromatic, but good malt to hop profile.

500ml can from Brewdog shop.
Big off white head, good retention, good lacing. Hazy dark amber body. Woody nose, raisin, brown sugar, a little honey. Flavour is sweet malt, biscuit, dark fruits, hop bitterness follows and lasts well. Great mouthfeel, creamy, oily and a little sticky. Like a big bastard supercharged brown ale.

No detail information about the malts, hops and drinktemperature on the can but an awesome story.
Red brown beer with cappuccino head, heavy bitter with a long finish, after a short time you can smell the hops and very light also the malts, light bread, creamy, full body,
(I have the Berlin version with best-before 13.03.2017 and produced 16.06.2016)

0,5 l can, Berlin version. Bright red brown in the glass, big light tanned head. Looking really good. Sweet malt and fruity on the nose. Taste starts with an all overlasting bitterness. Different taste more in the background. Also alcoholic bitterness. Little bit sticky. Boring due to the bitterness. Expected wayyyy more.

CAN 50 CL by Stone Berlin. Almost clear dark ruby-brown, nice beige head. The aroma has faint notes of caramel, more dark bread, very light roast. Traces of hops, and a hint of sweet cheese pie. Taste: just an impression of caramel, bready. The strong spicy bitterness - hoppy and slightly roasty - makes it feel dry and easy-drinkig. Light boozy notes just add to the spiciness. Silky smooth and easy-drinkig. Very good.

Can from Berlin. Aroma rich in malts, with some bread, cherry accompanied by hoppy notes (fruity and herbal). A little bit of alcohol when warmed up. High bitterness, medium sweetness. Nice,fruity aftertaste. Not bad overall - would have been better produced in smaller can.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 W aromacie kwiaty, ciemne owoce, rodzynki, fenole, troszkę po belgijsku, słodko, bardzo przyjemnie. W wyglądzie rubinowe z gęstą, beżową pianą. Smak bogaty, z jednej strony ciemnych owoców, fig, rodzynek, przypominający triple, z drugiej chmielowa kontra w postaci ostrej grejpfrutowej goryczki, cytrusowości, ale takiej gorzkiej. Fajne połączenie szkół belgisjkiej i amerykańskiej. Finisz drożdżowy, zbożowy, karmelowy. Gdzieś tam w tle wyczuwalne akcenty z mocnych, słodowych piw. Czarna puszka idealnie pasuje do tego trunku. Ogólnie solidny amerykański strong ale, ciekawy, dość pijalny i ostry. Niezłe piwo.

Can at Cafe Sara, june 28th 2016. Brown body with an offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, earth and pine. Strong bitterness, grass, caramel in taste, with a very light flowery note, sticky body with a bready and grassy finish.

Pours clear deep amber/Brown with good beige head. Aromas of bread, honey and hint of herbal spice and Raisins. Good carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is malty and molasses with hint of citrus zest and pepper. Finish is medium sweet and nice bitter hit.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a clean dark amber/mahogany color with a finger of fluffy tan head of foam. On the aroma there is toast, caramel and toffee malt. The taste is full of toast, roast, toffee and caramel malts with a little bit of rye in the mix. The finish is fresh cedar and pine. Very woody and dry.

Hatalmas bézs, tartós hab, barna szín. Illata enyhe, némi karamell és fűszerek. Karamell, pici pörkölt maláta, fűszerek ízei érezhetők, hosszú lecsengéssel. Selymes, közepesen testes és szénsavas, erősen keserű. Jól felépített, izgalmas sör.

Couleur brune, forte mousse cremeuse. Nez houblonné résineux et caramel brun. Gout houblonné résineux avec caramel brun, malt, note menthe sauvage, reglisse sauvage. Corps moyen. Bonne amertume agrume pamplemousse, herbes en fin de bouche.

Ciężko mi ocenić je obiektywnie. Z jednej strony mamy przyjemny aromat i świetny wygląd, a z drugiej ciężki, wytrwany smak, który mnie akurat drażni w tym piwie. Chyba taki był zamysł piwowara. Cóż, piwo ok, ale raczej do niego nie wrócę...

Can from Hops & Crafts Exeter( Stone Berlin canned 21/07/17). Pours clear deep Amber with a 3 finger light beige head . Aroma f Amber malt,biscuit ,berries ,pine & hop resin,plus some caramel. Taste is malty ,caramel ,piney hop,biscuit,red berries,initially sweet but bitterness quickly kicking in with some citrus & warming alcohol. Medium bodied & smooth great mouth covering mouth feel .the finish is malty,caramelly,biscuity ,piney ,hop fruity with good bitterness & some dryness.

Can, pours dark amber with a cream head. Quite hoppy with pine, resin and some fruity notes, caramel, toffee. Because of the aggressive bittering its kind of hard for the flavours to make a difference. Basically, its aggressively bittered and behind the great wall of bitterness theres just an ok tasting beer to make out. Its not bad, but somehow this beer is lost on me (ie. I dont understand the continuous stream of rave reviews)
This hit the spot. Caramel color. Dried fruit, cedar, pine aroma and flavor. Big piney hop bite with some great toasted malt.

Deep orange with a medium yellow head. No lacing. Astringent and dry aroma with wood, motor-oil, orange, honny. Bitter taste of quinine, licorine, caramel and orange. Aftertaste of apples and dry apricot that lingers.

Canned, 0.5 l.
Opal reddish brown colour, creamy stabile beige head, which laces.
Fruity nose.
Taste of dark fruits and grapefruit, aroma brings caramel, toast, resin, and citrusses, mouthfeel is syrupy.
Lingering and warming, bittersweet, hoppy finish.
Enjoyable.
Great Ale. Really nice aroma of American hops with great bitter taste. Really drinkable despite high alcohol volume. Definitely will try again.

Can, bought @Beershoppen, Kolding. Pours clear dark golden to amber with a medium, staying, creamy White head. Aroma has caramel, malty bitterness, grass, sweetness. Medium carbonation, fine dry and creamy, Flavour has okay initial sweetness, does feel a tad sugary, toasted caramel. Bitterness is heavy and kinda comes off as a tad harsh. Still good though.

Lovely dark ruby red hue, slight creamy tan membrane of foam. Aroma is deep and malty - caramel, brown sugar, cherry, plum. Taste is malty, bready, sweet to start and dry to finish. Notes of vanilla, black cherry, caramel, rye toast. Assertively bitter. Theres a mild cough-syrup impression in the finish, but beyond that, this is exceptional.
Can. Wonderful beer. This is the standard to which you should compare all ales or pale ales: if its better, its really good.

Bursztynowo czerwone. Piana drobna, obfita, bursztynowa. 
Aromat gorzkawy, lekko ziołowy. 
Dość przyjemny
W smaku gorzkawe, lekko alkoholowe. Ale nie narzuca się. 
Gorzkawy posmak. 
Ciekawe, ale spodziewałem się czegoś więcej.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 A friendly 22 oz. brown bottle from Albertsons joined me for this rating. ABA (which I nickname ODB) is my go-to for a cost-conscious top level ale. Great presence, just the right head for nice lacing on my tall glass stein. Really a nice nutty opening taste along with some smoke, lingers for awhile. Pine, resiny, perhaps a hint of chocolate. Complex. ABA does not slam you with a flavor jolt, just really tasty. At 7.2% ABA is elevated but does not kick your rear end. Probably my favorite right now next to some Belgians. I always try to have a bottle on hand cause you just dont know. Oh yeah.

Uit 50cl blik. Amber van kleur, crème kleurige schuimkraag die lang blijft, troebel....ziet er dik en rijk uit.....koolzuur is lastig te zien.
Aroma: Duidelijk rijkelijk moutig, brood/ biscuit, grapefruit, pijnboom, hoppy, aarde, grassig en een karamel hint.
Smaak: Grapefruit, ananas, perzik, juice, volle hopbitter, pijnboom en harsachtig......een behoorlijke IPA kant aan deze Strong Ale.
Daarnaast vol moutig (geroosterd), karamel, erg dik en Juicy en wat kruidig en netelig/floraal. Ook een lichte alcohol warmte is merkbaar. 
Body is vol, mondgevoel is zacht, romig en dik,  afdronk is lang bitter en droog.
KLASSE Ale van Stone Berlin! En de tekst is ook erg grappig :-)

Deep ruby color with a tan head. Strong aroma of malts, caramel, pine and hops. Complex taste of malts, oak, dried dark fruit, lacks the touch of hops, though. Full oily body, medium carbonation, medium to long finish, definitely dry, heavy bitterness. A strong ale indeed.
Can at home. Pours dark amber with large off-white head. Aroma is mild malts. Taste is malts, oak and american hops. Medium long finish. Medium carbonation. Really nice ale.

Looks great dark bronze with bubbily tan head. Strong atoma of noble hops and caramel malts. Strong bitter flavor like a pils on steroids. Heavy brew but mostly just the dry hearty bitterness and not much else. I prefer the barrel aged versions which are more complex and woody. Long dry bitter palate. A San Marcos classic for sure, but after all these years I discovered this kind of deep pine hxc bitterness (not sure what type of hops it is) isnt really my fav, but still a nice bold beer.

Pours a deep amber with a modest creamy head. Malty aroma with caramel, citrus and pine needles. Full body, oily feel, average carbonation. Taste kicks off with lots of bitterness from grapefruit, coffee, roasted malt and some marzipan. Loooong and hoppy finish.

Deep ruby red color. Medium carbonation. Malt dominated aroma with some caramel, light chocolate, and some piney hop smells. Nice balance of flavor. Deep and malty, chocolatey, with some sharp citrus hop notes to cut through. Good beer.

Aroma; brown malts, milky hops (?), fermented milk chocolate or something, dough - hmm, very special. Look; brown, beige resistant head. Taste; hops, roasted malts, dark caramel, black chocolate, solid portion bitter fruits - leading to a solid hoppy finish with black bitter chocolate. Feel; ok, solid, straight to it. Overall; yes, its a strong ale. [50cl.can 7.2% BB.06MAR17, brewed in D, Stone Brewing Berlin &german barcode]

heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter, full body, This was just a quick grab for me at the store and I guess Im really not worthy. For me, Its like a shot of expensive liquor: you can tell its really good but it wasnt enjoyable. lol The aftertaste was great though!

This is an epic brew. Outstanding malty bitterness with a superb dominating aroma. A solid head and an excellent mouthfeel. Like almost an IPA with a serious maltiness to it, hmm, maybe more the ale than the IPA, hard to quite work out which dominates. Excellent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

German version. Deep copper, medium lasting beige head. Aroma if caramel, grapefruits, slightly piney. Flavours of caramel, strong bitter backones that comes right away. Grapefruites, other citrus, piney. Long verry bitter bone dry finish. Quite pungent. I would have like a hoppier nose. It's a 3 month old can always kept in a fridge so the aroma might be weaker. It probably was crazy in 1997, kinda feel outdated.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very inviting with its dark red amber color and the tan creamy head. The aroma is full of sweet malts and dried red berries, not hoppy as expected. Way better and rich in the nose than in mouth though.
Well balanced and drinkable, the bitter is strong but not too aggressive or overpowering.
On tap. Clear amber with tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, bread, heavy hoppy. Sweet caramel flavour, berries, herbal hoppy bitter finish
Aroma has richness of malts, caramel, wood and some fruits. Taste has strong malts,caramel, some roasted and some herbs. A bitter and slight harsh ending. Good,

[Can. German edition] Aroma is dominated by caramel and some roasted malts with earthiness in the background. Reddish amber in the glass with sparkling structure. Tan foam, good lacing. The long bitterness settles on the palate. Dried fruits and coffee cherries at the finish. Really disappointing.
Dit is een straf bier, maar dat belooft het zelf al op het blik. Aroma: koffie en zuidvruchten. Smaak: hoog bittergehalte en wat rook. Ook een aangename zoete fruitige laag.

Can at csakajo. Dark reddish amber/mahagony colour with a small white fast disscipating head. Nose is soy saucy, light molasses. Taste is medium bitterness that turns into a high lingering bitterness. Nice hoppy red ale.
Heard a lot so had to give it a go and wow, Massive from every angle, Sweetness on the nose, and big rich complex mouth feel with a long bitter finish. Not for a wussie :-)

Aus der Büchse getrunken (gekauft von Stone (Berlin)). Dunkles trübes Kupfer im Glas. Schöner stabiler Schaum. In der Nase noch zurückhaltend. Aber dann.... Hopfenbombe ohnegleichen und anhaltende Restbittre. Ein sehr anspruchsvolles, knackiges IPA.
Tap at lexpress de lyon in Paris. Strong and quite bitter beer but suprisingly medium bodied. Coffee and roasted malt flavors mixed with dry fruits and a touch of nuts

Bomber pours a cloudy dark amber with a one finger beige head and abundant lacing. Aroma is grassy, earthy, caramel sweetness. Flavor is primarily chocolate and coffee. Leaves a bitter aftertaste that lingers. This ones OK but not really my thing.

Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, bread and a hint of berries and and nuts. Brown with a tan head. Medium + sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with a soft carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Overall an interesting Strong Ale, enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Tap at Stone Berlin. Pours dark amber brown with full tan and creamy head. Fruity and spicy notes, hints of lemon and yeast. Distinctive, but hard to pin down. Medium bitter taste that get stronger in the finish and is balanced by a pleasent grounding sweetness. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a rather sparkling mouthfeel. Flavor has some fruity, grapefruit and citrus notes and a spicy peppery finish, light touch of caramel and cookies. However the bitterness is dominating the flavor, that remains somewhat hidden and difficult to grab, but nevertheless hints of its complexity. Warm and bitter dry finish with a medium strong bitter and lasting aftertaste. Intense and bold as promised but with a mysterious core.

Bouteille datée du 28/04/2016, bue après un peu moins de 5 mois et avec un BB du 27/07/2016... Robe brune-orangée plutôt claire surmonté dun léger col de mousse blanchâtre. Arômes de malt caramélisé, houblons herbacés et francs, zestes dagrumes, cassonade. En bouche, houblons secs, cassonade brûlé, malt caramelisé et grillé. Finale amère et herbacée. Texture légèrement huileuse et corps mince à moyen. Manque de fraîcheur assuré.

Pours clear dark brown with tan head. Bready, caramel, dried fruits, hoppy, citrus. Very bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from Real Ale Newark. Deep ruby colour with a tan head. Aroma is sweet nutty, spice, bread and caramel. Taste is only light sweet initially with a big and lasting bitter finish.

Can 500ml. Brewed in Berlin. Zadna wielka rewelacja, owszem piwo wyraziste w smaku cos miedzy belgijskim mocnym Ale a imperialnym podwojnym IPA. Pachnie chmielem amerykanskim, chyba to Amarillo. W smaku gorzkie bardzo wytrawne i zalegajace w ustach, W smaku jest sporo slodyczy, glownie lukrecja i kukulka. Kolor czerwony z kremowa i spora piana, ale opadajaca bardzo szytbko. Piwo jest alkoholowe, wiec ci Aroganci nie postarali sie aby go chociaz troche ukryc.
Pours dark reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma is vanilla, dark fruits,dark grains, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is heavy bitter and lightly sweet.

Pours redish brown with a moderate white head. Hoppy, sweet, caramel aroma. Flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with note of caramel, hops, alchool. Dry, heavy bitter aftertaste. Really nice!

kindly given by bartlebier, thanks a lot! A beer you almost cant help but like, with its entertainingly arrogant beer drinkers bashing on every can. Lovely deep red colour, wonderful aromas of creme brulee, pine, spruce, toffee, roasted coconut. This translates into quite a sweet, very malty taste, with piney overtones, hints of milk chocolate and a decent, sugar-coated licorice bitterness. Superrich taste for only 7,2% abv. Creamy mouthfeel. Long lasting, arrogant aftertaste of grapefruity bitterness that kind of kills the hops complexity of the next sips.

- braun-rote Farbe mit sehr guter Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Röstmalzen und ein leichter Hauch von Citrus und Pinie
- passende Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk ist erst einmal malzig herb
- es braucht schon eine gewisse Zeit, bis man die verschiedenen komplexen 
 Noten auseinander dividieren kann, 
- erst im Mittelteil findet man dann etwas Johannisbeeren, Karamell und Brot
- das Malzige hat hier einen leichten Beiklang von verbranntem Zucker
- im Abgang wird mir genau diese Malzigkeit dann doch etwas zu viel des
 Guten über den gesamten Verlauf gesehen
Fazit: Tolles Bier mit einer leicht übertriebenen Malzigkeit

0.5 can.   A delicately hazy, crimson color with a huge, frothy, off-white head. A very malty aroma of wood, caramel, nuts, and alcoholic warmth. Taste is malty, toasted, caramel, dark fruits, and wood. A full body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is even maltier with more wood and nuts. Overall the beer is great, a definition of an American Strong Ale.

Can. Dark brown color with off white head. Aroma has caramel, dark fruits, malt, bitter elements. Taste is malty sweet with long quite bitter and a fairly dry aftertaste. Flavors of malt, dried fruits, caramel, grass and bitter elements.

Puszka 0,5 l
AROMAT: Intensywny. Wyczuwalne bakalie oraz subtelna nuta przypalonego karmelu.
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno miedziana, zamglone. Piana drobna, dość trwała, oblepia szkło.
SMAK: Słodowe (przypalony karmel) z wyraźną, długą ziołową goryczką.
OGÓLNIE: Nazwa jak najbardziej oddaje charakter piwa.

Im about a bottle and a half in while listening to can you brew it. Such a complex interesting beer. When they hit episode 2 and debated on special B, it rang really true to me. Super interesting malt character. Has a lot of flavor but is still pretty dry finishing. Hops have a perfect bitter balance to the malt. Hops have a good earthiness. The malt roast is so good. Thick body, low carb.
Bottle from Appellation Wines Dalry. Pours clear, deep red. Nose of toffee, resin, forest floor, red fruit. Full-bodied on the palate, bitter, burnt toffee, redcurrant, savoury notes, long finish.
Clear brown with huge tan head. Toffee, earthy and dark chocolate. Hoppy, oily and dry finish. Overall: great!

On tap at Who Cares for Beer 2016 Beer Festival, Bevog Brewery, Bad Radkersburg, Austria. Shared with His Highness Kaiser und König Igor and Rasta Teacher Mark. From Stone Brewing Berlin. Clear amber, off-white head. Dry fruits, caramel, honey and alcohol aromas. Sweet, but finish is light dry. Warming body, soft carbonation. You can feel the alcohol.

Can, served in teku. Pours light ruby with beige, rocky head. Nice retention. Aroma consists mostly of caramel, some nuts and toffee, not too intensive. Interesting taste, malty and caramel in the beginning, but then quickly comes bitterness punch, mostly herbal and grass hints. Long and hoppy finish. Nice beer, but taste is surprisingly overwhelmed by bitterness, which makes it rather boring, could be more balanced.

Ambrée tirant sur le ruby, grosse carbo, gros collet persistant.
Aromes pin, resineux, caramel, fruits sec (figue) et noisettes.
Corps moyen, amertume bien prononcée en finale sur le resineux et des notes poivrés

Tap at Bevog Festival. Pours a clear red amber with a frothy, off-white head. Aroma of nuts, pine, dried figs, spruce, caramel malts. Lightly sweet, a bit tart, medium bitter finish. Full, oily body with lively carbonation and a slightly sweet, bitter finish. 
Im taking a strong guess here and will say that this wasnt perfectly fresh. Either it has lost quite a bit of its hop intensity, or this is not a bold beer at all. Its a pleasant, pretty malty beer.
Can. Pours deep reddish brown. Aroma is heavy malt with dried fruit and a touch of nuttiness. Taste is malty with moderate bitter finish.
Sample at DØE 2016. Unclear brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, dried fruit, alcohol, citrus, grass, hops and biterness.
Pours dark copper with big frothy light brown head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, nuts, soap. Light sweet, heavy bitter, long woody, bitter finish. Medium body, oily palate, average carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2016 Dark brown, transparent. Big and solid head after while reduced to low permanent collar. Strong aroma of pineapple and caramel with citrus and alcohol in the background. Heavy, noble, long lasting bitterness. Probably will never drink it again but definitely worth trying.

Aroma: karamel, malty, blacksugar
Flavor: bitter and sweet, karamel
When i smell it first time i thought malty sweet beer but after i drink, it was strong bitter and herb aroma, fantastic bitterness

Can from Alko. A hazy raisin brown with strong natural white head. Sweet nose with raisins, spices. Herbs, pine and hints of something metallic, could be the can too. Full body with a complex, enjoyable palate. What I consider to be the typical american ale.

Nice reddish brown ale with tan head which leaves nice lacing as the head dissolves. Aroma has nuts, caramel malts, pines, grapefruit. Taste is malty caramel sweetness at first, then pines and grapefruit hops. Full body and medium carbonation. Quite malty ale but hop kick is there too.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Stone Berlin. Pours hazy caramel with a low off white head. Aromas of caramel, rye bread, ripe apple, toffee. Taste is malty and earthy with some floral notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours a dark mahogany with a foamy white head. Aroma is spicy, pine, and citrus hops, and bread and caramel malts. Flavor is caramel and toffee, with spicy and pine hops. Has lots of carbonation and moderate bitterness. This is a great beer and I appreciate how Stone has built a character around it.

Dark amber colour, big beige head. Aroma of caramel, spicy and piney hops, bread, dark fruits, toffee. Sweet bitter taste with light dryness and bitter hoppy finish and aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice dark ale, good balance between sweet malts and aggressive hops.

(Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale) Can 500 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 7.2%
Deep amber colour on the body, clear, with a good sized and thick tan head on top, good retention.
Aroma of caramel, toffee, hops.
Taste follows, caramel and toffee, cookies, good hop presence and a nice bitterness that becomes a sharp one on the finish.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Nice and very drinkable.
50cl can. Amazing aroma, amazing body, amazing overall. This is a placeholder. I will rewrite this.
Rich, dark brown with beige head. Taste is also rich, roasty, full-bodied, with a nice balance of hops and malts. This beer Was my first strong ale when I got into craft beer. I still enjoy it.
Can by Stone Berlin, from Systembolaget. Pours dark amber with beige head. Spicy, herbal, sweetish, caramel aroma and taste. Bitter, spicy, oily finish.

Can. Dark amber, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel, light fruitiness and some piney hoppyness and faint metal with light alcohol. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light fruitiness with light - some piney hoppyness, light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light caramel and faint fruitiness, light - some piney hoppyness, light alcohol. Way too sweet. Lacks character (as most strong ales do). Dont believe the hype.
@ Havregatan 20160819. Can (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and malty, sweet, spicy and roasted notes, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is long, bitter and fruity.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Fresh crowler from the main Stone brewery in San Diego. Many thanks to my good friend Paul. Dark ruby color. Good soapy thick head. Aroma of plums, wallnuts, whole grain bread, marginal ginger. Taste is bitter, bitter dark chocolate, very dry, dark bitter fruits. Strange beer. Not so tasty.

Cloudy ruby color with beige foam layer. Light creamy and forest hoppy nose. Too little carbonation with a very strong earthy bitterness and a little creamy mouth feeling. Hoppy finish and a very aggressive bitter aftertaste.

Spina @scurreria.
Ambrata con bella schiuma.
Decisa, molto amara, erbe medicinali
A strong smell of hops. The head is small and white, the body is dark brown. A strong bitter taste, light metallic. The body is medium strong, creamy with a soft carbonation.

Can 50cl, a clear dark amber beer with good head. Nose is on toasted caramel, carared malt, hop resin. Aroma is on toasted malt, resin, alcohol is burning, red caramel, quite bitter but less interesting in the malt profile. Cest une huit six avec du houlon !

bottle @ The Beer Trappe / Lexington KY --- Aroma of musty malt and herbals bitter. Clear amber brown color, frothy tan head that stays at one-finger, lace cobwebs. Taste is bitter malt that moves quickly through medium fizz, then grows sweeter as it flows to a finish that very late returns to herbal bittering. Interesting, full-bodied, alcohol that shows itself, but still doesnt match all the hoopla. Must be the reason Ive been so long in finally rating it.

Aroma of yeast, strong herbal hops, grassy, spices. Pours clear chestnut-brown liquid with a big head. Strong bitterness and little sour-sweetness, initially very strong herbal character, after a while adds more fruity, plum, peach and citrus flavours, noticable alcohol taste. Full body with a creamy but little dry texture, bitter finish.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, tea, bread and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with tea, bread and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. A lot of malts and hops, but almost no other definable flavours to back these up. A bit too one-dimensional maybe, but still great. The appearance is amazing.

This beer made me throw up after I drank half the bottle. I can usually drink anything, even turpentine but this beer is nnaaaaaaasssty! Its like if you would have poured an already nasty beer down your dogs ass and then put it back in your cup, then poured it back in and back in your cup then drank it.

Large can from the european factory. A hazy amber body with a thin, well-lasting layer of tan foam. Nose is mild with soft aromas of dark malts, hops and metal. Taste is very, very sweet and hides a decadently strong hoppiness that creeps up on you after the sweetness fades, but the beer still stays balanced. After a while, a strong bitterness still lingers on the tongue. Low carbonation and hefty mouth feel. A very strong beer by all counts that still stays perfectly balanced, well done!

On tap, JBM. Pours in clear dark amber body with medium white head. Aroma has dark fruits, floral, sweet caramel, raspberry notes. Taste has medium-high caramel sweetness with dark fruit character in the background, bitterness has a light gentle citrus presence, more balanced to the fruity side. Alcohol is evident. Body is full, medium-low carbonation.
Pours amber with a thick tan head. Aroma lightly malty. Taste is malty sweet that turns to hoppy bitterness, malty caramel lightly hoppy finish.
Drank with Liedewij, Bram and Timon 11-8-2016 after cooking "stoofvlees". Very "direct" beer. Bitter/cinnamon, or something? Not sure. Drinkable, takes some getting used to. Very malty.

Big can from web SB cons 2016-08-11 Göteborg, must have had it before?!
Brewed at Stone, Berlin.
AR: caramel, wee roasted malt, citrus, wee dried brittish fruits
AP: deep amber, wee frothy cream beige foam
F: warming feeling, wee roasted malt, citrus, wee dried brittish fruits, caramel, bitter, suger cake

Klar, mörkt bärnstens färgad, ljust brunt skum. Doft: Humle, kola, kanderat socker, söt malt, sött rågbröd, barr, lite alkohol. Smak: Humle, barr malt, lätt rostat sött rågbröd, kola, kanderat socker.

05l can. Cloudy dark red with a beautiful and lasting beige head. The aroma, while not too strong, is quite nice and sweet with notes of peach and caramel and a certain roastiness. The alcohol is quite noticeable, both in aroma and palate. Relatively thin texture and lively carbonation, it requires some time to drink but that makes it more enjoyable. Quite heavy bitter aftertaste with a delicious touch. Theres nothing too special about it, but its certainly a very well-rounded beer.

Wręcz wzorcowa, obfita, kremowa piana, bardzo trwała i z ładnym lejsingiem. Barwa herbaciano rubinowa, klarowna. Aromat bardzo delikatny, jest troszkę karmelu, troszkę ziół, jakaś bergamotka, suszone owoce... W smaku również delikatne, półsłodkie, sporo karmelu, herbatników, ziół, rodzynek. Całość kontrowana dość wysoką, zalegającą goryczką jak w bardzo mocnej herbacie. W posmakach również jakieś herbaciane nuty... Wysycenie niskie, półpełne i gładkie w odbiorze. Alkohol dość dobrze schowany.
Jednak wygrywa opcja druga, że wersja z berlina nie do końca jest taka, jak ta z USA. Poza pięknym wyglądem piwo mało aromatycznie, dość nijakie w smaku i z niezbalansowaną goryczą, tak to można podsumować - Top 50 to zapewne nie ta wersja.

A dark brown beer, a head is dense, big and beige. Aroma has richness of malts, caramel, wood and some fruit cake. Taste has strong maltyness, herbs, some caramel. A bitterness is quite strong and nicely drying, but also harsh in the end. Strongly medium bodied, nicely smooth palate. Too harsh bitterness isnt combined nicely to otherwise smooth maltyness. Nicely challenging beer, anyway.
50cl can. Forest floor and pines, but others do that better. Very bitter throughout. Dry, no sweetness whatsoever. Earthy. Okay, but not exciting.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours clear dark reddish brown with a medium brown head. Aromas of sweet chocolate, malt, dark fruits, roast. Taste is malty, toasty, bitter, caramel, dark fruits.

The aroma is fruity but also overripe fruit. The taste is very bitter and a bit fruity. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. To bitter for me to like it. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

For the book. Aroma is caramel, toffee, butterscotch, malt, nice. Appearance is rust orange brown, light brown head, hazy. Taste is earthy hops, caramel, toffee, bitter, malt, strange. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, earthy hops and caramel aftertaste. Overall, this is strange but pretty good.

50cl can from Systembolaget. Berlin version. Pretty sure I have had this before, but seems to not have rated it, so better late than never.
Poured mahogany color with a thick off white head.
Bready malty, some raisins in aroma. Musty.
Hoppy, malty, raisiny flavors. On the sweeter side perhaps, but the bitterness pushes through. Long bready malty finish. Decent. Feels fresh.
