50cl burk från SB. Brun/röd öl med beige krona. Mycket maltig sötma i denna vilket dominerar både doft och smak. Lite kryddig, besk. Man märker av alkoholen lite grann. Absolut en bra öl men ingen ny favorit. 50cl vart lite för mycket för mig nästan då det blev rätt mastigt och sött.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Copper reddish colour, light brown foam. Aroma is dominating of malty sweetness but some fruitiness pushing through. Taste is well balanced with lots of maltiness and greatness from the hops.
500ml beercan. Medium-sized brown head. Cloudy caramel colour. Sweet peach aroma with strong roast notes. Long spicy and roasty finish with light caramel notes. Very bitter. Good!

(tap 0,3l @ JBM (Brno))
Aroma: Malty, caramel, sweet, fruits/berries, some hops.
Appearance: Clear amber-red color. Medium, off-white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter, spicy, stone fruits/berries, malty.
Palate: Medium-full body. Sticky texture. Warm, long bitter finish.
Overall: Good heavy strong ale.

66cl bottle from brewdog online store. Dark copper color. Thin beige head. Medium high bitterness, light to medium sweetness. Medium body. Dry finish. Medium carbonation. Aroma is caramel, herby, spicy, chocolate, roasted, hops, resin.

Can @ home. Pours dark brown with (not so well lasting) beige head. Malty-sweet and fruity nose with some toffee. Intense and complex maltiness and even more intense hoppiness. I had the bittery sensation on my palate for twenty minutes after finishing this beer. Taste was good, strong malt & todfee with notes of citrusy and spices.

I'm not worthy! ;-) En god rackare. Rejält besk och en kraftig kropp som gör att den känns riktigt balanserad. Citrussyrlighet finns med, framförallt i eftersmaken. Knäck i doften. Bättre är storebrodern Double. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Stone Berlin: Aroma is like I remember it. Quite aggressive citrus notes hustles about with the darker toffee and malts. Taste on the other hand isnt as aggressive as I remember it, even if it packs some attitude. Sweet and almost creamy toffee notes that gets wrestled down by a citrusy and piney hop-attack. Great bitterness. This is truly an awesome beer.
Burk från SB. Mahogny- färgad med brunvit skumkrona. Doft av brännt socker. Mediumsöt och halvtorr kropp. Smak av brun malt, knäck, ananas, kaffe och anis.
Burk inköpt på SB. Maffig doft som väller in i näsan. Kakao, grape och tall. Rejäl och kraftig maltkropp. Förvånandsvis låg sötma. En massiv humlebeska fullständigt raderar avsaknad av sötma.
Canned 9.th april 2016. - Aroma is dank, very dank. Slight citrus, herbs and floral notes. The flavor is caramel-forward with bread and burnt toffee. Powerful bitter finish. Good one, this!

DWF; Can 0,5l.,, take away from Systembolaget, Karlstad. Pours large, hazy cobber with a lasting, lacing, frothy to creamy, off-white head. Aroma is moderate, malt, tropic, caramel, light nuts and spice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and heavy bitter with a lasting dark fruit, light spice finish. Body is medium, texture is to oily, carbonation is soft.

can @ home. Canned June-16, Pours amber, with a tan head. Aroma is sweet with resinous hops. Caramel, toffee, dark fruits, grapefruit, pine apple, citrus. Body is medium to full with an average carbonation. Taste is medium sweet and has an intense bitterness throughout that is very pine resinous and grassy in the aftertaste. Flavors of grapefruit, lemon,, orange zest herbs, caramel, toffee, chocolate biscuits and dark honey.
Assertive, long lasting bitterness.

Canned 16th of June. Aroma of prunes, plums, raisins, red grape, resin, herbs, pine. Barley wineesque aroma. 
Pours deep brownish red with a half finger off white head. 
Taste is medium plus bitter and medium sweet. Taste follows the aroma but has a certain spiciness that goes along with the bitterness.
Lighter side of full bodied, oily, soft to average carbonation, aggressive and spicy hoppy finish. Nice you can actually smell and taste the hop freshness in this. Big and bold stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 0.5l can from kaisers in charlottenburg, brewed in berlin, 2.79.
pours a hazy deep amber with a big dense beige head and a nice lacing. aroma of caramel, raisins, plums, some fruity hops. flavour of barleywine, bread/zopf, spices, grapefruit, spruce, dark fruits. quite bitter, sourish, not as sweet as a typical doppelbock or a strong lager. full body, long bitter finish. alcohol is barely noticeable. nice.

Bottle from Alko. Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Head leaves some lacing in glass. Aroma has sweetness, some malts and hops. Taste has caramel, it is bitter, a bit fruity, mostly with dark fruits. Warming beer. Would be perfect for a cold winter day.

Tap @ Keller, Tartu. Pours caramel amber with medium beige head. Aroma is silage, slurry, hay, light sweetness, fruits, some dust. Taste is sourish, bitter, caramel, creamy, oily, snotty, some fruits. Fills mouth with saliva. After taste is very long, spicy, hops, irritating and sharp. Good for the first beer in the evening but not for the last one - hits you quite hard!
Belle couleur brun-rouge; mousse blanc-crème; arômes et goût maltés, fruités (fruits rouges) et un peu de résine; bière légèrement douce avec finale sèche et amère; well done

Can. Nice clear red copper with two finger off white compact head. Aroma: rich malts, bread, caramel, hops, dank, citrus. Taste: bitter grapefruit at the en, full malt body with bread, caramel, pine, some sweetness. Super beer!
Burk systembolaget. Kopparfärgad vätska. Beiget skum. Maltig doft. Spannmål och hö. Liknande i smak. Ganska endimensionell. Hög beska
Inte så Mycket lukt. Väldigt bitter smak som håller i sig länge i gommen. Något gräsig smak infinner sig ibland. Inte mycket sötma.

Can from SB. Nose is malts, a little bit of hops, not very fruity. A hint of cauliflower. Drank it straight from the can. Taste is very bitter, tiny bit of sweetness, toffee. Quite an underwhelming taste compared to what the can/description promised. Was not very impressed, an OK drink to get your buzz on i guess.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

European version, 0,5l can from Alko. Pours dark brown colour with not much head from the can. Aroma has brown sugar, syrup, caramel, dark fruits like plums, some earthy notes, cranberries maybe. Quite strong taste, alcohol doesnt get through, noticeably bitter, long aftertaste. Almost like a quad but abv is dubbel-level. Complex.

Red-Brown color with big white head. Sweetish malt character with some caramel, floral and over all fresh notes. Big body with a heavy load of hops, very bitter. Cant find a lot of hop character, little earthy and herbal. Alcohol is hard to notice. Somewhat refreshing. Difficult but: Good one

Poured dark ruby with strong white head. Fruity aroma. Lots of dark berries and a touch of fresh cut grass. Strong bitter flavour. Grapefruit, dark berries, resin. Quite alot going on. Alot more bitter than i thought it would be. Long dry bitter finish. Lovely beer

Puszka z Berlina. Zapach dosyć intensywny, karmel, toffi, cytrusy, chleb. Kolor rubinowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, karmel, toffi, cukier, igliwia, cytrusy. Goryczka wysoka, wysycenie niskie.

Dark brown color, light beige head with good lasting, nice lacing. Aroma has notes of toasted sugar with some spice hints. Flavor is light bittery, spicy and sugar, good maltiness, some pine. Mild bitterness in the final, light smooth and dense on palate.

Tölkki @ Alko. Kaatuu snifteriin mahonginruskeana ja kirkkaana, noin kahden sormen paksuisella tiiviihköllä vaahdolla. Tuoksusta löytyy karamellista ja makean leipäistä maltaisuutta, sekä puumaista ja hedelmäistä humalointia, hieman turhan laimeana tosin. Maussa puumainen ja sitruksinen humalointi iskee alussa, sen jälkeen mukaan tulee makean viinikumisia ja toffeemaisia sävyjä. Hieman kukkaisia sävyjäkin on joukossa. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen, melko katkera ja makean puoleinen. Harvemmin Suomesta saatavassa tyylissä parhaimmillaan humalointi ja maltaisuus on loistavasti tasapainossa, niin tässäkin. Hieman kuitenkin jää vajaaksi sekä tuoksun että maun puolesta, mutta laadukasta jälkeähän tämä on. Jää kuitenkin hieman tammitetusta versiosta..

Pours a clean mahogany color with medium to huge tan head. Malty aroma, very dominant, with caramel, toffee, resin, pine and slightly citrus. Taste follows the aroma, ver Barley Winey, caramel, toffee sweetness, brown sugar, coffee, pine and citrus, with a massive and persistent bitterness on the aftertaste.
Ruby colour, lasting laces. Malt and sugar cane aroma. Kiwi. Sweet and bitter in balance.

Dose von Stone Berlin - dunkelbraune Farbe mit mittelhoher, fester Schaumkrone. Der Spruch auf der Dose ist ja eher zum fremdschämen ... dennoch: es ist einfach wirklich gut! Nicht unbedingt sehr facettenreich im Geschmack, aber furios in seinen Aromen: Tropische Früchte, Malz, Harz, Rosinen, Beeren. Unterlegt von einer schweren, aber aromatischen Bittere. Unglaublich gut trinkbar.

Clear amber, quite nice head. Aroma is very subtle; some caramel, bread, dry fruits. Medium to high sweetness, full body. Quite clean flavour profile. Terrible, high, earthy, herbal bitterness. Its really long lasting.
Amber color. Fruity aromas with bitter hops. Fruity taste, bitter taste. Heavy bitter finish. Too bitter. I guess the the commercial description is right.

Can from Stone Brewing Berlin
Dark ruby color clear beer with big head.
Aroma: a lot of caramel, later on resin, orange from hops.
Taste: huge lingering heavy bitter, and not really much more. Hint of grass, tones of resin, citrus albedo. Very heavy and not really pleasant bitter. Minimal sweet and sour notes.
Palate: Dry, smooth, low carbonated. 
Overall: Bo-ring!. After all this IPAs, beside empty, heavy bitter its kinda tasteless. Big disapointment. The label was right, I wont like it, but the reason is- theres no depth in this beer.

Bottiglia. Colore ambrato carico con un cappello di schiuma di 2 dita fine e persistente. Aroma maltato, caramello e luppoli. Al palato attacca in maniera dolce per essere poi sostituita dallamaro dei luppoli. Corpo molto pieno e finale molto lungo. Ottima

Fresh can from Stone Germany. Pours a big dark chestnut with light khaki head. Roasted, nutty aromas with some herbs and spices. The palate is medium bodied, towards the sweet side but quite balanced. The finish is pretty long with an intense bitterness which only grows as the beer warms up to room temperature.

From a can (part of the eu rollout)
Aroma: malt, carmel, vanilla, spicy hops.
Taste: dark berries, toffee, carmel, peppery notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canned from Systembolaget
Dark amber with an orange-ish, medium head. 
Sweet and vinous aroma with semi-dark toffee/fudge. 
Sweet flavour with brown sugar and fudge. 
Medium bitterness.

Pours chesnut brown, clear, almost brilliant, with long lasting beige tan head. Aroma: malt aroma with notes of caramel, toffee, vanila, supoorted with peppery hop aroma.
Flavor: malt flavor with notes of caramel, toffee, vanilla, supported with hop flavors, which takrs on citruses, with peppery notes. Taste is creamy, slightly sweet, then steps forward hop bitterness, which is surprisingly high and lingers thorough finish into aftertaste. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation low.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 From XXXII. In english pint glass. After dinner. Malty, reminding me english ales, with a strong herbal bitterness that remains after the sip and give a moreish feeling. Hints of dark fruits

6 Jun 2017. Can. From Bierkraft. In Ikeas pint glass. Watching House of Cards 1x02.  Very strongly bitter but without fruityness. Somen cramel and raisins in the flavor, but above all dry, astringent and alcoholic.

65cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured a chestnut brown with a two finger light tannish head. Aromas of caramel, vanilla, sugar candy, bread, milk chocolate, roasted nuts. Taste: Absolutely delicious! Caramel, vanilla, burnt toffee, toasted bread with marmalade, roasted hazelnuts, fudge, roasted malts, milk chocolate, sugar candy, spices, coffee, haagse hopjes (Dutch caramel/coffee candy). Medium carbonation. Very, very creamy and malty mouthfeel. Medium to full body with a long somewhat dry and bittersweet finish. This... is an absolute delight!

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 500 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Amber with a medium off-white head. Heavy maly aroma of caramel, toffee, bread, followed by a nice hoppiness of pine and grass.
Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body. Medium to high biterness. Medium carbonation.

On tap at Pudel. Dark amber colour. Thin line of beige froth around the glass. Hints of berries, hints of dark fruits, malts, slight caramel in the aroma. Slight bitterness at first. Hints of peat. Sweetness of the malts. Hints of caramel in the middle. Dark fruits. Hints of coffee beans. Bitter, slightly peated finish. Some sweetness and hints of alcochol in the aftertaste. Slightly lighter body than the bourbon barrel version has. Nicely balanced, drinkable ametican strong ale.

Pours dark ruby. Aroma: Toffee, caramel, earthy & grassy hops. Taste: More toffee and caramel, bready malt, bit of spice followed by a biiiiig bitterness. Overall: Now that its finally in Europe, I think its been a bit overhyped by our brethren overseas. Still a nice ale.
Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Lots of body, alcohol, hops, caramel, bitterness, grassy, fruity, dry finish, warmth. Quite good. Not the greatest though.
UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 Combination of roasted malts, sweet, caramel aroma, bit of citrus. Has a nice bitter after-taste. Good, heavy beer. And the can is hilarious!

Can from the german brewery. Enjoy by 06MAR17. 160609DE0101 
App: Hazy redish brown with a short yellowed creamy head.
Aroma: Sweet caramel/toffee and vanilla, grapefruit and resin, anis/licorice root, leather/tobacco and wax. Theres something vegetal about it, but not in a bad way necessarily.
Taste: Caramelly sweet and heavy bitter with notes of toffee and burnt sugar, grapefruit, lychee, resin and pine needles, vanilla, leather/tobacco. Big and long bitter finish with salty licorice, bitter herbs and slight soapy citrus.
Palate: Big smooth body with soft carbonation and oily slight viscous texture.
Overall: Without having the american version to try next to it I would say theyve managed pretty good to copy it. At least Im happy for now. :-)

First can series brewed at Stone Berlin. Aroma: floral hops aroma coupled with caramel and earth and malty sweetness. Taste: malty-sweetness coupled with caramel and biscuit. Palate is long and intense but nice. Good.

Bue en pression : surnotee.
Nez léger caramel, fond houblonné, léger herbal. Mais faut les chercher...
Bouche très légère, quasiment insipide... Un fond caramel, de légères notes agrumes et herbales.
Longueur amère.
Bof.

Can from Berlin brewery. Caramel, toast, some herbs in nose. Pours mahogany with huge beige head. Taste is medium dry with caramel, toast, melanoidin with high bitterness at the finish, bit astringent Beer is overcarbonated but ABV is covered well. Overall average at best.
Sample at Omaha Beer Fest, Stinson Park. 6-11-16. Bottle. Pours dark amber, off white head. Aroma of malts and some caramel. Taste was harsh.

Bottle. Sensoric. Dirty brown with medium, light brown head. Medicare head retention and lacing. Caramel and spicy aromas with some strong, dirty citrus and piney character, also some tea-like aromas. Taste is very bitter from the beginning (strong grapefruit involvement), pretty shitty and dirty bitterness. Zero neither tropical fruits nor floral accents. Medium body, creamy/oily texture, average carbonation, finish is bitter, bitter and bitter. In general hard to say, but this beer will devastate your tongue with high bitterness. In my opinion this one is not in my top ten, but interesting.

Bottled on 09/11/15. Aroma malty, fruity. Taste bread crust, caramel, strong grapefruity bitterness. Balance is on the bitter side, maybe too old already?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Aroma is caramel, bread, hops, grass, pine, dark fruits. Deep amber red, clear, big off white head. Medium sweetness, heavy bitterness, taste is aggressivly bitter, with hints of caramel, bread, pine, fruits. Medium + body, medium carbonation, long very bitter finish. Bitter, indeed.
Full ripe fruit aroma. Dark brown. Some roasted flavor. Long slightly licoriceish aftertaste.
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Taster at Brothers Beer. Big flavours of toasted walnuts with a good kick of hops.

Bottle 65cl.
@ 32GreatPower, Seville, Spain
A: Dark amber.
T: Malt, caramel, hops, slightly resinous.

Caramel, resin, butterscotch, alcohol, whisper of coffee, some raisin, grapefruit, powerful.
Ruby colour, small beige head, lacing.
Big bite, medium/heavy sweetness, lightly salty, ABV well integrated, some earthy dark fruit.
Medium body, small lively bubbles, heavy bitter finish.
Are Stone even Capable of making anything but a world class brew?

Can. Pours a deep, deep red-amber with a high, mixed-grained, light tan, blown-insulation head. Nose is subdued because of the overly aggressive head, but has caramel, spice, wheat toast, and dark fruit notes. It starts out caramel sweet, then kicks in with a burnt sugar and licorice bitterness that counters the sweetness nicely. The carbonation is low, so theres a definite syrupy element to this beer. However...this is nowhere near as badass as it pretends to be. Its a big, heavy, bittersweet beer, yes, but its not out of the ordinary. In this case, the arrogance may be a bit misplaced. Tasty, though.
Pours a deep brown color aroma is sweet flavors of caramel, toffee and light hop flavors delicious

In short: resin bitter beer.
Aroma: Liquor and resin.
Taste: strong bitter.
Palate: thick resin aftertaste.

Pours deep amber with sticky head. Aroma is bready malt, very earthy, with notes of treacle, piney hops, and spice. Taste is bitter upfront, fading to a more balanced toffee, caramel and grassy middle before returning to the bitter hops. Contrary to a couple of other reviews, I found this to be significantly better as it warmed. Not bad, but probably wouldn't buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a burnt carmel color with a good size head that stick around. Smells of fresh mild hops and pleasant spices. Bitter taste up front, and bitter aftertaste too. I think theres some nice spicy full bodied flavor in the middle there, but the bitterness killed it for me. Dang, I wanted to like this one more.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Zuerst lässt der etwas schlappe Geruch des Ales schlimmes befürchten, aber sobald der erste Tropfen die Kehle heruntergeglitten ist, gehts ab. EXPLOSION!!!! ABFAHRT!!!!! Extrem hopfig herb, überall nur noch rote Beeren und dann im Nachhall noch mehr Hops. HEAVY!!!! 0,1/1,50 die Berlin Edition vom Hahn beim den 3ten Kieler Craft Days. HOT!!!!!!! 9.7.2016 muss die Geruchseinschätzung revidieren. Frisch aus der Halbliterdose schnuppert es auch noch vorzüglich.❤

sample at 24 uurs, poured a murky light brown colour with a tanned head. nose has a lot of sweet caramel malts, fresh keg, so pretty hop forward aswell, grass notes, citrus, bitter aftertaste, toffee, butterscotch, bitter aftertaste.
How: tap Appearance unclear light brown with a medium to large tanned head. Aroma : dried fruit, stone fruit, grass, floral, earthy. Palate : medium to full body, average carbonation.

Im in heaven! 

The beer pours clear, dark amber with a huge four finger high, beige head. A lot of lacing on the glass. 
 
Nose: Orange marmalade, caramel malt, dried fruit, butterscotch, vanilla and whipped cream. 
Taste: Orange zest, caramel malt, grass, toffee, pine and molasses.
Mouth: Full body, light carbonation. Dry ending. 
 
This is absolutely awesome!

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a rather dark reddish amber with a small, off white head. Aroma has lots of grassy hops, malty caramel, and lots of malt in general. Taste is pretty sweet, but is more than just balanced by a whole lot of bitter hops. Very oldschool.

Im doing this one from memory, since I just realized I have not reviewed this awesome beer. It pours amber with a lot of foam, forward aromas of malt and toast. First taste is powerful, like a kick in the mouth, this is not a floral IPA, but a bitter, balanced beer that should not be permitted to warm. I have discovered that beers like this are much better tasted in an insulated glass like a YETI, where it will be kept cold till the end. This is one of my favourite beers.
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 75 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours brown with big head. Malty fruity aroma with long malty, hoppy bitter after taste.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Tap @ TCBW16. Pours dark amber with yellow head. Aroma is weak, mostly hay and citrus. Taste; bitter, slight roast, malty, citrus. Medium body. Ok beer.

Beeeeeeeeeeeeeer is a great day to be a good day to beeeeeeeeer! Beeeeeeeeeeeeeeer. Beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Jopen proeflokaal Amsterdam. Clear dark brown with big fluffy caramel colored head, looks nice. Sweat, onion, lots of spices, dusty, caramel and toffee, grassy and lime, light bitter vegetables. Medium sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with slick feel. Something went wrong here I guess, this is not very good and smells really bad. But according to the bartender this is how its supposed to be...

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 New rating: 0,5L can shared with J at catsitter tasting at Maakuns. Clear brown with offwhite head. Sweet malts, roasted, very bitter, lemon peel, tea, leather asshole. 😂😂😂. Medium sweet, very bitter. Medium body, average carbonation. 

Old rating: Tap at Jopen Proeflokaal Amsterdam. Near clear brown with fat tan head. Sweet roasted caramel malts, spices, cough syrup, tea, grilled onions. Medium sweet, under medium bitter. Medium body, low carbonation. Sweaty dirty onion candy. Hmm not really.
Bottle from systembolaget 1-2 finger brownich head very smooth and round hoppy and not at all alkohol spikey
On tap at Craft & Draft Amsterdam. Dark ruby with a medium height tan head. Caramel, pine, citrus, dried fruit. Bitter aftertaste with a slight metallic feeling.

Sampled from tap at Craft & Draft (Stone Berlin). Clear, dark brownish red with a tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of caramel, raisins, red berries, some pine and molasses. Sweetish-malty taste of caramel, raisins, prunes, red berries, some pine and molasses, followed by a short, slightly resiny-bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Quite nice!

Draft 0.15l at Craft&Draft Amsterdam Netherlands. 03.05.2016.Taste with Zlotta.Stone Berlin.Pour it clear red color with small white head.Aroma red fruits,some kind of smoked note.Taste starts with bitterish citrus,some red fruits,sweet but kind of flat.Aftertaste chocolate intesive,very well hidden alcohol.

Bottle (22 oz). Pours bronze with off-white head and lacing. Malt and hop aroma. Malt with substantial hops. Excellent all-around.     

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Craft Bier fest, Vienna. Amber color with medium off-white head. strong aroma of fruits and citrus hops. Taste, red fruits, caramel, spices, dominant citrus hops. Tasty.
Superb American Strong, some barley wine qualities, malt cocktail, bread, caramel, some toast impact, dried fruits, pine. Moderate sweet with intense bitterness, tho well balanced. Highly enjoyable.

Aroma terroso
Aspecto color caramelo con espuma persistente
En boca muy maltosa al principio con un final amargo que balancea el trago 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark honey with an off-white head. Strong aroma of hops, makes me think it will be quite bitter. Strongly bitter. A little too much for me, but I can see why others would like it.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2016 APARIENCIA: de color rubí profundo con destellos rojizos a contraluz, se observa cristalina; corona de espuma color beige de buena retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: cítrico, herbal, dulce y ligeramente frutal; notas a cáscara de toronja, naranja, pino, resina, piña, mango, azúcar morena, caramelo, toffee, nueces, vainilla, algunos frutos oscuros maduros como dátiles se alcanzan a percibir.

SABOR: de inicio un amargor medio alto-alto ligeramente dulce, seguido de notas cítricas y herbales como cáscara de naranja, toronja, pino, resina seguido de las notas de azúcar morena, caramelo, toffee, frutos oscuros maduros, vainilla; el retrogusto queda un amargor alto pegado al paladar, ligera persistencia de dulzor.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con una ligera sensación oleosos, mediana carbonatación. Queda una sensación jabonosa en boca una vez pasado el trago que puede llegar a ser molesta.
RESUMEN: Una cerveza buena, con una sensación jabonosa en el amargor residual molesto.

Flaska från SB. Provning med ölsällskapet. Mörk, mahognybrun i färgen, lätt disig med krämigt brunbeiget skum som lämnar rester på kanterna. Riktigt tjusig. Rejält med kåda, kola, apelsinskal och granskott. Medelstor kropp. Rätt klibbig beska men inte supertung. Ganska välrostade toner, nästan lite lätt rökig och tendens till lakrits. Även något torrare toner, nästan lite aska. Annars kola, kåda, toffee, granskott. Det enda minuset är att kroppen gärna kunde varit något större.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours deep ruby/brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel, pine, resin, sugary. Flavour is medium sweet with a strong and persistent bitter end. High body, medium carbonation. Rough.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 From the tap at the Dortmund beerfest. Reddish broen with off white head. floral piny nose. Taste is intense bitterness a bit to much for my taste. Finish is piny bitter hard Stuff...

Kolor jansnobrązowy, zamglony.
Wysoka, żółta, czapowata piana, która po kilku minutach opada do grubego kożucha.
Niezliczone wstążeczki na ściankach pokala.
Wzorowy lacing do jakiego przyzwyczaiły mnie amerykańskie piwa.
W aromacie o dziwo puściutko. Na prawdę pustka, pustka i jeszcze raz pustka.
Trochę ciemnych owoców i żywicy.
Następnie cukier trzcinowy i w zasadzie to tyle.
W smaku może odrobinę więcej, ale wciąż poziom przeciętnego piwa.
Słabo wyczuwalne nuty ciemnych owoców z intensywnym żywicznym posmakiem.
Poza tym delikatna kawa na końcu języka.
Goryczka wysoka, długa, BARDZO zalegająca stanowiąca kombinację akcentów żywicznych i trawiastych.
Na plus świetnie zamaskowany alkohol.
Butelki tylko 0,65l. w związku z tym męczyłem się z nim niesamowicie...

Najbardziej przereklamowane piwo z browaru Stone Brewing Co.
Kompletny zawód jak dla mnie.

Słyszałem głosy, że ten egzemplarz z Berlina również był słaby i że amerykański niby lepszy.

Niestety ten również mocno zawodzi i piwo na pewno nie jest warte swojej wysokiej ceny.

Jedyny plus to fenomenalna etykieta - malowana na szkle + kapselek firmowy, jeden z najładniejszych w mojej kolekcji.

On tap @ lambrate via adelchi. ramato carico, quasi marrone, lievemente velata con schiuma beige fine non troppo persistente. Aroma intenso, fine, complesso, tostato di caramello, caffè solubile e liquirizia. decisa luppolatura aromatica erbacea. note di toffee, frutta secca (nocciola) e crema di whisky. gusto abboccato, caramellato, acidulo per via della tostatura, decisamente amaro il finale, sia per la luppolatura che per la tostatura. finale amaro secco e lungo. corposa, non molto carbonata, calda senza eccessi, rotonda spettacolarmente equilibrata e armonica
Sample at BGM 2016. Dark copper, aroma of caramel, dried fruits. Taste is dry with well marked bitterness.

Fatööööl Rover Götet. Mörkrostad samt grumlig jävel. Doftar tungt av hav åh blåa druvor, frukter . Smakar djupt fylligt av alla möjliga dadlar, russin å sån skit. Hög efterbeska perfekt Ingen idiot sötma.

Tap (TCBW2016)
Stinky farty sweet aroma, fairly pungent. Watery palate, but smoothish, for 7% this is actually rather light and drinkable. Some caramelly sweetness. Lots of nuttiness. Resiny hops build up nicely. Has a dry almost peppery bitterness. Shame about what was going on in the aroma, that spoilt it for me. Would happily rerate, I dont think thats what the brewer wanted me to drink.
Malty overtones with a slight hoppy finish that balances well. On draught at Valencia on Tap.
Tap at TCBW. Pours copper brown. Aroma is sweet and malty. Flavor is bitter, malt, caramel. Bitterness gets bit harsh. Overall: very good.

Pite na WFP. Aromat karmelowy, głęboki, przełamywany przez owocową chmielowość. W smaku trochę jak east coast DIPA. Mocna, ale krótka goryczka. Karmelowy aftertaste. W sumie spoko, ale podejrzewam, że niemiecka wersja była tą gorszą.

Bottle sharing @ Budapest. // A dry hopped ale the color of muddy water. Flowery smell, although any fruitiness in the taste is overwhelmed by the hops. Threatens to wear out its welcome, like an arrogant bastard,

Tap, TCBW 16. Dark copper body, medium head. Aroma has dry American hops and dark caramel. Taste is dry with more dark unsweet caramel and a bit too much astringent hopping. Too harsh to be enjoyable. The name is really honest.

Tap @TCBW 2016. Deep brown, chestnut color. Medium size, beige head, stays. Looks nice. Faint coffee, sweet, malty, grainy, caramel and some hay in aroma. Caramel, roast, sweet, bready and spicy hops in taste. Spicy hops and woody in aftertaste. Hopping is very well done. Covers alcohol well. Excellent brew.
