Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weeken 2016, Tallinn. Colour is reddish brown with large white head. Aromas and flavours: Dryness, dry fruits and malts.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Tap at TCBW. Amber beer, big beige head. Nose is malty, sweet, hops. Flavor is hops, malt, some toffee notes. Herbal hops, oranges and caramel in the finish. Pretty nice.

Pours a beautifully clear dark red color with ample tan head. Aroma of caramel, toasted malt, bread/yeast, resinous pine, and a hint of sweetness. Flavors were similar, very heavy on the caramel maltiness, pine, and toasted biscuit. Full bodied mouthfeel with a nice astringent finish. Well balanced, very solid "reliable" classic beer.

Tap at Frankfurt Naïv. Dark brown colour with small head off. Aroma of peach, tropical fruits, Taste is hoppy,tropical fruits, caramel sweetness at first,moderate carbonation,huge bitter aftertaste. Good beer
Keg at Zapfanstadt in Dresden. I feel like Ive had this beer a million times. Just getting round to rating it now. Its tidy. Oaky, dry and boozy. Burnt caramel. Gets ye pished like. Bitter n aw

(650 ml bottle into wine glass.) Pours clear and brown with a ruby red shimmer topped with a hefty 2-finger, yellowish head. Well enough carbonation yet very nice. The taste has some distinct hints of roasted coffee swirling with fruits and a bold hop profile that leaves a long bitter tail. A proper brew.
Slightly opaque copper colour. Aroma is caramel. Slightly sour taste with a lot of burnt sugar. Mediocre.
On tap at Moeder Lambic. Aroma: sweet, malty, alcoholic. Taste: caramel, chocolat, sweet, roasted and slightly alcoholic

Bottle, 650 ml from Luvians bottle shop, St Andrews. Pours deep amber, lasting beige head. Caramel malty, dark fruit, spicy, toffee, sweet. Moderate hoppiness. Bitter finish. Had this on my list for some time, didnt really knock me off my feet, but it is a good brew.

Full-bodied with molasses flavors rounded out by hints of brown sugar. Always a nice treat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I wasnt worthy, was a bit disappointed after all the Arrogant Bastard hype I expected something a little bit more drinkable. It seems I dont have the sophistication to appreciate it.

Draught at BKL München 2016.
Dark copper body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, beige head.
Aroma of tea, caramel, dark fruits, grapefruit, some grass.
Tastes of grapefruit, caramel, some pine, some resin, dark fruits, some tea.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, a bit dry, zesty, hoppy, a bit herbal, with subtle malts.

Nice one, although I was expecting more. Tastes like a darker IPA, with some harsh notes I dont like too much. Ive had the Oaked version before and liked it way better.

Wow cant believe I havent rated this yet. Deep reddish copper with a medium head that leaves moderate lacing. The aroma is resiny, slightly piney, and a touch of floral hops with a rich caramel backbone. The flavor is about what you would expect from the aroma...Chinook hops and Special B. Classic American strong ale.

Bottle, 660ml. A mahogany beer with a small head and some sediments. Aroma is of firewood, malt, alcohol and spices. Taste is bitter with a strong alcoholic and malt finish. Medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste has a strong malt character and is somewhat agressive. I really like it.
On draught. Amber in colour. Malty aromas with big hits of hop. Malty and hoppy in spades with a long lasting bitter finish. I really liked this beer.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Enjoy By 09/03/15

bu 30 janvier 2016...

De couleur rouge sang foncé avec une petite dentelle beige sur les parois. Une odeur de caramel et un tantinet les agrumes. Cette gorgée débute en entrée avec son coté malté, avec un doux chocolat en arrière plan et son amertume des plus équilibré en finale. Wow

Re-rate bottled 16/0716

From tap. Clear dark copper brown color with light beige head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, bready, pine, dark fruity. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.
Hoppy aroma, not overpowering, but well balanced. Beautiful caramel color, with translucent hue. Smooth hop flavor with lasting sense on palate. Pleasure to enjoy, hot or cold.
Gezapft im Dolden Maedel, Berlin. Dunkle Bernsteinfarbe, Aroma Maracuja, Kaffee. Geschmack: Fuselig, säurig, Grapefruit-Noten, rauchrig. Bitter im Abgang

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 22 ounce bottle to wine glass 
Bottled 11/02/15 Enjoy by 01/31/2015
Today is 01/19/2016
Appearance: Deep red, small off white head, with lacing
Smell: Not a lot of aroma
Taste: More on the bitterness, nice follow through
Mouthfeel: Creamy and fizzy
Overall: Excellent beer, will definitely try again and

From tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Aroma is big malt, plenty of caramel, toffee, hops, pine resin, fruits, tropical notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and heavily bitter. Body is above medium. Heavy and big beer, strong rich malty and bitter. Vey enjoyable.

Appearance: clear medium to deep amber with one fat finger of dense light tan head, good retention and lacing. (5/5) Aroma: caramel/toffee, pine, citrus, tobacco, mild vanilla, hint of spicy rye. (10/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, strong bitter. (10/10) Palate: medium-full body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter finish. (5/5)

Well, on the one hand, this is probably a fresher version than my prior experience with this beer, making the hops much more emphatic. On the other, Ive had a lot more experience since first giving this a perfect score. Ill be honest: its tough being unbiased here now. Its definitely not perfect - for example, the lacing could be better-defined. But, is that a flaw that justifies dropping a whole point, from 5/5 to 4/5? I dont (quite) think so. Same goes for some of the minor character flaws in the aroma and flavour. And for obvious reasons, some (most?) people will find it too aggressive, while I, as a major hop-head, dont. At the end of the day, Its close enough to perfect that my subjective single point penalty here in the overall doesnt affect the final score. (19/20)
Bottle from Safeway in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is vegetal hops, minor malts. Taste is bitter and vegetal. Not getting enough malt balance. Disappointing.

650 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
clear dark amber brown with next to no head. That said, there is a bit of lacing left behind. 
Aroma:
Malt, custard.
Flavours:
Malt, caramel, toffee, hint of grapefruit with a very slight bitterness on the finish. 
Mouthfeel:
Average viscosity with lower carbonation. 
Overall: A nice ale with malty flavours coming through but it also has a hint of citrus with some grapefruit coming out. I found this one to be fairly easy drinking. This bottle was just slightly past its best by date so I suspect the hops might have been more intense if it were fresher.

Pours deep amber with a quick offwhite head. Nose is full of bitter hops and an almost syrup sweetness. Flavor is aggressive as advertised with plenty of bitterness and a thick malt. Finish is long and sticky.
Dark amber colored and a white smooth head. Hoppy and malty aromas, with a strong and pleasant bitterness.

From bomber, pours red with a one-finger yellow head. Aroma and taste of caramel. Taste is in-your-face bitter caramel, some citrus with a gentle sweetness. Medium mouthfeel. Bitter finish. This is a big beer that I keep coming back to. It surprised me that I hadnt rated it before. The marketing is a bit arrogant, but, yeah, I like this one.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 Rated from old notes. A dry hopped ale the color of muddy water. Flowery smell, although the fruitiness in the taste is soon overwhelmed by the bitter side of the hops. Monotone. Threatens to wear out its welcome, like an arrogant bastard, but is okay if sipped slowly and patiently

Bottle in the dining room again.
Pours a dark amber with a huge head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is hop forward with some pine and some citrus. Its got a big bunch of caramel sweetness and some bug spray going on there as well. The alcohol is noticeable but not overpowering. Cohesive enough, but not really something I find especially inviting. 

The flavor is really just a lot of stuff crammed together, this is how Ive always felt about this beer and I go back time and time again to see what Im missing out on. Its all bitter and sweet and Its got lots of crystal malt, its got a pronounced roastiness, lots of grapefruit, lots of bitterness, lots of leafy hops, lots of pine. Nothing really plays nicely, everything is just brash and feels random.

I mean, its a classic of the style (Imperial Amber I guess...) but thats not a style of beer I like. It seems like the marketing pulls in a lot of young beer drinkers as a gateway thing, and yeah... if you can get "into" this then youre ready to tackle the broad world of craft beer, but yeah.... its just never been my thing.

Aroma: caramel, resin, grass, spruce, citrus, 
Appearance: clear amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Perfect
Excellent! Taste perfect. Got IT in Mondial de la bierre at Rio de Janeiro

Strong 'bastard' of a beer. Three of five people who tried hated and two (myself included) like a lot. A strong ale with an unapologetic palate. Not sure the makeup or type but seems a great beer to stick with all night long as could ruin the palate for other beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 Poured from a bottle. Pours a translucent dirty brown with a medium sized light tan foamy head that dissipates quickly leaving a thing ring which clings to the glass. Aroma isnt very strong just a hint of malts and a semi sweet toffee. Not much flavor to start. Seems to be more flavor in the aftertaste. After you swallow you get a somewhat bitter dryness on the roof of the mouth and back of the throat. Not too bitter or harsh but actually fairly enjoyable. Re-rated after I got a fresh bottle.
650ml bottle from vons. Hints of caramel, marmite, black cod. Quite a deep brown colour. A little bitter. Head falls away quickly. Cool drop.

Dark brown, tight lace. 
Full body, silky texture, medium flavor, scortching heat and carbonation, lingering and fruity palate. 
Sweet, low bitterness. 
Medium roast flavor. 
Big beer, not very original. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This ale pours a dark amber with a thin head, a great aroma of berries, almost floral. The initial taste mirrored the aroma and then the hops aggressively take over. smooth finish but bitter lingering aftertaste. This is a good ale, its very solid, and its worth trying.

Not really sure how I haven't rated this before. From the bomber into a shaker glass. Reddish amber with a tan head. Aroma is bready malt, some sweetness, and some earthy hops. Flavor is similar, bready malt base with earthy hops. Haven't had this in quite a while and it's either milder than I remember or I've got lupulin threshold shift to blame. Definite bitterness throughout, but somehow has an underlying creamy quality as well. Still a solid brew for sure, but interesting to see how tame this seems now compared to so many other beers.

Aroma: Subtle cherry and some piney, tender.

Appearance: Clear reddish copper colour and thin creamy head.

Taste: Some fruity sweet and light sour.

Palate: Medium full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and abrupt malty with the Aroma.
A bit too agressive for my insophisticated pallet. Great color and complexity but keep drinking as to avoid that finish.

I had it on tap. It pours a dark red color with a fluffy off-white head and lacing. The aroma is hops, dried fruit, and alcohol. The taste is bitter with hops, fruit, and alcohol. It has a smooth and oily texture. Its a very good beer to savor.

Have been seeing this for 2 years telling myself, "One day you shall have this." I am so glad I did. Very hoppy and bitter. Just the way I like it. Definately going to add the bottle to my wall of shame.
Dark mahogany color off white head. Nose of malts and hops. Flavor of huge hops and malts very aggressive as mentioned in marketing. Slightly sweet aftertaste very good and big beer.

650ml bottle. Pours a beautiful, clear, ruby red with a large, frothy, long lasting, beige head that laces. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, caramel, dried fruit and citrus hops. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, caramel, dried fruit and grass with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice.

One of the highest rated beers in the world, everything Stone Brewing Company does is top notch.

The aroma is somewhat of a nutty earthy smell. When poured it appears as a dark, lightly red color with a head that lasts forever seemingly, having the consistency of watery motor oil. Your taste buds will dance to the overpowering rich, smoky coffee flavor with notes of nuts, seeds and various herbs, maybe a dash of citrus.

Its an amazing brew that lives up to its hype!

Tap at Beerbistro in Toronto. Near clear ruby / mahogany / amber with good tan head and great lacing. Loooads of toast, resin, stone fruits (ripe, tropical), prunes, nuts and raisins. Probably the toastiest beer Ive ever had. Sweet, and extremely bitter. Its excellent, its unlike anything Ive had before. Grapefruit seed bitter finish. So soothing, so... kinda mellow I should say, yet so firm. Like a strong friendly manhug from someone you idolize. Its fckn great!

Bottle. Aroma is not much - a bit surprising. May the thick foam be blocking? But the taste! Rich, richer, richest. Aroma is nutty, malty, hoppy but what else? coffee-ipaesque notes, black tea that has sat too long. Even some red fruit! Umami, cream and chocolate. Toasted bread. Complex is a cliche normally but this is the exception. This is the real full-bodied deal.

A 22 oz bomber with an enjoy by date of 9th October 2015 and poured into a snifter glass. Poured a very nice clear dark copper amber colour with a one finger tanned head with low retention but leaves spotty lacing. There were strong caramel malt aromas followed by maple syrup, toffee, almond and pineapple. Also hints of minerals and piney hops towards the finish. Taste was sweet-ish roasted caramel malts mixed with grapefruit and pine hop bitterness. The finish is a very nice long lasting bitterness. Mid to full bodied with medium carbonation and nice light alcohol warmth. Overall, I havent had the chance to try many American Strong Ales, but this one was really good. Great balance and the lasting bitterness at the end along with the light alcohol warmth make it really enjoyable.

Pours dark amber with persistent creamy beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, bread, pine and some spices. Taste is sweet and bitter, with lingering bitterness. Medium body, sticky, alcohol well inserted. A great craft for sure.
Bottle at tasting. Copper color. Aroma of caramelised malt and pine mostly. Simple taste of caramel, malt, pine and a dry grassy finish. Nice, but really overrated.

On tap at Prince Alfred Hotel, Ipswich. Copper in colour with a frothy head and nice lacing. Rich malt profile with a strong bitter palate that make it one strong brew as advertised. One to be savoured.

Caoba oscuro limpio y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de frutos rojos, melaza, especias, anis, naranja, pino. Cuerpo meloso medio, sabor inicial dulce, frutos rojos, anís, melaza y final de amargor intenso y resinoso.

A deep red beer with a beutiful head. The aroma is sweet with notes of alcohol and berries. The flavor is very complex with notes of cowberries, grass and enourmous amounts of hops which makes the end extremely grassy and dry. A wonderful beer.
On tap. Deep amber color with tiny head. Aroma - Strawberry marmelade, dark fruit, caramel. Taste - Light sweetness, very bitter, pine, toffee, citrus, herbs. Great.

Visual: Pours deep translucent reddish-brown with a gorgeous super frothy lasting head, very sticky thick lacing, 2mm retention, barely any activity - a bubble here and there.

Nose: light toasted caramel malts, a touch of booze, citrusy hop cones. (lvl-3)-pungency

Attack: immediate biting bitter hops, silky-micro bubbly feel

Mid-palate: metallic, (lvl-4)-sweetness, (MAIN) toffee malts, brown sugar, pine hops

Finish: bold hoppy bitter dryness, grass, bitter finish.

Summary: Full-bodied, great texture, bold bitter hops, sweet malty mids = overall great balance and complexity to keeps you sipping and flavour searching. Could be a little less aggressively bitter at the finish.
slight malt and faint roasty aroma. brown in color with a nice head. malty with nice roasted malt flavors, hints of coffee upfront, finishes with hop bitterness.
Bold hoppiness with a semi dry finish. I know Ive had it before, but am surprised I havent rated it before.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w Javeerwocky. miedziano-bursztynowe, ciemne, przejrzyste. z zupelnie nieimponujaca piana. Aromatychlebowe, owocowe (ciemne, swieze), slodko-slodowe (ciut a la barley wine), rodzynkowe, karmelowe. porto, drewno, Bardzo fajne. W smaku jest to samo wlasciwie, bardzo pasujace. wszystko to przy cieplejszym piwie jeszcze intensywniejsze i lepiej wyczuwalne. slodkie. Na to niestety nalozona wysoka, zalegajaca i wcale niesympatyczna goryczka, ktora jak dla mnie z wybitnego piwo uczynila piwo bardzo dobre ale az ciezkie w piciu.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle. Can't believe that I have never rated this beer yet. Poured a amber brown color with a generous head. Aroma is great caramel notes, hints of nuts, vanilla hint, and floral citrus hop. Some bread notes blend well with hoppiness. Medium body, slightly chewy. Great head retention. Smooth but a beefy tasty finish. Such a good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark ruby, slightly hazy, medium long-lasting off-white foam; lots of caramel and fruits in aroma; high bitterness, medium sweetness; full body, thick, oily feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish;Overall: Very nice taste and aroma, very "solid" beer, without flaws, considerably good drinkability-- rated with beerbasher

Tap @ Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Almost clear amber, tanned lacing head. Pine aroma with sweet fruit, figs, dried apricot, caramel, toffee. Silky smooth mouthfeel, full bodied. Complex taste, got full malt body with caramel, maple syrup, oak, toffee, dried fruit. Finish dry pine bitter.

Had this once in a bar in Point Loma, in 2001. This time a sample sized glass from tap @ Beer Temple. Nice clear red/dark copper color. Big reddish brownish head, good lacing. Aroma: somewhat vegetal, roasted, along with caramel and fruits retronasal. Flavor is bitter, roasted. Medium bodied. Finish is roasted and firm bitter. Interesting that this is so popular, cause its certainly not an easy pleaser.

Amber, light copper (EBC 16-18), light opalescent with a fine poring beige head and good lacings. Aromas of orange marmelade, dried fruits like figs and notes of toffee, caramel, herbs and some wood-honey and pine develop. Soft carbonation, smooth, full bodied. Toffee caramel sweetness building a nice harmonic herbal, grassy, pine bitterness. Lasting bit sweet yet dry finish.
Bottle at BBF LAb. Copper colour with tan head. Grain, yeast and amlt aroma. Sweet, grain ,bitter, caramel, malt and yeast taste. Medium to full body.

Bomber from the LCBO. Pours a muddy brown with a thin off-white head. Aromas have some hoppiness to them, but you quickly get malts, caramel, some gingerbread cookies, a bit of red fruits.
Fairly creamy mouthfeel. On the palate Im getting a melange of grapefruit, spices, slightly sweet malty biscuits, toasty roastiness, with a rye bread twinge on the swallow and after taste.
A pretty darned complex and balanced ale. Worth seeking out.
Well I liked it despite label. Hoppy aroma dark orange to red color. Taste malty and bitter hoppy. Pretty high in alcohol so not too many for me.
On tap at The Archive for Armakeggon. I know what all the hype is about, great full flavoured beer.
Very mild smell but cold beer, very cool red color though...very slightly sweet at first, hoppier right after and it lingers....bold flavor...little more bitter than I like

Never forgot this one. Think I first had a few (ended messily) about 12 years ago. Revisited now with more focus on taste. Big and bold hoppy bitterness. It lingers. Rich and sweet malt. This is a big, strong ale. Yes there are subtle notes too - fruit and nuts, caramel.

Very nice dark amber-ruby color. Clear with very nice head. Aroma: hops, resin, roasty tones and a bit of basement and raisins. Taste: at first resiny hops, but then hazelnuts, raisins and hondy. Semi sweet, soft carbonated and medium bodied. After a while I can feel some strange tones like: wet towel, and cloves. Nice beer, balanced.

Cervesa mold dolça i acaramelada, té molt bon aspecte i textura.
Cerveza muy dulce y acaramelada, tiene muy buen aspecto y textura.
Bottle to glass. Pours a medium brown deep amber color with a light tan head. Aroma is boozy, molasses, dark fruits. Flavor is toasty, caramel. Solid.

Bottle bought at the BeerTemple, thanks to Ster for keeping this aside. Classic red strong ale with thick, moussy, lacing, light yellowish white head and beautifully deep and warm, orangey copper red colour, clear with quiet fizz, misty with deposit. Strong bouquet of caramel, biscuit, persimmon, toast, gingerbread, dried grapefruit peel, spruce needles, nutmeg, roasted pine nuts, bourbon, dried apricot, walnuts, white pepper, dried flowers, hay, pipe tobacco and green tea. Clean fruity onset, crisp, subdued sweetishness with a light salty edge, red berries, orange peel, smooth body with soft carbo, lovely smooth maltiness, caramelly, nutty and very toasted, bittersweet with a long drying finish of firm, peppery, dried citrus-peel and lightly piney hop bitterness, warming the throat along with a dash of bourbon-like alcohol. Very pleasant, smooth, characterful beer, as the arrogance on the bottle would indeed suggest. Glad I finally tasted this classic.

I had this at Global Brew. I thought this was pretty good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 11/25/2013 Total Score: 3.8I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, citrus, pine, bitter. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Festői szépségű ital, ragyogó rubin árnyalattal, küllemre maga a tökély. Letaglózó komlós aromái szinte törik az utat a szaglószervünk felé, fenyőerdők vad ösvényén találhatjuk magunkat rögvest. A juharszirupos, borszerű jegyeket is megcsillantó illatáradatot az ízek végtelen mélysége követi - ha létezik kimagasló összetettséggel bíró komlóközpontú sör, ez lenne az. Olajos magvak, cukorka, muskotály, mazsola és faháncsos jelleg egyszerre robban a szánkban, tűéles pontossággal villanak meg az egyes ízjegyek. Lecsengése enyhén száraz, hosszan elnyúló kesernyét adó, egyediséget hirdető végszavú, arrogáns módon vágja a képünkbe, milyen remekbe szabott sörrel is van dolgunk.
Pours dark with full head from bomber. Aroma is strong. Starts easy and builds with bit harsh finish. Complex darker beer than I expected.
Bottled. Nice dark brown taste. Has a sweet malt taste. Has a slight almond after taste. Alright dark ale.

A solid off-white head atop a rich looking deep amber-brown colour. The nose warns of the malt to come, with a touch of citrus hops. Roasted malt is the hallmark of the "Bastard" series. Secondary tastes include rich dark berries, citrus and piney hops, and toffee. Solid richness in the body works well with the soft carbonation. A clean sweetness that isnt cloying helps smooth it all together. A really great beer, but I am not giving it extra "Rogue" points.

Big tan head, pesistant, nice lace. Dark amber colour, clear, obviously filtered. Caramel, toffee, pine aroma. Stronger pine in the flavour with mild chocolate and strong bitterness. Med-light body with dry finish and lingering bitterness.

Tap. Pours clear brown amber with frothy huge beige head, long lasting. Aroma is malty, toffee, fresh orange and hops. Some tobacco.Has grassy notes from the hops, almost minty too. Dried fruits and toasty malts. Quite fruity and fresh. Taste os toasty and malty at first, then comes the fruity, yammy and biitter hops. Alon some bitter chocolate and coffe. Delicious tobacco to find. Grapefruit, zesty orange and spicy honey. Light body with nice carbonation and hoppy fresh bitter finish. Quite creamy and oily feel though. Long lasting bitterness with some minty notes and peach candy.
This one grew a lot on me as i drank it! Really dry and toasty finish along the hops.

Great strong ale with a delicious taste and aroma, despite its strong taste and hoppiness it wont have that excessively bitter taste that many other well-known strong ales high in hops leave, but will deliver a fine feel in the palate. Perhaps one of the best strong dark ales around, a must-drink if youre into strong hoppy ales.
Muy buena espuma con gran consistemcia. Sabor maltoso y lupulizado. Olor herbal. Buen cuerpo. Una gran cerveza.

Botella, BBD: 01/08/15
Color cobrizo transparente, aroma caramelo, lúpulo, sabor malta, final amargo y seco.

It pours copper with ruby highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, grapefruit, shortbread, and mango. The taste is light sweet that finishes heavy bitter; there are notes of: toffee, grapefruit, alcohol, and floral notes. The palate is medium bodied with light carbonation and a long bitter and astringent finish. Overall, its meh.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 Âmbar escuro, marrom, espuma bege de fácil formação e boa retenção. Aroma amendoado, açucarado, levemente alcoólico, bastante intenso e atraente. Paladar de amargor médio/alto, dulçor médio que remete a açúcar queimado, um pouco amadeirado. Corpo licoroso e baixa carbonatação. No aftertaste aparece mais um resinal, mantendo o amargor elevado. Uma cerveja forte, mas muito bem dosada.

30-JUL-2015, draft @BierCab.
Clear, dark mahogany with a beautifull, creamy, lasting, lacing, tan head.
Grape fruit, pine, nuts, caramel, bread, herbs. Sweet and very, very bitter. Nice but tough to drink.

Light Brown color, off-white head. Aroma of grape fruit, pine, peach and some roasted and sweet malt. Hoppy taste of pine and citrus - some toasty and nutty notes as well. Long and quite bitter aftertaste

Aromat - sosnowy las ! naprawdę - od razu atakuje nas ogromna dawka żywicy, do tego grejpfrut i odrobina drewna, w tle delikatny karmel i rodzynki
Wygląd - przepiękna ciemno bursztynowa ciecz z solidną pianą, która sama się respawnuje po zamieszaniu szklaną. 
W smaku mocarnie (w ogóle nie czuć że to ma tylko 7,2%, odczucie w ustach -swoją drogą kapitalne - wskazuje na coś wyżej), mnóstwo żywicy, leśnych i suszonych owoców, w tle nawet lekka guma balonowa. Goryczka, ogromna, długo wybrzmiewająca, pozostająca jeszcze na chwilę po degustacji, ale absolutnie przyjemna. To takie uczucie jak człowiek wychodzi z dobrego rockowego koncertu. Łeb jak bania, huczy w uszach, długo nie może dojść do siebie, ale jest zadowolony. Ja też jestem zadowolony, bo dobrze ulokowałem pieniądze - świetne piwo !

Aroma: resin, melanoidins, herbs, roasted malts.
Appearance: clear copper color and white head.
Taste: high herbal/pine bitterness, roasted malts, tart and rough.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, tart finish.
Overall: Tragic beer, really disappointing.

12oz to cervoise. Pours clear dark ruby red, foamy tan head. Aroma of wood, earth, toffee. Taste is malt-forward with cocoa, toffee, oak and some dried dark fruits. Finish is smoothly bitter with cocoa and dried fruit. Complex and deliciously balanced.

On tap at Bishops Arms Maria. Clear deep amber with off white head. Aroma malty, burnt sugar, hops, earth and light citric fruit. Taste is malty, sugars, burnt sugar, bread with an increasing wave if bitter hops coming towards the finish

Piwo miedziane, mocno zmętnione. Piana drobno i średniopęccherzykowa. Dość trwała. Nieznacznie lepi szkło. W aromacie owoce tropikalne, cytrusy, trochę karmelu, las. W smaku wysoka goryczka, cytrusy, śliwka, w tle lekka paloność. Dość pełne, wysycenie niskie.

Aroma: Medium malty, toasty, toffee, Medium-light vanilla, oak. Medium hops, citrus, grapefruit, floral, berries.
Appearance: Brilliant, amber body. Large, off-white head, rocky, fine. Good retention, lacing.
Flavour: High bitterness that quickly smooths after the first sip. Medium-light grassiness. Light roasty. Medium-high hops, citrus, orange. Medium plum, resin. Medium malty sweetness. Dry finish with lingering bitterness and grassiness.
Mouthfeel: Medium-full body, Medium-high carbonation. Medium warming.
Overall: Great, complex beer. Amazing!

660 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Wimpie and Amanda!
23. Specialty Beer
Clear, ruby colour with poor, beige head, but with nice lacing. Sweet, malty aroma, dried fruits, some herbs. Semi-sweet taste, very hoppy, some herbs and dried fruits.

W aromacie zaczyna się od niezbyt świeżego, popiołowo - ziołowego aromatu chmielowego, wraz z ogrzewaniem więcej nut czekoladowych, orzechy, całkiem ok. W smaku potężna goryczka, która zalega w nieco popiołowy sposób, baza słodowa nie daje odporu. Stare jakieś to piwo chyba.. Nie jest jakoś strasznie, ale rozczarowanie spore
Beczka; barwa miedziana. Piana pozostajendo końca. Aromat słodki, cytrusów, owoców tropikalnych, karmelu, likieru alkoholowego. Smak slodowy, karmelowy, owocowy, likieru chmielowego. Goryczka wysoka.
This is one of my favorite beers of Stone! On draft in Jopen Proeflokaal Amsterdam.

Amber brown opaque body with a tan head. Aroma of citrus pine and hops. Taste is biter and sweet matching the aroma.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

IM BUYING ALL THEYRE BEERS FROM THE LIST IN MAGAZINE TO TRY THE DIFFERENT STYLES AND BEST BEERS IN AMERCA. AROGANTE BASTERDS IS A REAL GOOD STOUT (STRONG TO MADE ME DRUNK FAST GOOD) ITS DARK AND TASTE LIKE FRUIT AND LITTLE SPICE. I AM EMPRESSED VERY MUCH BY THIS BEER AND IM GLAD I RED THE LIST AND TRYED IT. I NOW ITS A DIFFRENT STYLES THEN PLINY BUT ITS NOT EVEN CLOSE. THAT IS LET ME TELL YOU PLINY IS NUMBER ONE IN THE WORLD!!!!!!!

From bottle. Powerful stuff - pours deep amber with a frothy off-white head. Great nose, all caramel and malts with a whiff of pine and citrus. The flavors are big - big malts, big hops, cedar and pine, long bittering finish. Overall outstanding beer.
Very hazy amber orange color with nice fluffy beige head. Hops, floral, caramel, vanilla. Lots of caramel, nice bitter hops, spruces, vanilla. American Strong like its supposed to taste.

On tap at Millers Ale House in PBG. Finally, they serve something drinkable. Dark amber body. I didnt really check for clarity because this beer just isnt much to look at. Its gotta be said that it isnt pretty. It looks the way its supposed to, I guess. Strangely, I never seem to get a lot of aroma from AB. I get the hops first. Mostly grapefruit. Maybe a bit floral. Behind that I get roasted malts with some caramel. Its not a strong or complex aroma. Taste is a bit of grapefruit hop at the start, followed by some malt. Caramel malt, but not sweet. Toasty. Extremely bitter finish. Well carbonated. Enough body to help the malt flavor linger until the finish. Not syrupy, though. Ive always found this beer defies characterization, but I usually enjoy it.
Dunkel orange braune Farbe, ordentlich beiger Schaum. Geruch sehr malzig, Gewürze, Tannennadeln. Geschmack sehr karamellig, Vanille, Kaffee, Gewürze, nett.
Pours a dark amber from the bottle, good rich caramel and vanilla smell, rich flavor, slightly boozy. Good beer.

1pt 6 fl oz bottle from Brewdog online store. Brown coppery amber colour, foamy off-white head leaving lacing and aroma of malt, light spicy hop. Taste is bready malt, grainy with tangy drying woody bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry lingering earthy bitter finish. Quite OK.
Smoky, dark pour. Undercurrent of chocolate with ripe malt notes. Soft carbonation. Seems unbalanced compared to other Stone beers.
Great price point for a high quality beer. Notes of tobacco and light smoke. Excellent mouthfeel/effervescence. Fascinating, impressively dark color for this ale.

From bomber into glass. Pours dark Amber. Almost brown. With tan head. Strong aroma and some substantial taste of caramel toffee and some bitterness from hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber to red pour with nice head and glass lacing. Malt aroma backed up by intense hops. Flavor of complex malts and intense battering hops. Balanced but big balanced intense in everyway.

Draught. Clear deep red liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, citrus, grain, toffee and pine. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee and pine. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Ok.

Draught. Pours dark amber with creamy, white head. In aroma the beer is malty sweet, caramel, toasted and bisquity notes. All this backed by gentle dark fruits and pine from hops. In taste similar, nice malty sweetness backed by very solid hoppy pine bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation, finish is long and a bit astringent partialy from the alcohol. Very nice malty yet hoppy and quite bitter ale. Disappeared very quickly.

Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, idealnie klarowne. W aromacie karmel, toffee, orzechy, chleb, troche palonosci i zywicznego chmielu, mocno angielskie. W odczuciu polpelne, gladkie, sliskie. W smaku karmelowo-palone, lekki chleb i zywiczny chmiel w tle, troche bieda.
Pours dark amber with a light tan head. Bready aroma, slight hops. Taste is somewhat fruity with a shot of bitterness and caramel malt flavor on the back end. Body is average. A decent enough beer.

66cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear dark amber with tan head. 
Aroma toffee, caramel, dried fruits, dark fruits, earthy, some pine, wood. 
Taste big earthy piney bitter, caramel vanilla toffee sweets, some wood. 
Mouthfeel thick, oily 
Great beer.
Pours liver bile brown. Throaty brew, with hops that cling to the tongue like lampreys to a shark. Youll still be tasting this when you try your next beer. Possibly even the next day.
Unbalanced thin cannot carry the bitterness. One pint and no more. lack of body makes this very poor. Should take a lesson from Guinness FES On a beer that can carry 75 to 80 EBUS no problem.

Malt and tin on the nose, a little appealing but not too exciting. Has a great dark brown-velvet body with nice beige head. Flavour a good strong ale taste with hints of licorice and molasses. The alcohol is quite prominent and the finish is oily. Its a good strong ale, simple and drinkable.
Physically tough day at work. What can I say, I needed something with an edge. Nuff said.
Pours ruby red with a creamy head. Biscuity, malty aroma. Very strong malty backbone. If youre after a malt beer youve made the right choice.

I wasnt ready for this. You dont drink this beer. It drinks you...I guess. Pours a smooth amber color with an off white head. Upon first taste I had to kneel down and submit to its will. This beer is like going to bed with a malty goddess and letting her play with your poop area.
Pours a dark amberish color. Aroma and taste are dried fruits, caramel, and malts.

Alright, all the macho shit aside, this is a really good beer. Fuck all the not worthy shit, just drink this beer and dont be a little bitch. Its a really big beer that does command respect. Theres a lot going on here. Lots of sweetness, vanilla, bourbon, fucking woodiness just epic aromas. This beer is not balanced and does not try to be. Ive heard a lot of people who try to talk this beer down and say its overrated and whatever, but Its null and void. If you want to venture down this road and try this behemoth of a beer, do it, but be prepared for massive amounts of self guilt, and unworthiness ;)

W aromacie lekko karmelowy, słodowy. Barwa jasno miedziana, niska ale bardzo trwała piana, świetny lacing. W smaku spora goryczka, duża podbudowa słodowa. Bardzo gładkie, bardzo aksamitne, delikatnie za bardzo nagazowane.

650ml enjoyed @ my vacation apartment. Pours clear dark amber with a one finger off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt, earthy, wood, caramel, pine and hoppy. Flavour is medium sweet and surprisingly bitter. Full bodied, thick texture, average carbonation. Finish is resinous and malty.

Malt and smoke smell with a bit of wood in the back, hint of coffee and bitterness. Red/orange with a bit of amber. Amber color. A bit of sweetness but it is mostly bitter. Needs a bit more sweetness.

Bottle. Beautiful appearance of dark amber colour with white foam. Aromas of caramel, malts, hops, hint of wood. Taste: rich and complex, caramel, vanilla, lots of hops, citrus fruits. Great balance. Medium carbonation. A beast of a beer!
Braun-hell. Leuchtend, schaumig. In der Nase Karamell, Holznoten, sehr hopfig-frisch. Am Gaumen KAramell, MAlznoten, hopfig, sehr bitter. Gut.

Bottle - pours dark ruby amber with a lacy white head. Lots of sweet caramel and toffee malt with a subtle hint of hops. Taste is not nicely balanced not over powered by either the malt or hops. finish is dry but not overly bitter. Mouthfeel is creamy.

Pours a dark amber colour with a thick white head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is of malt and the beer has a thick, syrupy consistency. There is a strong taste of malt and a moderately bitter taste that is long lasting on the palate. This is a complex, good quality beer, the only downside being that it is very expensive.

Another one of those "I cant believe I havent rated this already" beers. Heavy roasted malt and smoke aromas with an earthy, woody scent. Slightly hazy medium amber color with red/orange highlights and a thick, foamy tan head. More roast and smoke in the flavor with a slight note of coffee. Acrid, dry bitterness takes hold immediately with a strong cooked hop character. The caramel and light molasses sweetness tries to balance this out and succeeds, but just barely. Although the flavors are good, theyre a bit muddled but the end result is still very nice. The bitterness hangs around with a leafy and slightly floral aftertaste. Stones come a long way since they first released ABA and their flagship original still holds its own.

Poured from a glass bomber. Turbid brown copper very lightly carbonated with minimal head. Nutty nose. Complex taste. Hoppy but not overly bitter while a bit sweet, maybe a touch of citrus. Finishes smooth and clean. Worth every penny, I really enjoy it.

400ml draught 
7.2% ABV 
The Beerbistro (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)<vr>
February 17, 2015 
The beer poured a tranlucent dark copper colour with a foamy light tan coloured head. The aroma is citrusy hops, grains, and caramel. The mouthfeel is medium full bodied with average carbonation. The flavour is grapefruit hops, burnt caramel, and weak yeast notes. Best new beer of 2015 so far.
What can I say about Arrogant Bastard? This is often attempted but never imitated. This beer is just great. Hoppy. Malty. Delicious.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Friday, May 8, 2015. On tap at BeerTemple. Reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, hops. Taste is bitter sweet, malts, hops, hoppy bitter aftertaste with a hint of sweetness. Not bad 7/3/7/3/14/3.4

Saturday, August 27, 2016. Can at home (canned Berlin 5 July 2016). Pours reddish brown with an offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, light roastedness, hops. Taste is over moderate sweet, moderate bitter, caramel, light roasted, hops, hint of chocolate, light roasted hoppy bitter aftertaste. Not bad.

First smell doesn't forebode the great taste of the first sip and onwards. It is bitter, but still fresh and easily drinkable. It simmers in your mouth and it checks all the boxes in your mouth that are connected to bitter. It also has grapes, some pine and a little resin. Highly recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)
Pours brown with a fading head.Wood, dried fruit, malt. One of my favourites Strong Ale. Delicious
Red clear light tan head. Loads of malt and spicy hops. Flavor malty and very hoppy. Very rich and not sweet as some malty big beers are.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 50cl bottle served in a shaker. Pours dark amber/red with a nice light tan head with good retention. Aroma is massive hoppiness and flowery notes. Taste is more of the same backed with malt but not so much as to detract from the party piece which is clearly the hops. Grapefruit, pine and all the usual suspects are evident in this with both sweetness and bitterness vying for supremacy - although the puckering bitterness wins hands down. One of my favourites.
Bottle from bursprak. Many thanks! Dark amber/red colour, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of caramel, dried fruit and pine. Hoppy finish. Sweet and light bitter. Ok beer.

Beautiful looking brew - deep, clear garnet topped with sticky off-white head. Smells of citrus, caramel and alcohol. Flavors are bold indeed - pine and grapefruit leaving a lasting, heavy bitterness.

Rating number 800. Mahogany colour, off white head. Aroma of caramel, wet wood, not a lot of the aroma actually. Taste is light sweet, very bitter, the aftertaste is not very plesant, is astrengent as fuck. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. I guess I was expecting a lot. A bit of a let down...

220z bottle...I realize that this is now a classic and that there was a time that this was edgy beer...not anymore. Today this stuff is barely average. Overly sweet and sticky with zero hop high notes - only enough bitterness to balance some of the sweetness. First time Ive had this in years and hopefully it will be awhile until I have another.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Tap. Clear, amber, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Definitely an American strong ale!!!
Pours a very dark color a strong malt flavor initially but finishes a very very bitter finish if you like bitter beer face this is for you !!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650 ML bottle
Non grey so yay!

Dark crimson color, light tan head. Good head that falls to a thick collar. 
Nose is caramel, pine, citrus and biscuit. Well balanced nose.
Forward and backward bitterness. Smoothed out by the caramel. Lots of pine, grapefruit and citrus. Medium bodied, slightly sweet and very well balanced. Classic beer from the US for what it represented
(Tap) Really nice aroma and flavor! Just, a little too bitter and astringent aftertaste.
I had this with Mark and John and Bekah in Sacramento on our trip out west. At garden to grill vegan restaurant.
Draft. Beautiful red appearance. Very easy to drink red ale. Solid in every category.

Pours a bubbly dark mahogany with a lovely large foamy off-white head. Aroma is a near-perfect blend of fresh citrus hops, roasted malt, caramel and spices. Flavour follows the aroma but the hops are more upfront.
Tap @Brewdog Shepherds Bush. Clear, dark red brown. Frothy offwhite head. Malty, earthy, toffee aroma. Flavour has malt, caramel. Bitter and slightly boozy finish.

More like a red ale to me. Strong, rich malty flavor with a moderate amount of sweetness and the caramel/toffee youd expect from a red ale. Also wet on the tongue and moderate alcohol. Moderate citrus and pine hops as well as maybe a bit herbal.

Old rating. Bomber from Old Town. Pours a nice clear amber with a medium-sized beige head. Citrus, pine, caramel, toffee, molasses aromas present on the nose. Medium body with bitter overtones and a hint of sweetness of the palate. Nice carbonation. Nice big dry bitter finish. A classic from Stone.
On tap at Beertown, Waterloo. Stone! At Beertown! Earthy and lightly citrus aroma. Earthy, smoky, caramel, intensly bitter. Light citrus taste too. Boozy and bitter finish.
Bij Dora en Kai, warm maar lekker. Ruikt kruidig, smaakt lekker bitter. Mooi donkerrood en prima schuin laagje

Pours a beautiful dark mahogany color. Nice creamy head with plenty of lacing. Aroma of pine, tropical fruit, apple, tobacco and syrup. Tastes of mass amounts of caramel balanced by the hops. Everything is working in concert. Definitely well crafted. Finish is abrupt and astringent. A wonderful beer indeed.

Pours a nice Amber hue with a frothy white head. Head retention is excellent. Aroma (the stench of cigarettes just filled the pub so I really cant make out many aromas) citrus, bitterness, slight pine and maybe some orange. Taste of malt, hop bitterness , pine, citrus, spice, slight sourness and herbs. Amazing as always. Still looking forward to their pale ale 2.0. Cant wait for that one.
Double bastard is better, so getting that out of the way, this beer is pretty good but not one Id pick up, too many other great options...

Deep ruby colored, small beige head. Aroma is of caramel, toffee and some but not too strong citrusy hops. Taste medium sweet caramel, toffee, a bit toasty malt, some dark fruits, moderately citrus hoppy. Dry, quite bitter finish. Well hidden alcohol. Medium to full bodied, syrupy.

Awesome brew excellent hop pine citrus aroma, big hop character, nice malty, only reason didnt give t aste a perfect is a little too much caramel for me. Others may like it more...just my two pennies, other than that excellent beer.

Pours a dark cherry red , slightly cloudy with a nice dense tan head. Excellent lacing and head retention. Reeks of hops, with some cereal grain style malts going on, smells sticky (toffee). Taste is big and bold hops balanced out by the candy/caramel malts, some underlying stone fruit flavors. The bitterness is unrelenting, which is fine by me!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Bottle from Market Basket, Epping NH. Aroma is mostly hoppy with slight basement smell
Appearance is beautiful reddish amber with large, persistent, off white, foamy head with excellent lacing. Taste is more bitter than sweet, owing to the hops, and is a hair more hoppy than I tend to like but its not over the edge. Palate is medium bodied with light carbonation noted at the tip of the tongue. Pleasant long finish.

Aroma caramel, basement aromas, 
Appearance red, clear, tan foam, 
Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, 
Overall I would suggest this beer to a friend

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours clear deep amber/red, quick one finger off white hear. Nice lacing and retention. Aroma of smoked malt and pine. Taste is slightly sweet caramel but predominately bitter. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, resin oil mouth feel. Finishes long and bitter. Tasting notes of pine, apricot, smoked malts, caramel, burnt sugar and coffee. A very complex beer worthy of its reputation as a bitter strong ale.

Not something i would have bought my self so was glad to review the bastard box set for the holidays. Not one who enjoys overly hoppy beers. This beer is full of aggressive hops. The level of malt in it keeps this beer tolerable for me while still focusing heavily on the hops. I can understand why these beers appeal to craft beer drinkers who like hops. Just not my thing.
Poured reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of sweet fruit and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, increasingly bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Bottle from Haskells. Consumed in Moeder Lambic glass. Forgot how dark this one pours. Copper/amber. Minimal head. Aroma has some sweet elements but pine/citrus/hops come on strong. Gives way to a blast of hops that grabs you by the taste buds and never lets go. Basically a hop filled ride with resiny aftertaste. It definitely owns its hop commitment. Mouthfeel is cloying. You dont want to drink this before other beers. It doesnt play well in the sandbox.

Bottle from Haskells with commonmac. Dark mahogany with small head. Smells hoppy. Very drying, powerful hop taste . Strong hop dominates but finish is nice. Tiny bit of roasted malt but not as much as expected. Maybe some subtle syrupy elements. Could definitely tell this was a stone beer. Powerful and arrogant for sure.

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. A clear deep ruby amber colour with a fizzy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits like red grape and plum, nuts, sweet caramel and some spice. Taste of dark fruits, caramel, sugar, roasted malt, some grapefruit, earthy bitterness and alcohol. Full bodied, soft carbonation and an oily texture. A bittersweet, fruit hop finish. A well balanced, flavourful beer. Similar to a hoppy barley wine. Nice but lacks that special something.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Bottle. Dark ruby brown. Nose is caramel, toffee, hops, malts. Taste is smooth and bitter, toasted malts, dark fruits.

A clear dark amber color with medium amount of cream colored head. A strongly hoppy aroma. A pleasant hoppy taste and a lingering hoppy aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ruby walnut color with a medium sized creamy beige head. Aroma of creamy malt, molasses and sharp, piney hops. Full bodied with dark fruit sweetness and loads of resiny hops. Finishes with a dry creamy malt backbone. This is a strong one and the bitterness is a bit over the top but its good.

ENG: 650ml bottle brought from Vancouver, poured into the tulip. Opalescent dark amber color, nice thick but dissipating, beige head. Aromas of hops, a bit tropical fruits, grapefruit, pine and brandy. Also a bit skunky and alcoholic. Tastes malty, hoppy, with hints of roasted caramel. Finishes heavy, smoky tart. A bit too styptic bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation, medium to full body. Overall quite heavy flavors, too smoky / roasty with huge remaining tartiness.
PL: Butelka 650ml przywieziona z jednego ze sklepów w Vancouver, przelana do kieliszka. Opalizująca, ciemno bursztynowa barwa, gęsta lecz opadająca, beżowa piana. Aromaty chmielowe, nieco owoców tropikalnych, grejfrut, sosna, brandy. Także nieco skunksa i alkoholu. W smaku słody, chmiel, z nutami palonego karmelu. Pod koniec ciężkie, wędzone i cierpkie. W posmaku nieco zbyt ściągająca goryczka. Średnie nasycenie, średnie do pełnego odczucie w ustach. Podsumowując dość ciężkie piwo, jak dla mnie zbyt palone / wędzone z ogromną cierpkością pozostającą długo na języku.

(On tap @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Mar 5 2015) Pours clear mahogany with a big dense off white head that lingers with a carpet of lace. Aroma surprisingly sweet and malty with muscovado sugar, raisin, stewed plum, maybe a bit of date. Kind of a soapy hop character, odd. On the palate it is toasted malts with brown sugar, citrus peel, pine resin, almost woody. Dry and mineral in the finish, with moderate bitterness. Lightish body with creamy carb. I dont know, something about this didnt blow me away like it should have. The hop character did not totally work for me, and it was both malty and yet thinner than expected. Not bad, but not the world beater its reputation, perhaps somewhat historical, lead me to expect.

Draft. Deep coppery red with thin off white head aroma of malt and dark sugar sharp hop bitterness hit followed by sweeter dark dried fruit richness with bitterness returning Served too cold for my liking.

12 oz pour from refrigerated bottle into tulip glass. Moderate fluffy head. Good retention. Hazy. Amber or ruby in color. Pretty pretty. Nose is rich fruit, a little bit of hops. Taste is aggressive and satisfying. Bitter, strong hops taste. Raisin and fig. A little nutty. Pleasant bitter aftertaste. Overall tasty and aggressive. Would go well with BBQ.
Nice bite to it has that earth like bitter end, nice strong ale bitter yet malty has nice character not to bad
Nice crisp bite. Easy on the way down. Taste of bitter nuts and sweet caramel. Nice thick head.

Pours a dark amber brown body with a thin tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with an inherent earthiness and some spice. Caramel and coffee tastes precede a hop bitter finish. Nice strong punch in the mouth; aggressive, but not offensively so.

Couleur ambré avec un col resistant. Aromes de fruits rouges,caramel,résine, un peu dagrume, noix. Un mélange dun peu nimporte quoi. Pas mon genre de bière. Mal balancé, je ne vois pas quesque cette bière a de tant merveilleux.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 Dark translucent ruby-brown. Tan head with huge sudsy bubbles and fizzy legs. Smells of candied sugar, roast malt, some musty grassiness, some molasses and butterscotch. My description makes it sound overly sweet but it isn't. Taste is much more bitter than the aroma, candied malt, lemon, spice. Body is light but with a bit of slickness, dry, crisp, very smooth. Complex with lots of flavour without being overwhelmingly big. Lots of malt matched with lots of bitterness (esp. in taste).

Bottle from QClub at home. Copper pour with thick slightly tan head. Slightly lighter than root beer. Aroma is ginger biscuit malty with some pine resin hops. Taste is very malty which hides the very piney/resiny bitterness (very SD/west coast style hoppiness). Very bitter finish with a bit of sweet malts. Lasts. Really good.

Poured from a 22 oz bomber poured into a pint glass . Color of a dirty penny, massive tan head. Aroma of pine, citrus with a hint of toffee. A hint of bitterness in the flavor. Seems to be missing something. Thin body, lively carbonation with a bitter finish. Its a decent beer that seems to be readily available year around. 

Not my favorite in the category, but I liked the bottles label.

Poured from an oversized bottle. Pours dark copper with a tan head. Nose is brown sugar, roasted malts, and hints of dried dark fruit. Flavour is more bitter than the nose suggests with notes of baker's dark chocolate, grapefruit, lemon, caramel, and brown sugar. Moderate mouthfeel.

On tap at Rogue on West Broadway in Vancouver. Served in a 10 oz glass and re-poured into a large snifter. A very dark copper coloured beer with generous tan head. Bitter hop nose. This is a very bitter and hoppy beer, but with very mellow malt and fruit notes as well. All in all a very mellow beer, but the sharp hop note remains. Unusual in a good way! 4.0.

En fût au Brothers. Rousse. Belle mousse beige. Ronde. Grain torréfié. Noisette. Mielleuse. Belle amertume. Fruits secs (raisin, abricot). Malté sans être sucré. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Finale sèche et boisé. Très bien.
BOTTLE. Ruby red to brown pour with beige head. Malts and toffee nose, slight booziness. Caramel malt up front with a sweet sticky mouth feel & light bitterness at back end. Sourced RW

On tap @ Stone Brewery, Escondido - CA. Dark brown beer with small carbonation adn small brown head. Smell: caramel and brown sugar domination. Hoppy and sweet notes. Taste: very tasty and sweet sensation. Good malt balance and brown sugar notes. Hoppy taste and good caramel balance. Aftertaste: caramel and brown sugar with finish alcohol. Very good beer, a must to try!
-----
The same day, I tasted the 2005 Edition on tap. Color: darker than the normal one with no carbonation and no head. Smell: higher concentation of sugar and caramel. Notes of wood and caramel. Resine. Taste: explosion and harder than the normal one. Resine and sugar taste. Very oily sensation. Aftertaste: alcohol and caramel finish.

On tap at Brothers Beer Bistro (Ottawa, ON). Dark brown, hazy body with a lasting beige frothy/creamy head. Rich malty/hoppy aroma with woody, brown sugar, yeasty, ans spicy hints. Its robust, sharp hoppy taste carries malty, herbal, citrusy, and oaky notes. Ends with a long bitter finish. Bang on!

On tap at corporate brewhouse that makes me want to slit my wrists. But hey, at least they have Arrogant Bastard. Great deep copper color, bitter as hell but in the best possible way. Toasted cereal and hops. Great palate. I just wish this beer had less alcohol as I want to drink copious amounts and I fear tomorrows headache!
From Tap. Copper color with a thick beige head. Aroma. Citrus, pine, caramel, a lot of hops. Taste full bodied with pine citrus, nice long bitterness

Tap. Tanned medium head, layered lace. Deep ruby amber. Nice malty and hoppy aroma. Hoppy bitter with leather, broad malts, cream toffee, cranberries. Tasty, mouthwatering, yet dry palate, smooth nicely biting carbons. Long bitter aftertaste. Very complex, plenty, everything in a perfect balance of arrogance and classiness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Poured from a bomber into a pint glass.
Aroma- Hops! and a sort of primal feeling to it.
Appearance- The beer is copper colored with a tan head.
Taste- Incredible! a really amazing flavor, love the hops.
Palate- A full bodied brew with moderate carbonation, very dry. excellent.
Overall- Line up to try this, a great beer.

At the draft in oceanside. Perfect American strong ale with tons of hops malts biscuit toffee rich with perfect big peppery hop flavors. Been on of my favorites forever and always so consistent. aAaaaaa++++++

Tasted on draught for the first time at Barley Mow (Bristol) stone Tap Takeover. Fantastic beer - goes straight into my 30 top 10 beers. superb aroma followed by good mouth. Hops are very prominent but good malt also. Great balance with strong biitter taste. Very good finish leaving hops, malt and bitterness on the palate

Tap. Orangey brown beer thin lacy head. Aroma has lots of dried fruits: raisins, pineapple, wine gums and mangoish-floral-orange hops and whiffs of creamy toffy and toasted nuts. Thick malt flavor is not sweet; more like liquid white bread. Heavy, resinous and woody bitterness. Toasted almond and slight sherry notes gathering in the intense aftertaste. Hop flavor never seems to fade. Thick, slightly oily texture, full body. Ive had bottled version a couple of times before and both are equally impressive.

Aroma is honey, roasted malts, caramel, and light tanin bitterness. Taste is sweet malts balanced very well with the hop profile. Appearance is a clear amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly poorly.

Bomber, mahogany pour with creamy lasting light tan head, decent lacing, sweet malt, some dried fruit\prune, roasted, some wood, some bitterness at the end as well as some pronounced yeast, more resin than citrus not as overly aggressive as advertised

On tap at beerbistro. Warm brown with off white head. Lovely lacing on the pint glass. Very upfront bitter flavour that dissipates quickly. Not overly fond the first few sips, but it started to grow on me. Touch of caramel and toffee, but overpowered by the bitterness. Not bad, but not my favourite.  Ended up not being able to finish my glass.  Way too bitter for my taste.

Pours brown with a fading head.
Nose shows sweet rich malt, caramel, piny and resinous hops.
Similar rich, malty and bitter flavours. Comes off a little abrasive, could use a bit more sweet clean malt.
Having enjoyed other American Strong Ales, Barleywines, and Russian Imperial Stouts, this one was not as tough as it wishes it was. It is delicious, however.
Kind of a grainy aroma. Dark reddish brown hue with a off white head. Strong flavor that isnt over powering.
Maybe there was something wrong with this one? Had it on tap and it was nowhere near the double bastard I like so much. Weak aroma and decent flavour.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Stone USA, 7/2/2015: 1pt 6fl oz @ brauhaus, Edinburgh. Body is hazy rusty deep amber, small particles, head is medium tan rocky, fully lasting excellent lacing. Nose is floral, aroma is woody, grass, hemp, licorice, roasty. Light sweet heavy roasty and hoppy bitter, light sour. Full body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Not too easy, great dessert beer. 8/5/7/5/16=4.1.
Stone Berlin, 7/12/2015: 1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Body is opalescent brown, head is big, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is light roasty, flavor is chocolate, roasted malt, dried fruits, light coffee. Light to medium sweet, medium roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium to heavy bitter, tons of cocoa, developing hops. Medium to full body, slightly oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessert beer, very tasty, great one. 7/5/9/5/17=4.3.

DATE TASTED: February 6, 2015... GLASSWARE: HopDevil nonick... OCCASION: Cavs going for thirteen in a row--tying a franchise record?... APPEARANCE: serious dark brown body with steady effervescence; thick as snow, creamy, chunky off-white head that craters and clings... AROMA: instant pineapple and peach erupt; earthier textures blanket the scent with caramel malts and some interesting yeasts... PALATE: a powerful, mouth-awakening grip that tingles the teeth to the ears; creamy, formidable, and crunchy--in other words, a balanced ale...TASTE: as expected, a brutal malt swamp that holds its ground against a hop-laden West Coast citrus pucker--quite agreeable in its arrogance; love the lingering bitterness on the tongue and teeth, even as the strength of the malt dissipates...OVERALL: an American classic that lives up to its hype again and again--attractive, strong, assertive, alcoholic, reasonably priced and available in bombers or sixes; a versatile and instant mood changer, despite the Cavs losing...

Solid. There's not much more I can say than what others have said. Recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, bread, resin, amber, clear, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, slick feel, long finish,

Another uber bitter ale from Stone. Kind of a dark version of the ruination ale. Has a slight scent of raisins and bourbon. The body is quite bitter and grassy. Bitterness increases even further in the aftertaste and leaves an impression of ash on your tongue. Not really my cup of beer.

There was quite a bit of smoke with this beer. The beer poured a red amber with a thick khaki head that left a lot of lacing. The aroma is strong hops, slight sweet caramel, grass, and citrus. The taste is very bitter as imagined. It has a grassy, almost chewy texture to it. I also pick up some slight alcohol. I also pick up an oak aftertaste.
Not my number one stone brew but it's extremely solid and lives up to their hyper aggressive hop reputation. Delicious, but I can probably just do one.

22 oz bottle, how on earth have i not rated this classic beer yet, for years i just assumed i had- Pours mostly clear ruby red to orange with a thin white head. Aroma is lightly sweet, pronounced bitterness and hops, spicy rye. The taste is similar, with more of both, nice balance between the bitter bite and the big malt, the hops they use here are somewhat harsh, brash, being Stone this is undoubtedly what they were going for though. This is by no means my preferred style, but i can definitely appreciate its complexities.

Smells like caramel and fig, syrupy resin. Aggressive hops backed up by big malt flavors. A one-two Tyson in his prime combo. A stand by me 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried in a goblet and a craft pint. In the craft pint, taste and smell reminded me of an IPA. In the goblet it was very good. Too hoppy for me. But i really like the mouth feel. Not a favorite but hey at least I tried it.
Bottle at home. Pours dark red with a fluffy beige head. Aromas of caramel, red fruits, resin. Medium strong bitter, medium sweet. Medium-heavy body.

Poured from a bomber into a tulip on 08.21.14.

A: Sour. Malt sweetness as a base. Caramel is there too.

A: 2 finger off-white/yellow head. Nearly opaque red body.

T: Sourness dominates. Bitter hops and metal are more subtle.

P: I didnt care enough to notice.

O: Sourness is first, then sweet malt, bitterness, and a fade into sweetness. It was complex and weird. It had a lingering annoyingly sharp bitterness along with a flavor of metal. This was not for me. Drain pour.

Poured from a 22oz bottle into a snifter. A - Smells floral, a little fruity, quite bitter, and just a hair boozy. A - Deep reddish brown hue. Fairly hazy with a small lightly tanned head. T - floral and fruity up front. Bit of caramel sweetness rushes in at the middle of the sip. More floral notes appear on the bitter finish. P - Medium bodied and lightly carbonated. Beer has very intense aromas and flavors. I feel the medium body and smoothness help balance those elements. O - Beer is so assertive in its flavors, but very well-balanced. Creates a great drinking experience. And the beer gets even tastier as it warms up!

"Never turn your back on your beer."

Smell light & fresh with a fruity sweet taste to start with but this only lulls you into a false sense of security about what is to come as you get clotheslined by bitterness. To say this beer is aggressively hopped would be a massive understatement as your mouth gets scoured. An excellent beer that lives up to its name. Not for the faint mouthed!

Rated by BrewTom

Poured from a bomber into a tulip. Deep reddish brown topped with a thick light tan head that pours super thick and dissipates into a frothy had that remains across the remainder of the beer. Aromas of pine, caramel, bitter hops, finished by booze. Medium carbonation, and oily mouthfeel.
From a bottle. Pours dark copper with trace of white head and light carbonation. Faint malty aroma, with an initial malt sweetness followed on by piney hops bite. Bitter lingering finish.

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. red ale with good cream head. Aroma it leathery and malty, quite hoppy too. Taste is Sweet and bitter. Medium carbonation and full body with a bit of oil, beautiful mouthfeel from a bottle.
Pours a hazy amber with a thin off white head. Fruity and hops aroma. Roasted malt and bitterness taste. Good beer

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 アメリカンス                                      
苦味はあるけ&

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2015 66cl bottle from BottleDog, London. 12-09-2014.
Pours hazy amber with frothy off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Citrusy, earthy, caramel aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, subtle crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, dry, caramel, fruity. Robust beer, dry and bitter finish. Very enjoyable.

Original rating:
Ar:8, App:4, Tst: 9, Plt: 4, Ovll: 17.

Update, 14-08-2015.
12fl oz bottle @home.
Enjoy by :01-08-2015. Just a couple of weeks.
Same mighty hoppy ale. Robust and superb one!.
Pours dark brown/black , aroma is wonderfully fruity, floral and nutty. Taste is coffee, chocolate, dark roasted malts. Very good.
Bomber. Poured dark brown, big tan head and lots of lacing. Aroma of hops combined with some malts and caramel notes. Taste is bitter, hoppy balanced with some malts, nutty undertones. Great beer.
Very dark brown with a good foamy head. Nice nutty flavor with some hops. Overall very good.

Hell maybe I'm not worthy. While not a bad beer I just don't get all the hype. Definitly overrated in my opinion. All the makings of a strong ale just a little overdone. Not my thing but others love. To each their own.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from cellarbrations super store hami hill. Pours a dark amber with a finger of head and leaving lots of lacing. Aroma is fantastic. Up front you get a lot of nutty characteristics followed by oak with slight citrus. On the palate it's quite full bodied with moderate carbonation. Taste wise it's very bitter with lots of nutty and woody notes. Really awesome beer!

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Deep mahogany pour with a thick creamy and persistent head. Theres plenty of strong malt character on the nose with some dark fruits. Big and arrogant toasted malts on the tongue along with some sticky piney hops and a big bitter finish. For a malt-forward beer (not my usual wheelhouse) this was outstanding

For a belligerent strong ale this delivers. The malt assault is very much signature here. Smooth mouth feel and very nice hops and bitter backing. This is often overlooked when I am shopping. Love it when I grab it.

I call it Mahogany Mike as in Tyson. Walks right out and punches you right in the taste buds. Awesome color. Rich. Complex. Sneaky abv content. The 22oz is just about enough for one sitting. Not for amateurs. Maybe a little hoppy? Read the label. Nuff said. Wish Id said all that. All hail Stone! Try all of em. But not in one night unless you need a laxative...
Amber pour with an aroma of citrus and hops. Strong hop and sweet malts and citrus, with a bitter dry finish, quite good.

Poured from a bottle. Deep brown with a hint of red. Tan head. Not much aroma. Slight fruity smell. Very creamy mouthfeel. Hard to describe taste, but good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 1 pint 6 oz bottle. Appearance - Murky, murky dark brown body. Smell - Toasted maltiness with ample dark fruity alcohol. Taste - hops and more hops. Very complex. Medium body. A very aggressive beer with big flavors.

Poured from a 20 oz bottle. Dark amber color with lots of head. The active carbonation provides consistent head and a flurry of bubbles that dance their way up to the top. The first sip brings flavors of malt and a certain bite that lasts. Has a fairly bitter finish, which I was not expecting.

Poured from 1 pint 6 fl oz bottle. Clear, copper brown with beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, slightly nutty. Taste of resinous hops, quite bitter finish. Medium plus body. Good mouthfeel, but a little overwhelmed with the resinous-ness.

22oz from the COOP, but all the bottleshops and even grocery stores carry it now.

Huge 2" tan head that came out of the glass and left behind beautiful lacing. The brew looks walnut brown until held to a light revealing deep cherry red... pretty for sure.

Aroma is a good balance between American hops and caramel and toasted malts... some fruitiness.. more refined than I remember.

Full flavored obviously.. citrus and pine hops shine but are shadowed perfectly buy the big malt flavors... pretty brutal bitterness. Leans toward the sweet side with caramel and toasty malts... a touch of milk chocolate is highlted by the sorta creamy mouthfeel. Big and brash across the board..

AB leaves nothing to guess... it is Big. It is a beer I unfortunately always overlook/take for granted... I really should buy it more often.
Part of a Stone mixed 12. Dark pour, nice head, decent lacing. Creamy mouth feel. Not your average ale. Pretty good
Bottle at work by Majo. Pours deep amber color, lightly yellow head. Aroma of biscuits, malt, caramel, bit roasted. Taste is bitter, lightly sweet, biscuits, malty. Nice lond dry hoppy finish.
