Nice amber pour with a hoppy citrus aroma. The hoppy taste lingers a bit on the palate. Overall nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Strong pine resiny hop aroma with a little bit of citrus. Pours dark copper colored with a large tan head with excellent retention and lacing. Amber malt flavors to start with a bit of citrus. Finishes extremely dry with ridiculously strong pine resiny hops with a sharp bitter hop bite at end that lingers on the palate. Ludicrously hoppy and bitter, but quite wonderful.
Aggressively bitter citrusy hop profile on a sweet amber malt body. Slick texture. Pretty much the defining American strong ale but Im not crazy about the malty/hoppy dynamic.
Pours a very nice reddish auburn color with decent lacing. Smells slightly sweet and malty, kind of like maple. Tastes very malty and sweet. A good beer from stone, but nothing too special here.
Great beer. Nice copper pour, decent head. Hoppy scotch taste, medium mouth feel. Lingering hop after taste. Enjoyed it.

October 28, 2014. Bottle, best before september 28, 2014. Pours deep red with a dense tan head. Aroma is biscuit, red berries, pine, resin. Taste is medium pine bitterness with a sweet malty background and resinous notes. Finish is dry, hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

22 oz bottle from the Arrogant Bastard Box poured into a nonic pint glass. Clear amber with two fingers of beige head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, floral hops. Tastes of caramel, toffee, pine, floral notes, good amount of bitter hops. Like a cross between a brown ale and an IPA. Medium body with a dry finish.
The innovator. This has been killing it in my opinion for over decade. Always spot on with heels big hops and malts. Good to see a perfect brew available when ever you desire.
Good beer. A little hot for only being 7%. Thought it would be closer to 11%. Good stuff you won't be disappointed.

Plein du malt bien équilibré par une finition plein dhoublon. Cest une bonne mélange du malt caramel (mais peu sucré), un peu fruité, et une bonne amertume dans la finale. Je suis daccord que cest une bière aggressive, mais je ne dirais pas que cest trop complexe. Cest assez complexe, mais cest comme ça avec les bonne bières craft.

22 oz Bomber. Tasted on 11/21/14. Beer from Total Wine Lewisville,TX. This is a great beer with a well balanced flavor of the hops & malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It is definitely an aggressive beer compared to the standard commercial fare, but for craft beers and for me its actually a real nice balance of the toasted malts, some hops, caramel, little bitter on back. Its pretty drinkable for 7.2%. Could probably chug them on tap and get myself in trouble.

Before rate beer, Id have never tried this. I had looked at it many times and wondered what was. Finally time to try it I guess. Bottle, color dark Amber, big creamy white head, huge lacing. Aroma spruce, raisin, malt. Flavor is malt, citrus rind bitter, orange. Finish is bitter sweet. This has a lot of sweet malt backbone, with a big, hops bitter, which I guess is what they are known for. Palate is rich and smooth, carbonation moderate.

Pours a deep, ruby amber with a small tan head (but decent retention). Aroma is a bit on the faint side, including notes of caramel, coffee, pine, and resin. Taste wise, youre greeted with notes of coffee and roasted nuts, thick caramel and molasses, and floral pine and resin lingering on the palate. Full bodied, lively carbonation, long and bitter finish. Quite enjoyed this one.
Excellent beverage with a gorgeously well-balanced bitterness backed by a full malty body and thick, creamy texture. A modern American classic.

Big bang as the cap shifted towards the ceiling. Strong waft of nutty praline filled the room. Beyond it is woody, nutty; heaving with roasted, oddly phenolic husky grains, over sparged or the like - nothing like burnt toast in your beer!Palate is sweet, residually and forefront. Sticky, icky with bitter burnt sugar notes not helping. This is sweet, Cara, crystal, Vienna, dont care what they used I believe Ive failed to find the depth. Medial body with developing (thankfully) rough, earthy, spicy, floral and piney hop notes as it warms near room temperature. Carbonation is moderate softening greatly as it heads south. Pepperberries, juniper and a hint of mace give it thrill otherwise it is sugar and wood driven. Perplexed as it has taken me years to taste the Bastard and it treats me like that. Bastard!!!. (1pt,6fl.Oz, Enjoy by 11/03/15, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Arrogant Bastard pours a deep ruby red with a thick tan head that lasts a fair while. The aroma is strong floral hops with biscuits and honey. The flavor is also strong floral hops with a bit of biscuits and honey. Overall this is a solid beer.

De couleur ambré au reflets bourgogne bon colle de mousse également, Arômes de houblons, malt caramel,quelques touches dépies. Au Goût cest très épais comme texture, ça goute beaucoup les agrumes mais sous une nappe de malt caramel assez heavyweight! aspect de tomates également ,une petite touche dacidité en final qui apporte un balancement super honnête à une amertume plus que présente. très bon balancement des saveurs entre elles. Près du BBQ cest Solide
Finally a beer that perfectly describes me. Pretty intense flavor. Good but not one of my favorites.
On tap @ Haket Pub. Reddish brown with a small off white head. Malty and hoppy tones. Malt, fruit and loads of hops. Medium to full body with a long bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 Now available in Alberta, Canada. Not sure what the huge fuss over this one is, has some good malt characteristics and some spicy notes. Very pine-y and caramel-y. Decent beer but not living up to the hype for me.
Matly smell with a nice two inch head. Matly taste in your mouth. Going down a bit bitter and definitely nice malty after taste.

Look 9/10
Smell 17/20
Taste 33/40
Feel 7/10
Drinkability 16/20
 
Overall 82/100

This strong ale from Stone bursts with a big hop profile and a sticky bitterness that lasts... Nothing weak here. While the hops certainly play a lead role, the malt backbone also comes through on the back end. Banana, Toast, Rind and just a touch of tobacco can be picked up. Truly a beer that sets itself apart from the pack~
Deuce poured into pint glass. Beautiful color, weak head. Decent ratio of hop to malt flavor. A staple for a reason, but not spectacular, just solud good beer.
Bottle at blacks at start of yrfull bodied, heavy dankness, rasping bitterness, lots of pine in aroma vandalism taste, barley wine territory
Pours a deep, dark amber colour with a 2 finger head. Strong malt taste but stronger hops - heavy on both, but perfect ratio. Gets slightly caramel sweet when warmer. Thick after taste. Excellent

Bottle into pint glass. Pours a deep amber. Aroma is a little sweet malt and a little hops. Not getting much there maybe too cold. Taste is malt with a nice hop bitterness and a little alcohol. Really nice beer.

Aroma was not as strong as I would have thought. Sweet malt, reminiscent of a pancake with the slightest hint of hops. Looks great - more red than brown with a white head of foam. Tastes strong, bitter at first, then sweet, then back to bitter in the aftertaste. Complex flavor, but a little too bitter for me. Perhaps it would be a little better with some aging. Palate is good for the style. Overall good, but not something I would actively look for. I thought Double Bastard and Lucky Bastard were better.

The branding and story on the bottle was excellent... Probably the best story for a beer. The bottle is definitely a keeper.
Nice brown color with a quarter inch creamy head. Malty flavor with a good hop hit, but not overly bitter. Very balanced and easy drinking.

An old school craft beer that has stood the test of time. Ive been drinking this beer for years and years, and I still dig it! Pours a dark red, brown with aromas of slightly roasted malts and fruity hops. Very balanced and malty with a nice presence of piney hops. Big, bold and delicious, this beer will be relevant for years to come.

They said i probably wouldnt like it and they were right on the money. Im not a hop head in the least but i tried this anyway. All i could taste was the overpowering grapefruit flavor from the hops and if there was a malt note to it then it was lost on me, no balance what so ever.

Sorry hop heads this one isnt for me.
Uma ótima cerveja. Provavelmente você não ira gostar dela. Mas é uma cerveja feita pra adoradores do liquido santo. Recomendo!!
22oz bottle pours a reddy brown color with some beige head. Full malty flavor and some medium hop bitterness that stays in the background to the malt. A little spicy.

Drucken på fat på bishop. Tung och söt med mycket karamell och citrusmarmelad och rejäl citrusbeska. Lite spretig och inte jättepigg humle. Gjorde mig faktiskt lite besviken utan att på något sätt vara dålig.

This beer is no joke. Nice brown pour with a bit of haze that goes into a creamy head. Aroma hits hard with hops and caramel touches. Taste is bitter, rich, hard. It intensifies as it rests on the palate, too, which is rad. This is one beer that lives up to its billing. Love it.

650ml brown bottle. Coppery brown pour with a small tan cap and lots of lacing. Nose has some toffee and pine.Taste has caramel, chocolate, piney hops. Nice finishing bitterness. Piney and citrusy aftertaste with some maltiness. Nice mouthfeel and decent drinkability for its strength. A solid brew, waited over 10 years to try this.
Really great beer for just about all types of beer wizards..It had big rich malt, rich caramel, wonderful nose, and wonderful hop flavor.

i like big beers, and Stone is arguably my favorite brewer, but this one is an ever so slight miss for me, if only by Stones lofty standards. the culmination of the parts come out as a touch harsh to my tastebuds. Try the double bastard or the oaked AB, which are both excellent, but this is still some pretty good stuff...just not AS good "
Flaska från Systembolaget. Klar mörk kopparfärgad vätska med stort fluffigt skum. Doftar karamell och kåda. Kraftig maltig smak, tjära, kåda, lakrits, maskrosbeska. Lite annorlunda men bra
Fat på Bishop Gustav. Skum öl. Smak och doft av choklad, torkad frukt, hostmedicin, halstabletter, grapefrukt, citrus och maskrosstjälk. Lagom sötma, spretiga smaker med långvarig beska.

Aroma: intense grassy and floral hops, light grain and caramel malts. Appearance: hazy brown, medium, frothy, beige head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, grass, flowers, light resin, Overall: nice American Strong Ale, very nice taste and palate. Bottle at Casino Inn, Alpine.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 500ml can served in a pint glass. 
A: Pours a clear deep amber color with lots of thin suspended particles. Forms a big and creamy beige head with good retention and lots of soapy lingering lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Sweet, fruity, roasted and herby nose. Strong notes of toffee, roasted malts and caramel malts. Notes of grapefruit, grass, resin, pine and orange zest. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Notes of grapefruit, toffee, caramel malts, grass, zest and pine. Strong bitterness punch in the end: Quite dry and persistent grassy bitter finish. 
M: Full body. Average carbonation. Caramel and grass in the aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. Strong but well introduced bitterness. 
[ BA Review @ 11/7/2009 ]

On tap, poured into a nonic glass. A light citrus aroma gives way to candy sugar, then a light coffee and light woody note comes through with some caramel late - some extra points for complexity. It pours a murky red brown color with a lught brown / orange colored head. Thr head consists of fuzzy microbubbles and retains a medium thick ring with dusty, fuzzy surface, and it leaves a decent web lace. The taste is medium high bitter and a medium sweet. The sticky and slick textured beer has a medium full body and soft, fuzzy carbonation. Flavors of burnt bread, pine, and grapefruit membrane come through initially with some light coffee and milk chocolate sneaking in late. A woody and smokey character finishes it amd a burnt / charred aftertaste - maybe some dark chocolate too - is strong and lingers with a touch of coffee grounds and a hint of fruit. Nice subtle complexities to this one.
Sample @ a tasting event. Deep amber body with a medium white head. Citrus, toffee, pine. A bit raw.

Flaska, privatimport. 
Grumlig orangebrun vätska med lättare skum. 
Doftar maltigt, kola, blommigt. 
Smörkolesmak med fruktiga inslag. 
Kraftfull beska. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark chestnut coloured body with a medium head. Fresh hoppy aroma. Nice and hoppy taste. Starts like an IPA but without the bitter end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tilt, Oslo. Slightly hazy deep amber with an off-white head. Malty and caramelly aroma with lots of hops. Pine, citrus herbs and hints of cat piss. Fairly sweet with nice hoppy and fruity flavours and bitter finish. Balanced and very enjoyable. A bit too much on the sweet side for my taste, but still very nice!

Interesting aroma of malt, spices, floral, sugars and hops. Color of a dark ruby with disappearing white head. Medium bitterness and carbonation. Pine hop and floral hop start. Sugar/spice finish. Smooth.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle with a Best By date of 11/17/2014. 
Aroma is sweet with some nuttiness, moderate toasted bread, caramel and toffee. Moderate hop notes with pine resin and grapefruit. Light fruit esters. 
Pours a cloudy, copper, burnt amber with some brown hues and a small, light tan head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges. Medium light lacing and medium legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with some caramel and toasted bread with a light nuttiness. Light toffee notes as well. Moderately strong to strong bitterness. Medium light hop flavor, mostly pine resin but also some grapefruit. Some light alcohol notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer but way maltier than the hoppy beers I prefer to drink. Malt profile isnt too bad, and the hops work with it well. Is suppose for what it is, its pretty nice.

Big Bottle. Black. One of a kind. Aggressive. Strong taste. 7.2%. 'I' didn't like it, not for everyone!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I love big hoppy beers. For some reason this one didnt taste quite right. Its definitely hop forward but its not balanced in a way that suits my palate.
Really bold hops and caramel. Over top, I enjoyed that aspect, soemwhat sweet. Definatly one of a kind

Delicious and dark, this one has nice flavor that lasts and lasts. I like it a lot

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Enjoy by date is 08/19/14. A month past its date but oh well. chestnut dark brown color with nice dark beige colored creamy head. Notable lacing. Aroma is malty, citrus, hops, piney, slight earthiness, sweet malts, biscuit maltiness. Flavor is orange, citrus hops, caramely, lots of sweet maltiness. Nice dark fruits in the middle of the mouth. Noticeably bitter finish. Nice mouthfeel as well. Really creamy.

22oz bomber from liquor store on 101 in Encinitas. Great brew, a little too much hops for style for me....dont get me wrong but I love hops but reserve it for IPAs great malts just a little too hop centric for an ASA.

Fantastic beer, very hoppy. Great taste - I could drink this all day long. One of the best IPA's I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bottle from Albertsons in Hillsboro, OR. Aroma has hints of raisins, cloves, and leather. Mouthfeel is creamy, smooth, and sweet at first, then bitterness takes over and lasts long into the finish and aftertaste. Definitely worth repeating.
Keg draught half pint at the Head of Steam, Durham. Deep reddish brown body. Thin off white head. Malt and red fruit. Cherries. Some sour limes. Sherbet. Bitter with sweet notes. Dry finish.
Bottle (22oz $5): Pours a clear dark red with off white head. Lots of hopps, lots of malt Citrus smell. Pretty good beer but I personally do not like the bitter after taste.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 Caña en Cimmeria 13..11..2015 sin cambios. Increíble amargo final persistente. Para repetir sin duda.
Botella de 65 cl en cimmeria 12-09-2014 (cata). Edición 2014. Color ámbar oscuro cobrizo turbio. Aromas bastante lupulados con toques de caramelos ligeramente tostados. Cuerpo medio con 7.2 vol. Sabores iniciales que recuerdan a las red ales con tonos maltosos dulces de caramelos ligeramente tostados, aunque por poco tiempo pues el regusto amargo seco se va incrementando cada vez mas, perdurando durante un buen rato en boca. Bastante buena, increíble final amargo seco duradero. Gran cerveza.
Very dark amber/red with this off white head. Aroma is malty with some fruit. Complex malty flavor with a little citrus finish.
Hoppy fruity aroma, pours a dark murky red, lots of hops and leaves with a bitter aftertaste, full bodied and creamy, did I mention hops, excellent ale, I am worthy.
Bomber (enjoy by 10.2.14) - Dark transparent ruby. 1 finger off white head. Just all around good. Evenly malt & hop balance. The slight high abv is not noticeable. Personally, a beer many may enjoy.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 22oz bottle from Wegmans, West Seneca, NY. An attractive deep copper colour with a thick, frothy, cream head, looking like a good English ESB; inviting caramel malt aroma; thick malty body with the sweetness very nicely balanced by some powerful hops that add a woody dryness and a touch of spice; the finish is long resinous and dry with some lingering biscuity malts and a hint of grapefruit. A really good sipping beer. [3-Sep-14 7/5/7/4/16 =3.9]50cl can from Beer52.com, brewed in Berlin. Hazier than previously, but otherwise no different from my earlier review of the Californian version. [25-Feb-17 7/4/7/7/16=3.8]

I have start with a slight proviso...I had a few before trying this one and it probably...almost definately tipped me over the edge...I started dancing for crying out loud! Its a poky little number, drinks very well and I enjoyed it alot. I dont remember and especially lively aroma and its on the belgian side of ales style wise. Hmmm, will have to try it again to be sure.
Theyre right, I dont like it. Beer doesnt have to be about a pissing contest. Ive had far smoother whiskeys straight.

Transfer from BA review on 2-23-13-
 Served on tap in a snifter glass

 Appearance-Served a mahogany colored brew with ruby highlights shining throughout. Upon serving there is a one finger cream colored head that fades rather quickly to leave a persistent film on the top of the brew and a very nice level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is a nice mix of bready malts, caramel, and a moderate hop aroma. The hop while mainly grapefruit citrus in nature is also mixed with aromas of a pine hop aroma as well. 

Taste  The taste begins with a bready and biscuit base with a lighter caramel sweetness. Up front there are also some hop flavors of a pine nature. The caramel fades as the taste advanced with the pine getting stronger and more potent. While the caramel fades, fruit flavors of a light cherry and apple flavor come to the tongue. While the pine levels out in the middle, it is joined by a lighter grapefruit citrus hop flavor. This citrus grows stronger more toward the end of the taste with it, when mixed with the rest of the flavors, leaving a bitter pine and citrus flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel-The body of the beer is on the slightly creamier side with a carbonation level that is a b it on the higher side. The creaminess allows all the hop flavors of the brew a chance to linger on the tongue, while the carbonation level makes it easier drinking and more refreshing. 

 Overall  A quite tasty brew. Its on the hoppier side, but balanced quite nicely by the sweeter fruit, caramel, and more malty flavors of the brew. Its well know for a good reason; its quite a good moderate strength IPA.

Aroma: Bittering Hops, Resin, Mildly Bready

Appearance: Dark Amber Hue, Passes Mild Light, Off White Head, Great Lacing

Taste: Bittering Hops, Resin, Bready Malts

Mouthfeel: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter
Bottle at home. Pours deep red, nose is malty, fruity, taste is bitter, juicy citrus.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 A very well represented bitter ale. Dark in appearance with a an an eggshell coloured head. Creamy on the palate. Smells of bitterness. Tastes bitter. Looks aggressively bitter, it is the menace it claims to be.

Bottle At Barely Legal Tasting Room . 
Pours dark copper/ redbrown . Good white head . 
Smell is weak , bit of old-ale aspects, bit of bitterness . 
Taste is bitter, some old-ale aspects again . Bitter aftertaste . 
best to be descibed as an english bitter, with some old-ale maltyness . Nice

Just back from France where Ive been drinking lots of Belgian beer, so on my return I really fancied something like a classic English ale. And this is something like a classic English ale. It looks the part; reddy brown with a really good off- white head leaving lacing all the way down. Medium bodied, slightly creamy - could have been pulled from the cask in a small village pub, but was instead imported from San Diego by my lovely local beer shop. Not much aroma. Main flavour is bitterness at the beginning, followed by a bitter middle section and a bitter finish. Beneath that - malt, caramel, grapefruit, and more buried under the bitterness. If this had just been pulled in an English village pub, Id have another, even if only to try and pick out the other flavours lurking beneath the, did I mention, bitterness. And buried beneath the hype - a very good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 1/3 served in teku, Brewdog Notts. Taste of every dark thing that exists, coffee, carmel, whisky, cherry and so much more. perfectly balanced. Slight taste of alcohol, great appearance and great aroma. Really nice one!

22oz bottle. Cloudy deep red with a frothy off-white head. Flavors are bread, caramel, sugar, resinous hops, pine, grapefruit and toasted malts with earthy and nutty notes. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Bottle at a tasting. Pour is amber with a small creamy head, aroma is caramel and malty. Taste is malty, light candied fruits and a long finish with bitterness. Very nice

Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale claims you are not going to like this beer. I wouldnt go that far, but it isnt great either. Some fresh hop aroma coming from a dark pour with a thinner head. Taste is nicely balanced with strong malt and some simple hop character. There is a bit of an alcohol bite mixed with a bit of bitterness on the finish. Arrogant Bastard is not too bad for an underachiever - poor bastard. :)

Tap. Rich amber with off white head. Lacing all the way down. Lots of grain and caramel on nose. Slightly sterile. Mild orange. Medium body. Sweet on start, bitter on finish. High abv masked well. A bit think on palate. Lacks finesse, but solid nonetheless.

An old Stone classic. Pours a deep, copper with a tan head. Aromas are at first malty sweetness, some honey, floral hops, with a bit of spice and earth. Taste is mostly dominated by the heavy hopping. With a lil bitter finish and a relatively bright mouthfeel. Almost expect/hoped for a bigger richer body. American strong, hoppy brew.

I really enjoyed reading the reverse marketing they use to try and make one feel like a sissy for not liking this beer. I do like this beer, but would like to use the same method in my review. Poured into a paper Dixie cup on a bench at the Chicago Greyhound station, It looks like a Killian red Guinness, smells of urine and diesel fumes, or maybe thats my surroundings, cant tell. I smell adult diaper from 3 days prior but that may be the trash can Im laying my head upon. This beer hits the 7% and you get the points for that. The design on the double deuce bottle would make an awesome tattoo, if I were 12 years old, had no imagination, and actually used the word awesome after 1986. Great job on the beer guys, but dont try to pull the Jedi mind trick on me when marketing, it might insult me.
Big bottle dont know how big hey USA go metric big hoppy aroma dark amber in colour taste is hoppy but with good malty back bone

Nu snackar vi. Bra öl. Snygg som få. Fin färg. God eftersmak och helt klart värd priset. Även på krogen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours fairly clear ruby with nice white head. Nose is some chocolate and caramel. Taste is mix of sweetness and bitterness. Bitter on the backend.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Draft at Dudley?s Pizza. Clear dark Amber color. Nice hoppy flavor. Low head and carbonation. Nice beer though.
Deep red amber in the glass. Cream-colored head. Hoppy, fruity aroma. Tasted like burnt caramel. Light on the palate. Decent.

Bottle from the Bottle Shop in Lancaster. Pours deep chestnut with a rocky tan head. Starts with a bit of sweetness with creamy caramel and pineapple. Finishes with a long lingering bitter pine finish. An amazing beer that lives up to the hype.
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark reddish amber with an off-white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are pine, resin, nuts, and caramel - with a bitter finish.
Pint, on draught at The Good Beer Company Singapore. Dark, with a nice head. Good aroma. Hoppy with an agtetbite. Great beer....will try again.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2015 12oz tulip. Dark ruby-red brown, thin head. Smell is roasted malt, stone fruits, subtle caramel and coffee with a hint of fresh hops. Taste is dark toast with some fruity caramel notes. Pretty solid all-around.
Excellent. Bottle from Stone Sampler bought at Father and Sons. Pours hazy brown into a snifter. Bold caramel and malty aroma. Taste is huge. This is a great beer from a great brewery
I rate beers I think significantly better than average, simple as that. I am not into showing off through bloviating. :)
Pours a hazy brown with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, bread, citrus, fruit and hops. Taste is heavy sweet leading to a well balanced hoppy finish. Pretty awesome.

From a 650ml bottle on 13/7/2014 (shared with Butz). Pours a cloudy deep brown with a biggish off white head. Has a relatively subtle malty aroma featuring caramel and toffee. However, theres nothing subtle about the flavour which is massive, rich, complex and impressive. This is a real all rounder in terms of character. Theres a ton of malt with caramel, butterscotch, toffee and toast, along with some spicy rye, some sweet citrus and dark fruit, peel, and bog load of big resiny, bitter hops to finish it off. Has a creamy texture and average carbonation. This actually tastes bigger than 7.2%. A magnificent beer.

Pours a reddish brown, hazy, and had a small khaki head. Aroma is very malty and sweet smelling. Some citrus fruit hops in the background as well. Taste is caramel, bread, roasted grains, grapefruit, and some lemon. Full body and good carb. Too much malts for me, but overall decent brew.

Look: pours a cloudy light brown or dark red. Head is thick and looks like something from a soda.
Smell: fruity citrus aroma. Very sweet smell like a barleywine. Makes my mouth water. Dark fruit.
Taste: bitter up front. Apples and other dark fruit. Lots of alcohol. Slight malt after taste.
Feel: thick film on the mouth. Very dry. Medium to carbonation
Overall: ok, not as fruity as I like. Definitely a stone beer. Similar to a hoppy barleywine.

Poured from a 650ml bottle, dark reddish brown, tan head, aroma is rasiny malt and spicy hops a little celery. Flavor is spicy hops with some pine, dark fruit flavor from the malt. Medium mouthfeel medium carbonation.

The beer has a beautiful dark ruby red hue with good clarity and a creamy light tan head. The thick creamy head has good retention and slowly fades to a thin cap of frothy foam. From this head I get lots of cool lacing and lace rings on the glass. It has a big juicy citrusy hop presence over nice bready maltiness in the background. There is a good solid mix of bready, caramely, grainy malt with loads of juicy of citrusy, grapefruity, lemony, and piney hop notes. The hops bring solid bitterness which slowly fades off the tongue deep into the finish. The palate has a firm yet still easy drinking texture with active carbonation and a good solid medium to full body.
A malt lovers dream, toasty, roasted, goodness. Caramel notes, with a nice hop bitterness without being overpowering. A really well balanced beer.
Good bitter ale, caramel flavor and good malt. Nice taste and would great again. Bitterness isnt overpowering, but makes the beer unique.

Bottle pour. Dark hazy amber. Light bready aroma with lots of hops. Strong bitter hop taste with a long aftertaste. Well made beer, but not my type.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22 oz. Bottle from local liquor store....Drinkable but heavy lemon peel taste....love the aroma but again....not a fan of lemon peel....love lemons, not the peel
Pours a deep clear amber reddish color with white head. Floral notes, some caramel malt, a little spice on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some malt.

Fresh 12 oz. bottle. Pour is a nice deep transparent amber with a sticky lacy off-white head. Aroma is a sweet caramel earthy malt with maybe some dark fruit. Big hop character, pine and citrus. Taste is similar, big flavorful bready sweet malt with piny bitterness with grapefruit and sweet citrus in the finish. Really good one.

A: strong malt characteristic with the his coming through as a resin finish. Smells of alcohol 

A: pours clear caramel color with off white head. Big and frothy with a lot of lacing

T: well balanced. A lot of buttering hops. Little hop flavor. A big beer but drinkable. 

M: medium carbonation. Finishes almost creamy. 

O: this is the beer that got me into craft beer so I will always be partial. Strong malt characteristic and a big beer but well made

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Chocolate, toffee,caramel, alcohol aroma. Dark ruby appearance, great lacing, medium white head. Medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, average carbonation, Bitter end. Great and complex beer!

On tap at Dan's. The pour is a deep ruby/brown pour, lightly opaque with a small head of medium khaki that leaves some great lacing. The aroma is strongly malty with a subtle underlying hop to it. Very good and very deep. A nice caramel and earthiness hides a bitterness that's just lying in wait. The taste is definitely sweet and malty up front but then this arrogant bastard just blasts you with a great bitter hoppiness. Lightly floral, strongly bitter, and nicely malty on the back end. The mouth feel is light, but had great carbonation backing it up with a lingering, very dry, bitter, malty aftertaste. I like it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer. Nice head retention and color. Good aroma, malt, caramel, some chocolate. Excellent taste, sweet in the beginning and bitter finish.
Great beer! Well worth a try. Great aroma and flavor and the high alcohol content helps too :)

Appearance- very dark ruby, pretty opaque, one finger off-white head which is thick and foamy. Aroma- caramel and toffee, malts, hoppy, yeast, sugary fruit, bread. Taste- loads of hop bitterness and a firm malt backbone. Toffee, sugary raisin, hop resins, boozy fruitcake. Cherry and hints of marzipan come through as it warms. Mouthfeel is sticky and a bit oily. Bitterness clings to the mouth and tongue and lasts forever. Impressive.

Unbelievable that I havent rated this yet after having it many times from the bottle and draft. Pours reddish copper color with a small off white head that leaves rings of lace. The aroma and flavor have PNW hops, caramel malts, raisins, wood, with herbal and earthy character good bittering hops, medium body, complex and very well balanced. Prior to ratebeer this was a beer I drank quite a bit of at home and out.

Picked up a bomber. Pours a reddish brown with minimal khaki colored head. The aroma is bland with some subtle caramel malt notes. Despite some reviews mentioning strong hop notes I do not detect any. Taste is initially sweet malt but quickly transitions to a strong bitterness that lingers into the finish. Full bodied and creamy.
I'm a mexican arrogant bastard, love the taste and the beer quality. Mexican beer tastes like piss.
Kick ass American ale. Nice brown copper color with small lacing. Slight citrus with malty flavors with a bitter finish.very good ale

this is the best damn beer on the market love it and is my favorite out of all the other beers. I drink 2 cases of beer a week always trying something different then I found this and Im hooked on in. you truly have to love beer and have the sophistication to enjoy a finely crafted beer like this one, you guys nailed it. Ill be buying arrogant bastard ale from here on out. I would like to see this sold in kegs. hats off to stone brewery.
This beer has a great taste to start but leaves a less desirable finish. Great aroma but wished the beer tased as good as the smell
une bière pour homme sans compromis, un gout qui persiste en bouche et un prix très compétitif I want more of this!!
650ml bottle. Dark brown. Awesomely bitter. Strong and solid. The style isnt particularly something i cant get enough of or anything but i liked it a lot. Ill dig more of Stone thats for damn sure.

Very drinkable beer. Great and unique mix. Like a strong IPA with some light smoked malt, citrus hops and all matched well. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Basically a slightly dark IPA with some smoke. Very sessionable for what it is. On tap at DC Summerfest.
On tap at Tap House Grill, Seattle. Hefty and hoppy ale with citric and salty notes. Full bodied and oily with long bitter finish. Doesnt get much better than this.

650 ml bottle (enjoy by date 7/8/14) poured into shaker. Remarkable garnet color with a generous dense foam cap that exhibits excellent retention and lacing. Strong aroma of caramel, pine and grapefruit. Flavor follows suit, with short-lived malty sweetness giving way to a lingering resinous bitter finish. Feels downright creamy on the palate. While this isnt my favorite Stone offering, its still a great beer.

A very powerful, majestically bold ale! Poured from a bomber. Beautiful ruby red body. Creamy, off-white head. Smells of hops and malt. Tastes of caramel and big hops! A fantastic balance of hops and malt. Almost perfect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 FL. OZ ($4.99) I had a few beers by the maker now and this seems like a lower rung beer thats aimed for tap use. not very amazing and didnt impress me. dont for a second think its bad its still a great brew but not amazing and for these reasons worth the try.

This beer has it all. With a unbreakable malt backbone of caramel, molasses and roastyness, and then the power and bitterness of the hops balance it all together. The malt and the hops are fighting each other but they are equally matched. Big body on it, but it was so good I could drink more than one.

What can i say about this beer, other than its friggin awesome. This brew is really interesting and very aggressive. Kinda like an extremely malty ipa. Very hoppy like stones ipa, but also very thick and malty. I was kinda sceptical goin in but the hoppiness and maltiness actually pair together quite nice. Definitely one of my favorite beers. Keep it up Stone
Aroma of caramel roasted barley, toasted perfectly by hephaestus himself. Appearance matches the color of the bottle perfectly. Taste is near zenith. Palate is exceptional. Best beer tasted ever.

As per usual a very solid offering from Stone. Plenty of hops here and the drying bitterness drives a very long length. Dark fruits, old oak (i know its not oaked!) and bitter licorice. Quite serious really.

On tap at Craft Beer Co Amber to Reddish color with a thick two finger off white head. Aroma is malty with plenty of hops. Strong hop flavour balanced with great malty character with a good amount of bitterness.
Bomber. Pours dark brown with tan head. Malty, with full body. Surprisingly bitter on the finish. Overall very enjoyable.

Reddish color with a thick off white head. Aroma is pine, barley, and hops. Strong hop flavor with a nice, sweet malt backbone. Evenly balanced for how bitter it is at first. 

Wife: 4.1
OMG! The bitterness wont go away! Even after 10-15 minutes!

Nice stable head. Smell is of fruits and fresh grass. Aroma is citrus and herbs. A little bit too much bitterness.
Poured from bomber given to me by fellow musky hunter brad....great american strong...great malt taste....another strong showing from stone.

A dark malty aroma with cascade come from this brown ale with a bit of cream colored head. A chocolaty malty crisp taste with an aftertaste of bitter cascade hops if my pallet serves me correctly. Surprisingly a light/medium body come with this 7.2%. A great brew from stone. Theres no burn from the alcohol and the malt and bitter ratio is almost perfect.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2014 From 22oz bomber.  Pours a copper color with hue of ruby red on glass when backlit. Aroma is hops, malt, yeast and pine. Flavor is more pine, malt, citrus. Full-bodied. From Stone event at Brickskeller 6/1/09.
Its not bad but its just not flavorful enough as the double bastard or the oaked arrogant bastard i prefer those

Nice a dark brown with a white foamy head. This is definitely a strong ale, but quite nicely balanced IMHO. A nice roasted pine sense, not hoppy enough to remind me of an IPA...I read that comment and dont understand it

This has a nice medium body with a bit of a sticky feel and ending with a nice bitter touch. This would be an excellent addition to any meal and would definitely recommend to anyone that enjoys a nice craft. This would work almost anywhere.

Poured into tulip, a hazy brown with small white head that resided quickly. Aroma was citrus hops and caramel and toffee of the malts. Taste was same but with an alcohol note. Finish was a mix of the malts and citrus with the warming of the alcohol. Nicely done.

Birthday present from s_hartshorne. Bottle. Burgundy beer with medium frothy head. Aroma of malts and fruit. Taste is dry fruits, caramel, autumn leaf and malts. There is an astringency in the finish. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Keg at Stone @ San Diego Airport, 22/04/14.
12th most rated beer on RB and one Ive had a few times over the years but with an hour or so to kill before my flight to Maui (via SFO) on a day of limited ticks -there was only one outcome!!!
Rich amber with a good sized beige head that retains well.
Nose is caramel, light spice, candied fruit peel, dark fruits, toffee.
Taste comprises caramel, fruit loaf, dark fruit rind, spice, light booze but very well in check.
Medium bodied, smooth on the palate, very light alcohol and hoppy tinges in the close.
Decent strong.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle, 650ml. Pours a clear, deep ruby/copper head with a rich, creamy head with beautiful lacing. Sweet nose with some great hoppiness. Very smooth and very heavy. Robust body with a fiery roasted malt character and a packing finish. You probably wont like it.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Good ruby red tan head low retention. Aroma is vinous fruits pine. Taste is same good malty back bone long hoppy bitter finish lots of alchol present. Nice body and mouthfeel. Really good strong ale.
For me, this comes far too close to an IPA. Has a pretty hoppy taste,can really taste the alcohol in my opinion and it is a bit heavy in consistency. Has a great hoppy, floral aroma.

No lack of character but a little over done. Thats the idea I guess. Unsubtle alcohol, resin levels of hops, roasty, and some yeast in its long lingering finish. Fun to wrestle with and good with flavorful food.

Pours a dark, mahogany type amber showing carbonation and has a white bubbly head thats almost non existent. Smells of sweet hops, lightly roasted malt, kind of a metal drum smell like a red ale but smells like a beer Id drink. Enjoy by 5/24/14 drank on 4/23. Packs a hop punch but not a huge one. Has a slightly heavy mouth-feel and just about a perfect light carbonation. You kind of get a mix of alcohol and hoppy taste but not overpowering at all, then it quickly subsides with a dry finish. A Classic

This has become a Classic and good go-to beer, just not sessionable. It does tiptoe very close to the IPA line. Nice blend of hops and caramel malt aromas. Amber color that looks almost like some Belgian strong ales. Palate is full and somewhat weighty with high carbonation. Hops are up front but immediately followed but a caramel malt sweetness . Grainy flavors with bread and a dry finish round it out. A must try.

Interesting blast of bitterness out of the bomber. Then....as if by magic it disappears. Then its enjoyable and I could imagine ordering another if I were at a bar. Cool deep copper color nice head thats thin but hangs right in there. Not too shabby...Probably great with grilled meats,would buy again.
Bottle from Bier Huis, Ossett. Clear, dark amber. Pale tan, thin, tight, lasting head. Looks boss. Bitter dark cherry chocolate. In a glass. With a head on it. Lovely.
Sweet nose with hints of chocolate. Alcohol in the taste with a bitter finish. Well balanced with piney hop notes. Would definitely repeat but only on certain occasions.
Nice, classic, American strong ale with a strong hop presence. Dark brown pour from bomber, malty front, hoppy finish.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 Second rating on this one: Bomber, less than 1 month from bottle date. Mahogany color, 1/2 inch tan creamy head with lacing. Very little aroma, bitter, grapefruit taste backed up with some maltiness.  Detect a little bread in the back of the throat. Bitterness is strong and upfront, but not so overpowering as to ruin the beer. If you like bitter, you will probably like this.

(backlog recollected in abstinence) Shared tap pitcher, shared at Pork Slope, Brooklyn 09/2012.Thanks to Steve and John for taking us here!). Welcome palate rinser after an evening of bbq-sauce clad swine debauchery. Comes complete with the signature Stone palate cleaver hop profile, heavy on spruce and citric rind astringent bitterness (going on flowery, green resins) - at that clinically clean, yet from tap mercifully mellowed out by a solid and crisp pale malt randiance. Not necessarily an ideal subtle aperitif, but very well made.
Beautiful beer reach deep color. Aroma is floral hops. Taste is indeed aggressive with a strong hop flavor throughout accented by small roasty notes

This is my go-to beer for everyday enjoyment. Its got the bitterness of a really good IPA, but also has body and smoothness. The nose is wonderful, and the aftertaste is forever. The only minor flaw is that the head is just a little too bubbly and doesnt last quite as long as one might like. Now that its in the local Costco, there is absolutely ZERO reason to experiment around. For a quiet evening at home, this is THE ONE.
Bottle. Deep reddish brown color. Aroma is brown sugar, resin. Taste is licorice, bubblegum, dank hops. Bitter, alcoholic aftertaste. All these are good things. Very well crafted brew.

Brown. Hints of red. Off-white head. Malt, wort, hop and alcohol nose. Sweet. Some bitterness. High carbonation. A bit lower than medium body, which is a bit too thin for this beer in my opinion. Pine, citrus, malt, some wort, hint of metal aroma.

Bottle. Pours clear reddish brown with a big lasting beige head that leaves great lacing. Aroma of malt, caramel and grass. Medium body, medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter taste, soft carbonation, flavors follow the nose with the addition of citrus and spruce bitterness. Finish starts sweet and ends bitter. Wonderfully balanced and complex.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 Aptly named marque brew that is full bodied, brilliantly balanced, and a definitive benchmark of the style.

Arrogant Bastard is much as it's written on the back of the bottle. It's a delicious, up front ale that steps up and satisfies.

Ar: Zesty orange, juicy - some faint toasted caramel.

Arrogant Bastard Ale. Weve all had it, we all know what it is. Stone again can do no wrong. Ive had this beer on a number of occasions. From on tap to bombers of this stuff. Picked up another bottle the other day for shits and giggles. I wanted to rate this classic and I needed a reminder of exactly what it was I would be dealing with. I cracked it open and poured it into pint glass and right away I was shocked at the massive head of this thing, and it would not go away. You could have built a house on the froth or used the stuff to spackle cracks in boat hulls. I needed a machete to hack through the foam and get to the actual liquid essence of this thing. That is exactly how Stone would have wanted it. The color is a beautiful dark amber with bubbles elevating from minute imperfections in the glass. Resin, pine and hops on the nose. Gives way to toffee and dank malt. The finish is dry and bitter, intense hops at the very end, everlasting on the pallet. At one point when this beer came out it was way more aggressive in comparison to the field now it seems to have found a nice home in the middle of the pack. Still a delicious beer and worth a try for anyone serious about beer.
Super hoppy and delicious! Strong and bold flavor with a solid aftertaste of hops.

Big rich body, oily, sticky, resiny, lingers long on the palate. Moderately high carbonation.
Palate explodes with big upfront malt; more biscuit and toffee sweetness. Hops cut through with a barrage of citrus rind, dried herbs, cut grass and pine needle. Strong lingering persists, well balanced, alcohol sneaks in pretty much undetected.
Big brash hoppy beer; does what it says on the label!

Bomber from Jan 23, 2012 poured into snifter. Pours a deep, hazy, caramel brown with a thick white head that wont quit. Aroma of rich malt, booze, hops, light caramel. With a name like Arrogant Bastard, a beer tends to gain a reputation. Not to sound too Shakespearean, but this beer would be just as delicious if it were wearing another title. The fact that this ale is actually worthy of its shamelessly pretentious name just makes it even better. The bold hop flavors are spectacular. They create an herbal sensation that counterbalances the toffee-like malts. With flavor like this, one can afford to be an Arrogant Bastard.

Bb: 06.28.11

A: Pours a dark brown, when held to the light, a toasted orange. Excellent clarity. Less than single finger of toasted peanut head which falls quickly leaving a sheet of the same. Spotty lacing.

S: Piney, resiny hop profile. I take a couple deep breaths and the sweet malty backbone comes through. Brown sugar, candi sugar. 

T: Bitter, arrogantly bitter. Nicely balanced. I know they label this as an American strong ale, but it reminds me of a balls-deep amber with the capacity to satisfy and challange the palate. I rarely skip over the actual adjectives and tote the skill in formation. Pine, bitter, amber, sweet, tea-like hops. 

M: medium to heavy body with low to medium carbonation. Slicks the palate ever so lightly.

O: Outstanding beer. Nuff said.

FROM NOTES: July 3, 12
Poured from a 22 ounce bomber into a Stone pint glass.

A: Moderate citrus hop aroma with a hint of biscuit and caramel notes. 
A: Pours a nice dark red/amber color with a foamy tan head with great retention.
T: Initially a mix of the malt sweetness matched with bold hop flavor, finishes with the dry biscuit flavor and malt sweetness lingers on the palate. 
P: Medium to full bodied and great carbonation. 
O: A complex contrast of malt sweetness and full hop flavor creates a really drinkable beer that still packs a punch. Ive had it numerous times but just got around to reviewing. It NEVER disappoints, nor does the world-class Stone Brewery.

Bottle with mR_fr0g at his place on 12 October. Poured a dark amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma of cloves, caramel and butterscotch. Treacle and toffee flavours with pine hop bitterness. Finish is slightly astringent, but still rather tasty with hop resins and chewy dry malts.

Pours a dark amber with small off white slightly yellowish head. The aroma is of strong grapefruit. Super hoppy like nothing else I have had before with a very mellow & soft powdered sugary sweetness in the background. Very full palate and long lasting bitterness just the way I like it. This is the perfect balance of being super hopped up and not overpoweringly sweet like other imperial IPAs & barley wines tend to be. A+

Grass and flowers. Not lasting aroma. Great lace, decent head, mediocre pale brown color. Bitter and malty, with a good texture and med to full body. Med sour too. Long palate with liquor notes. A bit smoky. Good beer.
Aroma of grapefruit and hops, bitter taste slightly complex, yeast, hops and grapefruit. Bitter citrus rind finish

I tried this years ago and totally hated it. My tastes have changed... 22oz bomber from Julios. Pours out a lovely deep amber with a nice frothy light tan head. Earthy-alcohol aromas. Body is heavy. Flavor is complex, with a long lingering musty-earthy sweet bitterness. Hop profile is "classified" on the Stone website... doesnt matter cause they are so muddled.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 171013
Bottle, 7.2%. Clear dark amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, caramel, little toasted and hops. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, hops, medium sweet, pine and quite bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are roast malt, wood, caramel, bitter hops and has a long bitter finish. Nice.

Bomber into snifter glass, clear deep ruby brown color with light tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, brown sugar, some fruit and piney/resin hops. Taste is definitely a hop hit, heavy piney/citrus notes, balanced with kind of a candy malt sweetness with notes of dark dried fruits, slight nuttiness and toffee. Medium body, moderate carbonation, bitter, strong with lingering hoppy finish. This is a tasty hop heavy monster.

22 fl oz bottle. Pours a clear ruby/brown with a frothy, one and a half finger, light tan that thins to a film but never truly disappears. Every time i take a sip a cascade of bubbles makes a new ring around the edge. Medium lacing.Aroma has big bread and pine notes with hints of resin, caramel, chocolate and vanilla.Taste is a solid bitter with a balanced bitter aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Slightly slick and resiny texture with a dry finish. Overall very nice. Big bitter but balanced and not overdone. Looks great, smells better. A solid choice overall. Would buy again for sure.

Bottle at home from GBBF. Really clear copper / amber colour, persistent cream head. Aroma is caramel malt, with some pine resin. Flavour is assergive pine bitterness., light roast and big caramel malt. I find this a bit too bitter for me. Long lasting bitterness. Ligt sweet caramel. Medium full body. Average carbonation. A bit too one dimensional on the bittering.
Amber brown in colour. Aromas of toffee and caramel. High sweetness and a dry hop bitterness in taste. a good strong ale

Creek Resort in Death Valley. Tip: dont buy your beers in the shop, they are too expensive. Dark copper body with a red shine and beige head. A lot of hops in the nose. Taste of pine and light citrus hops. Medium carbonation. Medium bitter finish.

pours a smoky topaz/coca-cola brown with soapy tan head. body with ruby with light. head fades fast with draping, moderate lacing. Aroma of raisins, grains, cinnamon rolls with icing, grass and earth. Taste starts sweet with a bitter finish. sweet raisins turn to strong black coffee - bitter cherry and blackberry notes - with touches of almond and hazelnut, and caramel. Palate is thick and silky but has a clean finish. Full bodied with the perfect amount of carbonation (a staple of Stone brews). Dull bitterness in a delayed aftertaste. Overall a masterfully complex ale, with a balance of nutty malts and bitter pit-fruit hops. Should intrigue the stout fiend, but there is something here for the hop-lover.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Aromas of raisins, resin, alcohol, butterscotch. Dark orange-brown color with a brownish head. Flavors of orange, pine, hops, and butterscotch. Brighter than Id have guessed from the aromas. Flavors linger for a while. Really nice imperial ale.
In bottiglia. Colore mogano, aroma di malto, caramello, al palato malto, cereale, amaro secco.

Pours cloudy brown with creamy head. Nose is of toffee and caramel. Taste is of toffee, dried plums, vanilla. Mouth feel is smooth with some dry bitterness attached. Youll find this beer anywhere, and thank God for that.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Beautiful dark chocolate brown colour, sweet malty brown aroma, hops break down the sweetness of the beer. 
Re rated, from a can brewed in Berlin . A supremely well balanced beer , enough sweetness to warrant it being drunk at cellar temp, enough bitterness to keep coming back. Delicious
From draft. Beautiful deep copper color. Love the hoppiness!! Great after taste. Excellent way to do penitence!!
Love the beer, love the message! Great, aggressively hopped strong ale. Very complex and ages well too.

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy ruby-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of grainy roasted malts, herbal hops, milk chocolate, cherries and mango, with a hint of tobacco and brown sugar. flavour is quite one-dimensional, slightly earthy, with notes of toffee, liquorice, herbal hops and an all-dominating roasted-bitter earwax finish. medium to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Keg @ The Vintage, Leith. This is a badboy of a beer. Pours nice and dark, almost red wine on the nose with a real fruit (dark fruits, raisins, plums, prunes) it keeps up the nose in the mouth, quite fruity and with some chocolate as well.

1Pt 6FL OZ bottle from the shop of Furnace Creek Resort in Death Valley. Tip: dont buy your beers in the shop, they are too expensive. Dark copper body with a red shine and beige head. A lot of hops in the nose. Taste of pine and light citrus hops. Medium carbonation. Medium bitter finish. ***
Bottle from Utobeer. Dark amber with foamy head. Aroma is strong malt and some alcohol. Very nice balanced. Medium to full body. Great beer!
This is pretty much my ideal beer. Hoppy and malty. Very well balanced. This is a great beer.
Very good. Hopy but nice and well brewed. Nice aroma and aftertaste. Quite ebony features.

Bottle. Thank you Excellent Little Brother! Clear reddish brown with a lacy frothy white head. Hoppy aroma - some chocolate, delicate fruit and prune, delicate bitter taste, dried fruit and again - chocolate. Hops are apparent though. Medium body, carbonated, long, bitter finish.

Of course you try this beer for the first time because of the name and the attitude! It actually delivers. Pours a dark ruby brown with a tan foam. Immediate caramel taste that explodes to your roof then slowly fades but says on your nose. A great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Bottle from Craft Beer Base. Dark brown with tan head. Piney hops aroma. Some sweetness and alcohol taste. Packs a punch for only 7.2%

Served on-tap at One-Eyed Bettys in Ferndale, Michigan.

The beer is a dark, ruby-ish color. A very nice little head on it with super sexy lacing... a very pretty looking beer, for sure. Arrogant Bastard has a taste not quite like beers Ive had before... theres some bitterness in there, for sure, but its not as intense as it seems a lot of people like to describe it. The hops in this beer mixed with the malts balance it perfectly. Ive had some people try and tell me it tastes/feels "soapy", but I dont get that at ALL ... maybe thats because I had it on-tap. The taste is complex to the point where I cant pinpoint exactly how I remember it being, but it was interesting, and it was super tasty... a seemingly wild blend of hops and malt, and I couldnt get quite enough of my sample. Crazy drinkable, tasty beer.

Once again, I find myself at odds with my peers. Does hoppy equal bitter? I hope not! What I like is a well-hopped or dry-hopped IPA that has no bitter finish, and the few highly rated brews that are really bitter (and highly rated) I do not like. This one, once again, to me tastes like earwax.

Growler poured into a tulip, reddish brown with a 1" tan head that quickly dissipates. Nose is caramel, roasty, floral, dough. Taste is slightly bitter but balanced out by a nice malt flavor. This is an aggressive beer, but easy enough to drink. Goes down smooth.

Bomber/tap. Pours a deep redish/brown/amber with a light tan head. Wam bam in the face with brash piney hops! Caramel, light alcohol, touch of citrus and a toffee note also show. Pine resin, dank dank hops, a touch of dark fruits, some grapefruit rind, and warming alcohol in your chest make up this guy. Love this stuff....goes down pretty smooth dispite the abv. Hell yes!
Has a solid aroma. The taste is alright but has a somewhat off taste about it though. Not bas
Dark w/ brown head. Very nice grape and prune flavors mixed w/ hops. Full bodied and well balanced brew. Delish!
Great tasting beer that gets stronger the longer you drink it. Available in a few UK bars so good to it regularly appearing in the Bay Area during my recent visit to SF

I've only recently been introduced to The Stone Brewing Company. That said, from the very first sip I knew I was not a typical brew. It wasn't even a typical craft brew. My initial response to a Stone Brewing Company product was "Wow, I think this might be the best beer I've ever tasted!". That was the Stone IPA. This is my first try of Arrogant Bastard Ale and after my taste buds stopped screaming "Uncle!", my response was "Ahh, Seven Hells, that's good!!". The first thing that caught my attention was smell. I knew then that Fate, that sultry mistress with the warm hand and sensible footwear had pushed us together and I was truly in for a treat. The rich head on this beer is the equivalent of a steak dinner at the Buckhorn Exchange. Once the beer hits your tongue it's like a cacophony of flavors. It takes your mind a few seconds to catch up with it. This beer is almost too good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First tried at BJ's Brewhouse in ABQ. Nice color. Think head. VERY hoppy.

Lett fyldig og sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, karamell, sjokolade, melk, nøtter, kaffi. Fyldig smak med preg av mørk malt, humle, kaffi, gras, sjokolade, karamell, høy. God bitterhet som set litt. God.

Bomber poured a caramel brown with a tan head. Aromas of caramel, sweet malt, light citrus and pine. Flavor is caramel, sweet malt, bitter hops, light citrus and pine. Some sips are not too bitter. Others have a big bite to them.

Everything about this beer is absolutely brilliant. Gold standard for a strong ale.

22oz bottle. The bottle caught my eye and thought I'd give it a try. The beer has a strong bite with a lingering aftertaste. Also it's pretty cool they decided to use toxic materials for the bottle labeling, wasn't there alternatives to prevent that warning? 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 0z bottle. Pours dark carmel with a beige head. solid hoppy flavor of pine. Very balanced though. One of this brews highlights is the great mouth feel. I think the extra carbination hepls. savor this one.
Thick tan head with a floral nose. Bitter grapefruit taste with a strong hop finish.

Pours with a decent head that dissipates quickly on top of medium brown color. Balanced to the malty side and hides alcohol content well. Very drinkable

Bottle @ Exmouth Arms, London. Slightly clouded reddish brown, medium off white head, some lacing. Aroma, malty, hoppy, toffee, bread, .Taste, malty, slightly roasted, nice hoppy bitterness, fruity hoppy in the middle. Bitter hoppy dry aftertaste.
This is a beer? More like an elegant alcoholic drink. The vanilla and caramel is very noticable, it tastes great.

a basterdized pale ale with an amazingly balanced nose of hops and malt pours like a dark brown kinda gold beautiful pale ale status the taste is ridiculous and makes most other pale ales look like draft canadian or something STONE IS HELLA GOOD SEND YOUR BEER NORTH TO CANADA PLEASE PLEASE

huge hop aroma, very assertive. a bit of malt sweetness under the big hop aroma. mahogany tinted caramel color, rich off-white head. a battle between hop flavor, malt sweetness and hop bitterness. toasted caramel notes, serious hop bitterness. full throttle on all fronts. long bitter finish fades slowly, leaving a lot of lingering aftertaste of hops and malt. rich body.

22oz bottle. Pours dark amber, almost no foam. Flowery hop aroma with a bit of booze. Citrusy hop on the palate with a bit of malt backing.

Pours light brown with a nice fresh hop aroma. Initial flavor of strong citrus hops that lead to a balanced caramel malt backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This was the first craft beer I ever tried, which was about 3 years ago, and I remember thinking it tasted like tree bark. I couldnt get past a few sips from the bottle. Now that Im older I feel as if I can fully appreciate this beast. 

Hoppy aroma with some pine scents. When you drink it, it starts nice and smooth and sweet with said pine notes and some minor lemony and grapefruity flavors as well, but then you begin to notice the carbonation and the flavor profile quickly shifts to bitter and remains that way for the finish. Its this quick flavor shift quality that makes this beer really complex and interesting to me.

I love the appearance of this beer. Hold it up to a light source. Its blood red with a nice thick head. Great beer thats fun to drink at parties.

Bomber: mahogany with a creamy top. Woodsy earthy tones on the nose. Dry mellow start. Quick to a very nice bitter that lingers. This was the mast brazen beer I'd ever had some time ago. Tame by today's standards but a great beer regardless. Love it! ~m

--RaucusBacchus

22floz/650ml bottle into a shaker. Served cold.

Aroma: Interesting! Kind of piney, definitely some cascade hops. Theres also a kind of sweetness though. Unique!

Appearance: Dark, translucent, red mahogany body with a creamy, full, light khaki head.

Taste: Wow thatll wake you up in the morning. Very bitter hop bite, but a lingering woody sweetness that lasts and lasts and lasts...

Palate: Medium body. Extremely long and bitter finish.

Overall: Arrogant Bastard has a special place in my heart. It was one of my first craft beers. Excellent, intense brew.

This bear taste like a thousand rotting fruits all at once. It has a lovely smell and a great head to it. It took me a very long time just to finish the pint at the bar beside first ave in Minneapolis.
Bottle. Pour is deep ruby, large off white foamy head. Aroma is rich roasted malt, caramel, slight toasty grain. Taste is rich roasted malt, caramel, molasses, slight earthy hops.

From a bomber, pours deep amber, white head, well balanced, smooth, delicious... Excellent strong ale ...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A garrafa, o rotulo e o próprio nome da cerveja são essenciais e fazem parte da degustação! Mas, quando você serve e sente os aromas é que se percebe que a Stone Brewing realmente está certa em relação ao que é dito no rotulo.. O aroma é forte e traz notas de torrefação, um leve toque de baunilha, notas de algum tipo de madeira, enfim, o aroma assusta! E no sabor...o amargor é intenso! Ele traz também um dulçor leve/médio, notas de torrefação, açúcar queimado, e já no retrogosto o amargor domina, continuando por muito tempo com este gosto amargo, o que é uma delicia! No geral, realmente não é para quem não entende, mas ela é espetacular!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Contém um amargor forte que se coloca sobre notas um pouco adocicadas. Retrogosto que perdura. Ótima.

Tap at American Dream Pizza. Light, maple-syrup brown with brilliant amber highlights. Fine, 1-inch fine caramel head that stays. Aroma is lemon, pine forest, caramel. Body is light-medium with big, moderately coarse carbonation that make it lighter than it probably is. Flavor is lemon, grapefruit rind, pine sap, bitter resin, grapefruit, light and dry caramel sweetness. Big lingering bitterness. Refreshing though (thanks to body and non-astringent hop bitterness). The quintessential American beer (this is probably the 5th time Ive had it over 4 years).

Poured from a bomber. Dark amber with frothy head. Aroma is strong malt and some booze. Similar taste balanced by piney hop bitterness. Some dark fruit flavors come through as well. Some alcohol warmth on the finish. Medium body. Overall, a good beer, but a bit on the sweet side for me.
Pours dark amber with extremely thick beige head. Pungent hoppy aroma, strong hop and malt flavor. Lingering hop bitterness on the palate. Another fine example of Americas love affair with the hop.

Great beer with a strong malt backbone, a little more bittering at the back end then the front

---C.Gove

Very strong malt, and hops. Intense! Enjoyed this in San Diego in 2008 the first time after spending all day in the sun. Nice dark amber caramel color with slight caramel colored head. It looked and tasted perfect! Loved it. Second time I had it it was horrible. I wasnt hot and thirsty. Tasted of pine and too much bitterness. For me, its like Gator Aid; its great when youre hot&thirsty but otherwise not enjoyable.
This was a very good beer with a lot of flavor. Nice and hoppy with a strong malt backbone that finished with a small alcohol warmth.

I just opened a bomber, I like this beer a lot. I get a lot of bitter, but its not overkill. Beautiful color, finishes dark and bitter. Big citrus taset... I taste dark fruit somewhere in there, too. (Im worthy...)

Serving: from tap at Stellar Pizza, Ale, and Cocktails.

Aroma: didnt detect any particular aroma.

Appearance: small, light brown, initial head that quickly dissipated. No lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-red/brown body.

Taste: lightly sweet, fruity, initial flavor and moderately bitter, roasted finish with long duration.

Palate: medium-to-heavy body with oily texture and soft carbonation.

Overall: great taste. I look forward to drinking this again.

This is an arrogant bastard of a beer! I have a lot of respect for Stone, but this one isnt my favorite in the lineup. Its aggressive, Im not afraid, but it just really doesnt do for me as it does for many other people. Copper color, hoppy, malty, 7.2%, perhaps a little too much of something...

Everytime I have this beer I think i will finally conclude that its isnt all its cracked up to be. Everytime it surprises me again, as one of the best craft beers out there period! I think if stone had made it as some exclusive hard to find seasonal, it would get even high ratings than it already does. Has amazing spicy pine entry that finishes with lucious passionfruit understones. The complexity and depth of a barlywine melded with the drinkability of an apa...Even though their stupid "our beer is too intense for you" marketing gimmick has gotten old, stones flagship beers never will.

This beast has a lot to it. You get licorice, sweet alcohol and hops in the nose. Very pleasant indeed. Then along with the obvious hefty malt and pungent hops youd except theres a flavour I can only describe as marmite followed by a bitterness that almost hurts. Very interesting and well worth trying even if it isnt exactly to my taste.

Dark amber colour with a large, creamy head. Aroma of hops with some fruituness and orange. Strong flavour of hops and fruits with some foreground sweetness and a finishing hoppy bitterness. Taste of orange with a hint of caramell and grapefruit. Full body with a sticky carbonation.
A bit on the dark side for my taste. Pours a deep brown colour with a slight head. Pleasant strong taste.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 Dark ruby brown. Medium frothy creamy white head, lasting with streaks of drippy lace. Aroma is hoppy, a little sweet, a little boozy, pine, caramel, touch roasty, lightly fruity. Full body, creamy, soft carbo, a little sweetness, long bitter finish. After the palate catches up theres some really nice things happening here.

Hoppy aroma, a little caramel and pine. A little roasty Strong but refreshing aroma.
Very hoppy, pine. Almost creamy. A little toasty. Very hoppy, but not bitter really. A little, but its subdued...at least for me right now. A little sweet, maybe some dark fruit? Very interesting and delicious.

25 oz. bottle. Pours a clear deep ruby red color with a tan head. Aroma is balanced between hops and malt - neither stands out to me. Full-bodied, again the malt and hops is balanced very well. Slight roast flavor in the finish. Just a touch of a dry finish. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased a growler from my local craft beer "to go" shop. I like the aggressive taste of this ale. Nice bitterness and bold flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

We were drunk in Vegas, cruising a shitty drug store on the strip, and trying to find our booze fix for the night. My friend spies one of these in the cooler and argues that I am uniquely suited to such a beer. He couldnt have been more correct. Pounded one back, and our night of gambling, comped drinks, and strip clubs was off and running. Bought a second one for a serious review. Pours a copper amber, and exudes hoppiness right from the get go, powerful citrusy, grainy, fruity hops on the nose. Medium heavy carbonation, mild alcohol warmth. ABV disguised by hop character. Extremely balanced, pleasant sweetness, smooth bitterness, crisp clean finish. Beauty!

22 oz bottle, on a train! Pours deep copper amber with medium head. Aroma is sweet roasty caramel malts with a hint of hop spice. Taste is big sweet caramel malt, with the roastiness and bitter pine and grass hops coming out together on the finish. Malty and substantial, the 7.2% abv is evident. This is the standard bearer for American strong ales and probably the inspiration for many that followed. Still impressive.

500 ML bottle from the Beer Store in Monticello, NY, USA. Is dark chestnut in color, with tan head. Aroma is hoppy and pine like. Bold hoppy taste with barley, malt, and coffee notes. Excellent beer, looks great and tastes even better! For me the palate is to dry and brings down this fine beer.

650ml bottle. Fantastic clear ruby red colour with average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Hoppy aroma, caramel malty background. Taste is bitter hoppy, accompanied by matching minimally dry roasty malt notes, hints of minimally sweet caramel malt, a nuttily touch. Clean, integrated, concentrated, well balanced.

A beautiful dark brown with a creamy light tan head. Smells of carmel with just the slightest hint of fruity sweetness and grass. The taste is masterfully balanced with a delectable bittering hop finish that is well muddled with a deliciously dark caramel malt flavor. It strikes a great balance between being watery and overly thick resting at a silky smooth texture as it washes your palate. Perfect for anytime in my opinion!

22 oz bottle from Walgreens in Las Vegas. Pours a clear rubyish brown with dense, light tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is solid toasty toffeeish malt and big piney/citrusy hops, with hints of spice. Flavour is rich, toasty toffee, strong piney, citric hops and some spicy/woody character. Pretty big body. Finishes quite bitter. Very impressive.
muuy buena ale mucho lupulo muy parecida a una ipa,perfume floral con aroma de naranja,paladar lupulo bien pronunciado y persistente buen grado de alchool me impresiono!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Drought. Reddish brown with beige spongy head, caramel aroma, caramel-coffee taste, very satisfying fruity-roasted malt taste, loooong finish. Deserves the praise it gets!

Pours clear amber with an average frothy head. The aroma is dominated with loads of hop, spice, and floral tones. Also malt and caramel as well. The taste is dominated with bitter notes but finishes with a sweet boozy touch. Overall this is an amazing amazing beer
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a layer of creamy head. Aroma of hops and malt. Tastes of coffee/chocolate

One of my favorite beers of all time. A great strong ale. Heavy malt forward, but not too roasted which would take away from the balance of the hoppy finish. Holds up really well against most foods you pair it with. Cheers!

[US West Coast Trip 2013]  This is how i like it. Kraftig aroma och smak. Ett djup och rundhet i kroppen som är väl balanserad. I min mening perfekt kolsyra för en Am. Strong Ale. Hade gett den ett overall på 17-18 men efter glatt läst etiketten blev det 19 dirr !

Aggressive, rude, abrasive. Mouthfeel like thick whole milk. Piney, rustic aroma. Unapologetic hop assault. Flavor is toffee, white pepper, and very slight lemon and pineapple. Finish is dry as dust with a little soapiness. Lacing absolutely does not quit. This is a good beer, probably a great beer, but I wouldn't use the word "enjoyable". It most certainly is what it is.

22 oz. Poured to glass.Pours very clear dark mahogany copper with frothy beautiful khaki head. Aroma is pine maybe some chocolate nuts? Very pungeant and complex aroma. Taste is malt in the front and generous hops in the back.  Full body. This beer is gorgeous. Not a session brew but great.

Bomber. Clear deep dark copper brown, foamy tan head settles and fades. Pungent aroma of singed roasted caramel malt, piney citrus hops. Intense dark roasted caramel malt taste, strong juicy citric hop bitterness, some grapefruit and earthiness. Soft carbonation, full bodied, aggressively hopped. Long bitter finish. This powerful ale takes no prisoners, and is definitely DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Bottle. Clear amber with off white cap and great lacing. Aroma of pine and citrus, a bit nutty. Taste is woody pine and caramel.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 Amber ruby pour. Thick off white head with lots of lacing. Caramel, toasty, and heavy citrus and lines hop aromas. Flavor is bready, toasty, caramel sweetness up front. Ruby brown with lasting tan head; strong hoppy aroma; Flava is rich with hops and spiciness blended with sweet malt; feels medium to thick; finishes dry and very bitter

Pours almost a dark maple color with a thin beige head.. tons of lacing.. woodsy, pine, soap aromas.. flavor follows with some grapefruit as well... strong hoppy aftertaste that definitely sits and lingers on the back of the tongue.
Bottle.  This is a killer beer with a huge wallop of flavor coming from the hops.
Pours a dark amber with white head. Has a slightly sweet aroma with some hints of malt and hops. Strong oaky and wood taste with an even stronger malty and hoppy aftertaste.
Hearty beer with lots O malt and hops. This is a big bad bastard with tons of malt flavor. Well constructed with some dark caramel and pine. Rivals any barley wine.
This is a very good beer but its definitely over hyped. Like many of Stones beers.

De couleur rouge foncé, avec une mousse couleur crème ; assez mince. Au nez, notes de houblons fruités et de petits fruits rouges. Bien amère en bouche, les houblons sont résineux et fruités à la fois. Bel équilibre, et belle texture moelleuse qui la rend bien ronde. Une des incontournables de la fameuse brasserie Stone, et on comprend pourquoi.
I love the arrogant hoppiness of Stones arrogant bastard ale. Goes great with a good meal, and after a tough week at work, an arrogant bastard makes all ok with the world.

On draft at Firewater's Atlantic City NJ. Pours a dark copper/brown with very little head. Aroma of sweet malts, dark fruits (raisins & plums), and some citrus hops. Taste is much the same, sweet malts, citrus hops, some dark fruit notes, and booze.

Very nice dark red color. For all the talk its not THAT difficult, its just got a high IBU. The disappointing thing is, the malt that underpins this ale is really fantastic, and if the bitterness was toned down a little it might actually come close to rivaling 90 Minute. All in all, its a very good beer.

Bottle - Piney hops, huge sweet malt backbone.  Cloudy amber with a thin brown head.  Toasted sweet malts, brilliant hoppy bitterness with a citrus sweet finish.  #500 rating and the reason I love craft beer, thanks stone.

Looks great, Woody aroma , pine, grapefruit, beautiful color and a mouthfeel that lasts forever.
This was a very good beer with a lot of flavor. Nice and hoppy with a strong malt backbone that finished with a small alcohol warmth.

I was apprehensive at first, but this was love at first taste. Only topped in my mind by its oaked counterpart

I dont think I could write this wonderful beer high enough. the combination of complex hops & sweet malt. strong pine and grapefruit hop aroma pairs well with overall taste. a well rounded beer u have to taste to believe.
Pours a dark golden orange. Aroma is very complex. Taste is great. Really strong on the palate. One of my favorite every day strong ales!

On tap in a pint glass... Nice head with nice citrusy aroma.  Very dark, amber color.  Tastes initially of hops but finishes very smooth.

Big flavor, mild to moderate bittering, the beer came to life when the temperature of the beer rose closer to room temp.

The nose on this is...shockingly weak, given how strong everything else in it is.  It has a slightly toasted bread smell hinting at some darker malts.  Hops seem to be of american high alpha variety, good citrus/fruit smells.

Leaves good head disspates a bit quickly, and medium lacing.  

Tastes heavily bitter with a bit of malty sweetness, good strong biscuit taste.

Not a ton going on in the aroma.  There is a caramel/malty smell with just a slight bit of hops.  Taste is very bitter though.  Also has an alcohol bite/burn at the end.  Could this potentially be ageable?  We will see....

So extremely well balanced between the malty body, hop flavor and alcohol bite. Great deep amber color. Aroma could be a bit stronger.
