Theres a solid malt backbone thats actually pretty complex. Some lightly roasted grains and white toast among other, less aromatic, aromas. As it warms alcohol fumes rise into my nose.

Oh, the taste!... Toasty grains and mild caramel make the initial appearance. The malts fades to the background as the delicious bitter grapefruit hops take over the palate. After a strong bite the hops simmer down to a moderate bitterness and the grains come back for a night cap with a stronger showing of the caramel the second time around. The bitterness lingers around for a little while after each drink. This beer isnt polished. There are a lot of rough edges that go together seamlessly. Alcohol fumes come through as it warms and they just add more complexity to this drink. Lots of interesting flavors. Very nice. 

Mouthfeel is good. Medium bodied and very smooth. Leaves with a little grittiness. Carbonation keeps it pushing through and the tongue takes a beating from the big amount of hops. Just the way I like it.

Drinkability is good for the fact of how good this beer actually tastes. I dont think Id want to drink much more than a 22 in a sitting but it definately is good.

This is an excelent brew with all kinds of big flavors that go together wonderfully. Stone needs to get to Illinois as soon as possible. Another excellent beer from them. I havent been disappointed yet.

Bottle.  Appearance was a dark amber color, with average head that was off white.  Lacing was medium.  Aroma is very prominent!!  Smells of heavy malt, caramel, and a bit of CO2.  Flavor is unique, nicely balanced malt and hop character.  The finish had a roasted bite to it with  lingering hop flavor.  I really liked this one, its very unique.
This beer had a noticable combination of both hops and malts. The flavors seemed to alternate standing out one at a time. A slight liqorice flavoring that lingers well.

a hazy reddish ale with a thick light moka head. A pleasant vinous aroma, with carmale notes, and funky floral hops, and light coffee notes. In mouth, a sweet caramel malt, torrefied coffee, nuts and floral hops, citrusy. A good classy ale. Bought at Bessettes, Canton, NY. Tasted Feb. 2007 and many times before.

A nice brew.  Quite a bit maltier than I was expecting, it was a nice blend of bitey hops and some good roasted malts.  Finish was bitter, but I couldnt tell if it was from the hops or the roastiness. Average carbonation, quite drinkable really.  Enjoyable.

Bouteille, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur brune rouge et légèrement voilée. Nez malté de caramel toffee sucré et légèrement terreux (notes de rôti), de houblon terreux aux notes citriques (pamplemousse), légèrement fruité (agrumes) et avec des notes de tabac, de chocolat noir et dalcool doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement crémeuse et aux notes huileuses, Goût assez amer de houblon terreux, légèrement citriques (pamplemousse) et aux notes résineuses et florales (qui dure toute la gorgée) avec un goût moyennement fruité (agrumes, faibles traces dabricots et de prunes) et des notes de fumée de cigarette lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel toffee terreux sucré et légèrement rôti ainsi quun très léger goût de chocolat noir parallèlement à un goût dalcool moyennement réchauffant puis en finale lon retrouve un goût légèrement plus amer de houblon (légèrement plus citrique et résineux et notes herbeuses). Post-goût long et un peu sec, amer de houblon terreux, herbeux et aux notes citriques (pamplemousse) avec un léger goût de rôti et dalcool ainsi que des notes de chocolat noir et de fruits (zest dagrumes).

Very dark amber with a light-gold head. Aroma of malt and citrus hops. Grapefruit hops flavour with a strong malt component, the taste is slightly bitter overall but the malt sweetness is quite present. Finish is on the bitter side, but there is still plenty of malt sweetness in it. Mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth and carbonation is just right. Really not as aggressive as I expected, and certainly a lot maltier. Actually it is rather well balanced and quite pleasant and easy to drink, and with its high ABV, that is almost worrisome. My 22oz bottle did not last long at all since I kept wanting another taste of it. I can definitely say this is the best beer I have rated so far. I will most definitely have to try more from Stone. If this is so good, I cant wait to try their IPA.
Good hoppieness.  Not as strong on the hops as their IPA.  If you think their IPA was too strong, try this one.  Very complete beer, - balanced.
22 oz bottle. Pours copper in color with off white head. Hoppy grapefruit aroma. Taste of grapefruit and malt with lite bitter after taste.
Very nice and a little alcoholic taste. A little bitterness. Drunk it on draft in San Diego and on bottle somewhere in Belgium

On tap. Nice deep ruby color with a think tan head taht leaves brusssels lace teh entire length of the pint. Sweet alcoholy aroma with a touch of hops in it. Nice hop flavor than some malt with a very dry finish. Medium mouth feel. Good beer but not great. Id hardly call it agressive.
This was my first really beer and my one true love.  Great color and amazing taste.  Bravo Stone Brewing Co.

This beer says what it means.  You probably wont like it.  Unless you love, and I mean LOVE bitter beers, the aroma is heaven, to hop lovers, its an amber, beautiful amber color.  The smell is like people are hitting you inside of your nose.  And when the beer hits your pallet, oh my god...its like a punch in the face.  I recommend everyone at least try it once, it will change your life, it changed mine.  Well...beer wise it did.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2007 The back of the bottles describes this as an "aggressive" beer, I was curious as to the meaning of this. After one taste I immediately understood and was instantly hooked. This is one of the best ales ever to pass my lips. The flavor is so complex it was like the fourth of July in my mouth. I cant wait to try their other brews. //12-7-07: Ive enjoyed a number of bombers since my initial review including one tonight. This brew is one of the first beers that really lead me to the craft beer craze and for that I am very thankful. Some additional comments in regards to this great beer to complete this review. Pours a dark, burnt copper color with a very large tan head and sticky lacing. A very aromatic hop scent is emitted into the air. Bitter citrus with caramel and sweet breads. I cant believe how well the aroma permeates the air surrounding the top of the glass. Creamy on the palate with a nice bite and puckering finish. Medium bodied and filling. Grand flavor of resinous hops and roasted, sweet malts. A touch nutty, grapefruit and spruce. The flavor sticks to your ribs and assaults the senses. Overall a nicely aggressive and flavorful ale, still one of my favorites that I look forward to returning to every once in a while. A sentimental beer that deserves its rating."

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2007 Pours a deep vermillion with moderate carbonation, a slight haze and capped with a full, tan head. Heavily malted nose with an alcohol presence that cant be covered. Pepper, pine and tart citrus show in both aroma and flavor. Peaty and dry for the most part, with a heavy palate.
Agressive? Indeed. Sophisticated? Not really... it is what it is... a strong ale with heavy-handed PNWs, high IBUs and thick malts to back them up. Id call it a DIPA. The "arrogance" implied thru its flavor-text was probably considered a sweeeeeeeet marketing technique, but it annoyed the f*ck out of me. Ill drink this if its offered but Im not going to seek it out...  Im "not worthy", dont you know.  If I truly want an arrogant bastard, Ill call my buddy Gene.
<font size=-4>A gift from my good friend Mike out in Philly.</font>

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008 i was expecting a lot more from this brew given the high marks.  better from the bottle in my opinion (a bit more depth). reddish cola colored with a fluffy head. nice aroma of malt, citrus and piney hops. flavor is well balanced with wood, nuttiness, brown sugar, caramel and hoppy bitterness. easy enough to drink a bunch all day.

I liked this beer, but it may think too highly of itself.  Kind of like the arrogant bastard who parks between two parking spot so you wont ding his Audi A6.  This beer has a really nice balance between its caramel malt and biting hops but I expected more.
A good beer, though I was expecting more from it.  Very hoppy yet pretty smooth. Its a good beer with lots of hops!
Just a great beer, very hoppy but smooth. I try to get this whenever i can. A must try for everyone
Definitely aggressive, very very hoppy-- smooth finish despite bitterness. Didnt used to like it as much as I do now!
On tap at Stone.  Dark red with fluffy white head.  A good strong hoppy aroma.  Well balanced taste between the hops, malt, and alcohol.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. one of my favorite strong ales. Huge hop presence, it is Stone. Well balanced with the malts, caramel flavor. A little alcohol nip but invites you back for more

tMy recent go around with a bottle of this stuff made me realize its a lot better than I used to think. Deep red color, with a great head that stays and stays- a definite 5.  Flavor mixes between fruits, hops, malts, caramel.  Finish is bitter but very balanced and a little sweet.  A great example of an american stong ale!!  A unique one indeed.
HOPS! enough said.  very strong after taste, but a fantastic beer.  this you can drink straight from the bottle if your bold enough
Great example of the style.  A very well balanced american strong ale.  Big flavor that all blends together very nicely.  hops up front, nice malt backbone, some chocolate, some citrus.  Very unique.
This beer has a stout yet smooth flavor.  It leaves a great aftertaste.  This beere is a beer lovers beer.  Its a bit pricey....but well worth it!!!!!

22 oz. bottle.  Poured dark reddish-brown with a nice white head.  Strong aroma of flowery hops and alcohol.  Initial hoppy bite floods the mouth, slightly alcoholic, and somehow transitions to a smooth finish that begs you to drink more.  Great beer.
The label said that I probably wouldnt like this beer, and it was right.  Very hoppy and bitter, but it isnt as overbearing as some APAs.
Smells like plenty of hops with a hint of coffee and citrus, and has great flavor ... smooth, with a very bitter finish...

I have a lot of beer tasting years under my belt... or should I say over my belt.  AB is one of the finest beers brewed in America today.  Hoppy, with great flavor (chocolate, fruit, citrus). This is a smooth beer that goes down easy.  At 3.99 a bottle its a steal when compared to a Trappist. IMO this is the best beer Stone brews (better than their IPA).  Im waiting to find one better for the price.

22oz bottle, $3.99.  Aroma has lots of hopps and malt with some yeast.  Notes of hay, grass, horse blankey/leather, apple and grape.  Large, light tan, mostly lasting, frothy head that left good lacing.  Flat dark red/brown body.  Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately bitter.  Finish is sweet and even more bitter.  Average/long duration.  Palate is medium and light oil, flat, and with a light alcoholic feel.  Very very good and well deserving of its high ratings.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2008 Another one of my go-tos for sure. Pretty much a cosmopolitan brew on the west coast, available nearly anywhere. Nice bitter caramel and spice aroma and great copper colored appearance with adequate head. Flavors are a nice combo of citrus, toffee, strong malt undertones and hops. Finishes crisp and refreshing. Ye shall know the Bastard, and the Bastard shall set you free.
I absolutely love this beer.  Its got a nice bite to it.  Really beatiful amber/red color.  Very hoppy; a beer that you definately have to be in the mood for.

Bottled from Total Wine.  Beautiful blood red with large tan head.  Smells of rich malt and hints of nut.  Strong taste of burnt malts to a perfect amount of strong hops.  You need to be in the mood for a strong ale, though, as it packs quite a punch.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2011 I just love, love, love this beer. It was the first Stone I had and my gateway beer beyond the standard crafts like Sierra Nevada, Rogue, and so forth (not that theres anything wrong with them). Im still a big fan, though it doesnt *quite* blow me away like it did 5 or 6 years ago. But this combo of blazing hop aggression and malt smoothness isnt one I can resist. Kudos, Stone, and may you adhere to your arrogance in perpetuity.
Went to Stone Brewery in Ca.  Very fun, fun beer hoppy, potent and you have to be in the mood...

Pour was a deep amber/brown with a perfect tan head with a great amount of lacing. Aroma was earthy hops. Taste was like their IPA without a huge hoppy follow through in the end (which would be a huge plus for the non-hop heads). I can see the mass appeal for this beer. Its an IPA that doesnt commit to the bitterness in the aftertaste.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Aroma of pine backed by malt. Ruby color with a extremely frothy off-white head that laces. Starts with balanced pine hop and malt. Medium mouthfeel. Really pleasant. Light carbonation. The finish is well balanced, but the hop now seems to have gone floral. Good!
Very similar to Stone IPA, so it was very good. However, I liked the IPA better. Hoppy taste that is very complex and enjoyable. The flavor did not get boring. Light, carbonated mouthfeel.

Had it in Lansing, MI at the Nuthouse on draft.  Very good and strong.  A bitter aftertaste with some strong, sweet, malty/hoppy flavor.  Not a low alcohol brew, but very tasty.  High quality stuff...

The perfect beer for my 69th rating. It seems either you love this beer or think its overrated, I happen to be in the love this beer camp. I know a lot of people bitch that this company is mostly marketing but they do make some of the best bottles out there and fill em up with really good beers. AB looks great, smells great and tastes great. If you havent tried some then go get some.

Pull this beer, pour it, and take your time. Taste the beer sip for sip as it slowly warms, the flavor adjusting greatly. From start to finish, this is a fantastic brew from Stone. Gorgeous dark red/brown color, and a beautiful brown head. Very well balanced, and gets even better as it warms. Make sure you take your time with this hearty beast, patience is well worth the beauty waiting in this brew when allowed to warm.

22 oz. bottle purchased for me by iradog on his trip to Colorado. Thanks, Ira! Aroma of piney and citrusy Pacific Northwest hops. Smell also possesses a pronounced sweetness, featuring cherry and chocolate scents. Aroma similar to that one might find in a barley wine, but it could stand to be a little stronger. Pours an impressive, dark, amber/ruby-brown with a golden-amber hue and a small to moderate amount of yellowish tan head. Looks like pure cranberry juice or liquid clay in the glass. Produces extensive lacing. Bitter hops dominate the flavor, despite the fact that the beer looks and smells as though the malts would be stronger in the flavor profile. Grapefruit and other citrus flavors deriving from the hops are evident, but the English-style dirt bitterness is what sets this beer apart from so many other American strong ales. Improves after multiple sips and as it warms. Long, satisfying, dirt-bitter aftertaste. Medium to full in body. Tangy and sharp, silky but lively in the palate. Easy to drink for a relatively big and thick brew. The mouthfeel to some extent stands out more than the flavor in this beer. Arrogant Bastard is a good, solid, bitter spin on the classic American hops-dominated ale.
Bottle - Nice pour, good head with a lasting head.  Great taste from start to finsh.  Good beer with a cool gargoyle.

This beer was poured out in to a heffewizen glass with a good head to it. There is a dark amber color to it with the nice smell of pine trees. It has a bitter sweet taste of hops and pine and the nice pine after taste. I like how the flavor sticks around for a while after the beer has slides down your throat with a smooth texture.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2009 Picked this one up in Boston, May-06. Amazing Beer!  Nice copper colour with great aroma of hops and citrus. The flavour offers lots of complexity, with great hoppiness balanced with sweet malts and piney, earthy notes. A nice finish with bit of lingering hops.
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2007 22 oz. Had a great aroma hops and malt. Full of hop flavor which was perfectly balanced with malt texture. All around excellent beer. Would highly recommend.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Re-ratign after long and dignifed period of drinking ABA.  Strong woody and hop notes make it a classic.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2009 22 oz. in quart Mason. Deep mahogany that is a clear, ruby red when held to the light. Medium large, tan head lasts fairly well with some crusty lacing. Aroma is fresh and prickly pine hops with grapefruit and some malt support. Initial taste is surprisingly not so hoppy, and very smooth. Hops still dominate this beer -  pine resin, dirty leaf, oak and light citrus - but the big malt body balances it pretty well with some dark fruit tastes. Very luscious and creamy, medium-bodied beer. Pretty two dimensional, but still a nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2007 This, for me, is the brew that opened the door into the microbrew world...based on the name alone.  It is red-brown and clear.  The aroma and flavor are certainly hoppy, as one would expect, but it is not unbalanced.  Unfortunately, the mere existence of Double Bastard renders it virtually obsolete.  But, then again, the relative availability between the two knocks Arrogant Bastard back into relevancy.

On draft at Nicholsons in downtown Cincy.
Served in a pub pint glass.
Has a dark gold/brown color with a huge two inch head. That is frothy and plenty sticky. There was very good lacing that covered the entire interior of the glass throughout drinking.
Smell is mostly bitter hops, with some citrusy notes coming through slightly. Taste is bitter but refreshing at the same time. Mouthfeel is somewhat astringent but enjoyable at the same time. Becomes a little cloying after a while.
Its a very good offering on draft, however I think I could only drink a two pints of this at most. Would tire of the taste after that. Would highly recommend, a little more "relaxed" than served from the bottle.
Nice muddy, cloudy copper color. Aroma is of hops, citrus, malt and fresh cut grass. Flavor is more of the same with that oaky flavor from the oak. Not heavy or overbearing. Very nicely done.

Very complex indeed.  I cant decide if Im biting into a grapefruit or chewing on fresh greens.  Nice pine/grapefruit aroma and flavor.  Not my fave, but still pretty darn good.  It finishes with a lingering bitterness, still hinting at the pine needles.  Gotta love it.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2007 Gorgeous.  Simply gorgeous.  One of the most attractive beers Ive ever seen.  The pour was a rich ruby and copper that had incredible depth.  The head was nearly three fingers and off-white, not quite tan.  Rocky foam sat on top of this one the entire way down the glass.  Rings of lacing.  The aroma was a nice mix of sweet malt, roasted malt, citrusy hops and pine.  The flavor was caramelly sweet up front with citrus and piney hops leading into a succinct, dry finish.  Nice warming alcohol feel that wasnt too in-your-face.  Above average mouthfeel.  Truly high-end.
Bottle. Very strong taste, but I enjoyed reading the label more than the taste...

Yeah, well I know I "probably wont like it," but well I do. Maybe it is because I really need a beer, maybe because it is a really good beer. It pours with minimal head, but leaves nice lacing. Nice brownish read colour to it indeed. It has a deleightlful sweet and fruity smell. The first sip is quite bitter and hoppy. The finish is also rather bitter and leaves a sort of sticky taste in the mouth. Nothing really wrong with this beer. It has a lot going for it and I look forward to trying the Double and Ruination.

yeah you sons a [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ you make a great beer.i bet youre real proud of yourselves huh. beautiful malt base. excellent body and mouthfeel. fantastic hop character. addictingly good. cant taste the alcohol,  careful lightweights.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2007 I love the description of this beer on the bottle.  Its almost like theyre challenging you to try it, for that reason I expected it to be much more ballsy and complex than it was, but its still really good.  Bottle... Poured a dark ruby tone with a nice white had that diminished fast.  Strong malty aroma with a touch of alcohol presence.  Mildly carbonated palate and flavors of malt, caramel, a little bit of hops and just a touch of barley at the end.  Not much of an aftertaste in the finish, just clean.  This is a unique brew.

(Bottle) Hmmm... maybe I dont have the "taste or sophistication" to enjoy this beer. Pours a dark brown color with a small beige head. Sweet aroma. Taste is rather complex, with a unique tasting mix of malts and a touch of alcohol. Palate is quite sticky and oily. The hops are able to balance this stickiness out a little bit, but not completely. A more earthy taste emerges as this beer warms up. Its a decent beer, but not as good as described by other raters, in my opinion.
I did not enjoy this beer at all - way too sweet.  Formed a nice head and had a very pleasant color, but I found that the flavors did not mesh well at all.

Bottle: Dark amber in color with a light tan head. Aroma, caramel, brown sugar, earthy hops. Flavor, rich caramel, and some slight roasted malts, nutty, toffee, with a nice bit of earthy hops, and bitterness. Its nice going back to it after so many other beers. Its not what I remembered at all, but for once, that is a good thing. Usually something that I loved a couple years ago pales in comparison to what I like now, but this is definitely an exception.
Bottle.  Had this one many times and cant believe I havent rated it.  Very nice, huge on the malt.  One of my original favorite micros.
Very malty and strong beer.  Interesting upfront, but difficult to have much of this brew.  A good example of extreme beer.  Id prefer a bit of balance.
I figure I got a bad batch of this beer.  I await my next test.  Skunky bottle.

Sometimes youre just in the mood for a ballsy beer. You dont want delicate. You dont care about subtle shifts in flavor as it lingers on your tongue. Youre not going to concentrate on ballerinaesque transitions from nose to palate to finish. But you still want damn good beer. And you want it to slap you around a bit (like that night...um...). Arrogant Bastard is the very best of this kind of brew--one of the sure classics--and easily one of the best values in beerhistory.
Pours a dark amber colour. Very complex and spicy , with the malts and hops nicely balanced. A great beer.  Very cool bottle.

From a 22oz. This has been one of my favorite beers for awhile. Complex and incredibly well rounded, this beer combines floral with citrus with an twistedly strong hoppy finish. Just like their Ruination, it is incredibly crisp and refreshing.
Draft.  This is a good second beer to have, because it has pretty intense flavor.  The malt presence is nice, and the hop bitterness rounds out the beer very well.

Aggressively hopped and very floral. Deep reddish brown color that caught me by suprise. Asertive taste that is, well, arrogant.... Rather bitter up front but finished with an onslaught of hoppy flavor that lasts for a while. This is the strongest beer I have ever sampled without the word "imperial" anywhere in its description. Not bad, but I have put this one off for a while because of its reputation and it is really just a decent beer.
Lots o hops! Pours a nice amber with a medium head. Very bitter at first but goes down pretty smooth. The beer is arrogant.

smells great!!! sweet and hoppy like an imperial ipa. pours a gourgeous deep red.  taste is great.  starts like an ipa then finishes without the bitterness.  fantastic pine and citrus flavor. not to thick or thin.  Bravo!!

Awesome beer.  Stone really has thier marketing campaign down.  I did a "Stone" tasting last night and tried the arrogant, double, IPA, Ruination, Imperial, and Gaurdian all in a flight.  Darn good tasting, Stone has its act together.  Stone is notorious for hopping up thier beers.  the bastard is no exception.  poured into a tall tulip.  pours a dark clear amber with frothy full head, aroma of complex hops, taste is bitter on the front with a woody aftertaste.  gets better as you drink it, at first it is afront, but after the hoppiness gets on your palate you notice the complexities, laces well on the glass... definitly one of my favorite beers...

Poured out of a 22 oz bomber around 40 degrees a nice dark ruby red bordering on brown.  Smell was very hoppy.  This beer should not be consumed under 50 degrees.  At low temperatures this one was super aggressive with too much bitter up front.  As it warms the beer gets more balanced and the malts play off the hops.  At first I wasnt sure I was going to be able to drink it.  By the end of the second glass, I was left wanting more.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2007 What a great looking bottle and colour!  Dark reddish, amber colour with a nice foamy tan head.  Very bitter, hoppy taste that leaves you with a kick for a little while.  Fairly easy to drink.  Overall, a unique beer with a unique marketing campaign.  I liked it.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown pour. Tan head about a finger width high with some nice lacing. Nose is malt and hops. Taste is malt and hops and lots of it...very nice. Well balanced with a nice bit at the end.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2011 enough has been said about this beer to where i feel like i dont have to write much. after all the years this one still holds up as a really well balanced ASA with complex malt flavors and assertive floral, hops.  here in CA you can get it for a pretty decent price and pretty fresh, too.  besides having the gimmicky name and image this is a quality strong ale

Verre de dégustation, provenant dun fût, dégusté au Atlantic City Beer Festival 2007 (Atlantic City, NJ). Arôme: Odeur de caramel et dhoublons fruités. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée brunâtre. Présence dun mince col beige avec une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et de tabac. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #904)
Excellent brew. Arrogant Bastard has to be one of my favorites. The hoppy flavor and aroma immediately draw you in. Highly recommended.

This brew has a major hops kicks to it. I like it. It pours a deep ruby red, not dark ruby red; red. Has a medium thick head with lots of bubbles and a tannish overtone to its head. The carbonitation is great. The in mouth feel is medium light, not thick or syrupy. It does have a bit of a floral hoppy aftertaste but in general is smooth all the way around. After number brew 2 you either hate or love it.....I love it. It has a bit of a bitter after taste that lasts for a LONG time (tens of minutes).....but in a good way. The aroma is that of (to me) pure maltiness and yeast. Tasting the alcohol....if you consider hops alcohol-ish youre wrong (is almost non-present). There is almost no alcohol if any present in this monster of a brew! Me being from Southern Cali......rock on Sur Califas!!! A perfect 5
This one is my favorite. Extremely hoppy, but I say the hoppier the better. It has a kick from being to end

22 oz bomber. More like an IPA. Orange, mahoghany color, with a thick off-white head. Great active canbonation that makes it easy to drink. Sweet and spicy grapefruity hops that stick to the back of the mouth. nuf said.
Hoppy as hell.  This one kicked right in the back of the mouth, but that wasnt a bad thing.  Nice frothy head and a spicy finish.
dark amber color, big hoppy aroma to go along with the flavor. malty sweetness with a nice spicy finnish. good stuff

Excellent beer, dark amber in color, hoppy floral aroma mixed with sweetness malt, very smooth, very hoppy flavors.  "Youre not worthy" printed on the bottle cap makes it all the better.  Delicious, I will definitely buy this again in a heartbeat!
Pours dark brown, thick, light head. Aroma of hops and passion fruit. Strong passion fruit and cascade hop flavor with an undercurrent of malt. Spectacular!
Ginger Man, Austin (coincidence!) Deep amber color, ideal mix of caramel malts, heavy hops, earthy yeast. Full bodied--one of the best American ales on the market.
Ginger Man, NYC. Amber coloured, huge head. Some caramel malts, but predominantly super hoppy. Very bitter flavour, but with enough complexity to balance. Very good.

pours dark amber with slight off white head. aroma of caramel and hint of pine. smooth mouthful of malt and perfectly balaced with hop with a crispness that makes you crave for some lingering goodness. This is by far one of the best staple brews... and a great place to start for the double B.
A true original. Amer color is tremendous and the taste is great. Dont be scared off by the name or bottle, this is a quality beer that you need to try, it wont disappoint.

draft at fathers office - ive never understood the appeal of this beer. i think people just like saying "arrogant bastard" when they order it. personally, i find this to be a boring, overly bitter hoppy beer. i dont see the complexities and balance other people speak of.
Deep red color, sweet aroma. Outstanding malt and mouthfeel balanced by a well-balanced, not overbearing, hoppiness. Surprisingly drinkable for such a flavorful brew. An instant favorite.

This beer was very good for the style it was.This beer was smooth yet did have a bite due to the higher alcohol content. It was aromatic, had a full mouth feel, tasted of bitter hops with a slight malty flavor and lots of bitter chocolate, very complex/well-brewed yet left a nasty aftertaste. This beer did not live up to my expectations for such a highly rated beer. Yes, it was worth trying. However, this was not something I would really want to try again.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2007 I really liked this beer.  It is drinkable, even though they tried to pursuade you otherwise "you probably wont like this beer" is right on the bottle!  The alcohol is well hidden and has a great hoppy aroma.
Good. Drinkable. Lots of hops. Not as aggressive as the Runination IPA. Still, nothing less than expected from Stone.

Really good, if you like extreme bitterness! Quite balanced between malt and hops, regardless a huge level of IBU, very nice malt & hop aroma. Full bodied. Why this kind of stuff is not (yet) available in Italy?!?

Very good but not as great as some is putting it out to be.  Alcohol comes out stronger but less than it should given the 7.2% content.  Heavy to the tongue, sweet and bitter  Typically I cant drink more than 1 22oz bottle without the taste becoming too overpowering.  A nice shock when first drank, evne though the aroma warns you already.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2007 I had this beer on tap at a neat little restaurant called the mellow mushroom.  The beer itself was very dark and viscous.  The taste was very bitter, hoppy, and strong, just as the style implies.  Cant say Im a huge fan, but it definitely is a well-brewed beer with lots of complexity. Guess Im just not an arrogant bastard, oh well.....
Nice strong ale that is another fine example of a good beer from Stone Brewery

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2007 The label says it all. You probably wont like this beer if you like megabrews. Quite possibly my favorite beer and the first Stone Ive tried. I believe Stones tagline of "Hated by Many, Loved by Few". Im fairly certain that with this beer you either love it or you loathe it.

Blacker than the blackest black time infinity with a thin head, and with an almost overpowering hoppy flavor if you arent expecting it. Bravo.
This was my first Stone beer, and it was excellent. It pours a dark amber with a thin khaki head. This is the strongest and best tasting strong ale ive come across.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 Great beer!  Very complex slightly sweet citrus hint.  Pours amber with small tan head.  Strongest darkest ale out there.  Nice and hoppy with a bold bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2007 This ale pours rich amber red,with a tan head.What stands out is the amount of hops, with a skunk smell.Too much hops for me ,but a  great brew nonetheless,the strongest ale I have tasted yet.
this was my first stone offering. wow. nothing wrong with this beer. great color armoa and flavor. bottle from international beverage in grand rapids.

Pours a red/brown with a small amount of head.  Strong, in your face hops with a very sour finish.  It has a smooth mouthfeel, and left nice lacing on the glass.  I think my expectations were too high for this, I thought it would be more than it is.  Id take their IPA over this any day.

Cold 22oz bottle:  Pours a clear dark reddish amber color with a medium frothy light tan head.  Aroma is of floral hops and rich malts.  Taste is predominantly of floral hops with hints of citrus and sour notes.  Medium bodied, crisp and well carbonated.  Ending is mostly bitter with some sour notes.

This beer has a nice amber color and a tan head, I really couldnt decipher too much from the aroma, almost a celery kind of smell! But it does not detract from the flavor. I enjoyed this one, and will try again.

This beer pours a very deep amber with a large tan head.  When you take a whiff of this thing, you get how complex this beer really is!  Its hard to pin down one thing that stands out.  This is an extremely good beer and at the price this really is a good buy!  A beer this complex for 6.00 is a great buy!  Cheers!
This has everything a great beer should, even the bottle. So many things going on, its hard to describe. Well worth the price.
i hope the guy that rated before me really enjoys his bud ice light.  this is a great beer with great taste.

I was very excited to try this beer based on its ratings and marketing. However, I found this to be a rather ordinary beer. Nothing special. It tastes like beer. It goes down like beer. It comes up like beer. Im sure beer snobs have all sorts of reasons to like this brew, but it just doesnt do it for me. There are much less expensive beers out there that do the job just fine.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2008 I did not want to like this ale but was strong-armed the other way by the first half of the 22oz bomber. Appearance is probably the best ive seen - nice hazy amber with small tan head. Taste is strongly malted with complex, heavy sweet caramel smokiness. Everything about this is complex; lots of floral and earthy hints with some slight spicyness. Has a little of everything. Great hop flavor with minimal residual bitterness. Lives up to its reputation - the bottle was right, im not worthy.
Good stuff. I enjoyed the floral essence in the aromas. Good style. I will try others in this class.

Serving Type: 22oz bottle into glass

Appearance: Pours a muddy brown with a one finger off-white head that leaves some nice lacing around the edge of my glass.

Smell: Pine hops, and floral hops. Not much else.

Taste: Lots of hop bitterness, mainly pine and other floral hops, just as the nose implied. 

Mouhtfeel: Light to medium body with little carbonation. Creamy and smooth.

Drinkability: One 22oz bottle is more than enough for me in a sitting. Would I buy this again? Most likely not. I bought this namely for the reputation. I still would like to try to get my hands on a bottle of Oaked and Double as well, though, at least just to try them once
22 ounce bottle . . pours dark brown . . white head . . aroma is pine, citrus, sweet . . taste is PINE, grapefruit and slight malt . . alcohol is WELL hidden . . a great beer . .
Dark brown in color with very small head. Much better than the Double Bastard. Good flavor without the overwhelming alcoholic taste. This is actually drinkable.

22 oz bottle.  Pours a dark cloudy tan with a thick light brown head...tons of lacing.  It has a sweet malt, tangy fruit, and floral aroma.  Nice carmel richness with a medium mouth feel.  Some strong ales alchohol content is just too high and kills the overall enjoyment.  This beer has a nice balance of bitterness, sweetness, and alcohol.  Great beer!

clear copper with a great tan head that settles into a thin film. nice lacing. juicy grapefruit hops with a hint of caramel malt sweetness. bitter juicy grapefruit hop flavor with a nice bittersweet caramel backbone. the keyword here is bitter. bittersweet juicy grapefruit caramel flavor. very nice medium full lively mouth feel. simple straightforward but very nice. very solid fantastic beer.

Had this a few times and finally reviewing it. This thing is amazing. Pours a nice dark color and smells like it means business. The flavor come through nice and strong with a very nice finish. It lingers a bit but can be expected with a beast of this nature.

Pours a hazy brown with copper highlights. About an inch of tan foam, consisting of tiny bubbles. Nice lacing, though not count-the-rings. Tart fruit and malt in the aroma.

Prominent hops - spicy floral and just plain old bitter. I start to think about them but the malt takes over. Sweet with dark caramel, more dark caramel, and then some dark caramel. Theres a fruitiness in there too - like a dried plum (which sounds nicer than prune). Anyways, lets go with complex hops and complex malt. All in perfect balance - assuming you want a balance weighted towards hoppiness. With big malt. There is a spicy (white pepper) hops with faint licorice (from the malt) aftertaste. Mustache tickling carbonation and full body. Peppery spicy hops several minutes into the aftertaste.
Great pour with nice color and great very sharp,bitter and aggresively hoppy. Decided to try after a bottle of IPA, not as smooth, nice kick

Golden/orange color.  Fragrant and floral hops on the nose.  The taste  backs up the smell.  So much hops, but rounded out with subtle malt flavor. Grassy taste, but also berries.    Certainly packs a punch.

Opens with a great pour - nice color and an incredible aroma that begs to be consumed. Flavor is what I expected from the bottle and very different from the aroma - very sharp,bitter and aggresively hoppy.  Not for the inexperienced palate, but worth at least one bottle to experience the taste.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2007 Re-rate.  I had this on draft before I was into beer and was overwhelmed.  Trying it again with a newfound palate.  Bomber.  Pours dark brown that shows some red through the light.  Huge, fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is strong, yeasty, beery, metallic, slightly hoppy with a lot of malts and chocolate.  Mouthfeel is quite thick.  Taste is bitter but smooth, malty as hell, some chocolate finish.  Hops isnt too apparent besides the strong bitterness.  Pretty well balanced surprisingly.  Stone continues to impress.  And unlike some quality microbreweries, their stuff is incredibly cheap, which should be applauded.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2007 Pours a Reddish Brown with a Tan Head.  Very hoppy with a nice balanced finish. Great ale from Stone

I got this beer as a gift, do to a lot of people telling me I tend to be a bit on the arrogant side.  That being said, I really enjoyed it.  Poured a rich deep color, almost a reddish tobacco.  Foamy white head, that faded into a rich fluffy lace.  This beer is full of hoppy bite, however is nicely balanced to keep it drinkable.

Awesome ale served in a type of flute snifter glass at a local joint in S.B. great bablance of hop oilin and malty sweetness, really enjoyd the two wresling for flavor and complemented as well. great mouth feel great brew

Pours a deep maroon with a meium white stable head.  Mixture of raspberries and hops in the smell.  Nothing too exciting.  Pretty hoppy in the taste with alot of bitterness in the finish.  tatses of fruits, but not sweet fruits, more like the skins.  The hops somewhat overwhelms it though.
Pours a brownish redish with a thin tan head. An aroma I realy enjoy but I cant put my finger on what I smell. Very unique flavor. An enjoyable brewwith very different and memorable tatses.

Pours a ruby brown.  There is a slight bready character on the nose to accent a nice healthy dose of floral hoppiness, and subtle malt flavors.  Great malty backbone that is accompanied by a nice citrusy hop bite.  Nice caramel and almost cofee like flavors linger into the finish.  A very nice beer that lives up to its name in my opinion.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: This was a strange brew indeed! Poured from bottle. Nice copper color, no head, no lacing...Smelled GREAT. Very sweet, but man, first drink was very tangy and sharp...Very complex flavor that I just cant figure out...Apparently, according to the bottle, I am not worthy! HAH!

I tried the double before this. If I had tasted this first it would have blown me away, but I found it slightly lacking when put up against its big brother. On its own I think the sweet, malty flavor is excellent.

bottle with a very intimidating name.  I found this in a God-forgotten liquor store in central Utah (dont ask why).  This beer was featured on Diggnation, so I was very excited to try it (kinda; Kevin Rose hated this). First sip was like a punch in the crotch; clearly, something has gone wrong in this brew.  However, the subsequent tests proved that I was wrong.  The flavor is like nothing else; its sweet and malty, and it took me a couple of ounces to figure it out.  Very complex flavor, each sip is a separate experience.  Not very carbonated. A very unique beer.  High alcohol content, I was buzzed after drinking the whole bottle.

Dark red/auburn in color.  Aroma of hops, malt, caramel, and pine.  Flavor is similar except much more complex, changing as it makes it way around the mouth.  Very enjoyable and natural flavors.  Finish has roasted fruits and alcohol with modest bitterness for an aftertaste.  Somewhat over-carbonated in my opinion.  This is a very good overall ale.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2008 Pours a deep amber color with a big foamy tan head.  Aroma of fruity hops.  Flavor is all hops, but not as overpowering as you may come to beleive from the label.  Actually its a pretty nicely balanced, well hopped brew.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2007 Bottled at Old Chicago in Boise.  Very aromatic grapefruit.  Frothy and heavy in the mouth, hoppy bite.  Clean dry finish with slight alcohol burn.  Re-rate after tasting at the brewery:  More floral than I remembered.  Increasingly  terrestrial after becoming more beer-savvy.  Still great brew.
Medium whitish brown head with dark caramel brown color.  Taste and aroma of sweet hops and malt.  Nice balance of sweet malt and bitterness.  Very satisfying!
Two words; Cat Piss and gimmick. Ok three.
One of four beers I tried last night and this was my favorite. Starts off with a nice kick of hops. Soon after is balanced well by some malt, and what else can I say, this was a damn good beer.

Ive always wanted to try this and thanks to Ross my wish has come to true.  Poured into my Chimay glass it almost looks like a fine trappist ale with its rich dark amber color and off-white creamy head.  The aroma is of earthy resinous hops and a big abundance of caramel malt.  What the aroma lacks the taste brings.  This is quite the complex lil bastard that I behold in my glass.  The taste is of  earthy hops, caramel malt and in the finish notes of dark fruit and a bit of candied sugar visit this bastard.  The carbonation is moderate and allows for a creamy easy drinking brew.   Slightly dry in the finish with an alcohol warmth as the beer comes to temperature.
Big in every way. hops and malt are equally prominant, difficult to describe the taste, but I love it. worth the money

This beer is a great one.  Starts off a deep red, with a thin tan head leaving behind a bit of lacing.  It smells of oak, hop, and a hint of alcohol behind it.  The flavor is a difficult one to describe, it balances a nice hop bite, a solid malt backbone, and a bit of alcohol.  This is one that I will always enjoy.

22oz bottle, a bit afraid dipping into this one, however My feers were quickly subdued with the complexity of flavors, good amounts of hop and malt. Very enjoyable to sit down and drink. Stone continues to impress.

22 oz bottle. Pours a rich, dark red with a medium-thick light tan head. Plenty of tiny bubbles. Aroma is dark, foreboding... First taste... mmmm. Initial malt presence and a hint of roasted sweetness that soon gives way to the hops and a bitterness on the sides of the tongue. A bit of grapefruit. Very nice malt presence. Occasional taste of cherry? Aftertaste a bit resiny, malt lingers, but bitter to the end.
Great beer with a ton of flavor.  There is no reason to drink beer that is not made by Stone.  My neighbor and myself enjoy these regularly every weekend after we work on our houses.

Bomber. Poured with small tan head, nice dark color and plenty of chill haze like a homebrew.Nice hop to malt balance, not as "thick as it looks. Head gone in seconds but laced nicely. The hops end up dominating the palate when all is said + done. Worth the $4.50 at the CandleWick in Buckingham, Pa
What this beer lacks in finesse, it partly makes up for in power.  Strong hop bitterness is offset by some maltiness, but it is not very sweet.  Not bad.
Great beer.  Pours a generous light brown head, complementing a dark copper body.  Citrus aromas and a strong hoppy/grapefruit taste.  Has a good bitter finish.  Definitely a recommend.

Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival 2006. Deep red color with creamy head. Extreme flowery, citrysy and piney american hop aroma. Sweet aroma. Strong, good flowery and citrusy hop flavor along with toffee and caramel. Strong bitterness. Bitter and fruity finish with toffee notes. Very good hop aroma and flavor, a bit too surypy.
A strong, arrogant beer.  Good color, strong flavor and liberal use of bittering hops makes this one a hopheads delight.  Now, if I could only get the local bar to put it on tap...
Great strong ale, almost tastes like a barley wine to me. Very generously hopped and nice tart sweet counterpoint. On tap at Gingerman and Hop Devil  and my new favorite Collins in NYC.

The white grapefruit flavor was overwhelming and honestly I couldnt taste anything else except for hoppy bitterness.  The bottle claims sophistication but I sensed no such subtlety.  I havent seen (tasted) an ale more undeserving of the 99th percentile.

I thought I was sophisticated enough to enjoy a brew like this.  But I tried a bomber of this while vacatining out in Arizona (since I cannot recieve this in IL yet.) and I cant really say I like it.  Too much going on , caramel, fruit, overload...Id rather have an Eye of the Hawk by Mendocino.

Bomber:  Deep maroon color with a fluffy tan head.  Aroma is caramel, well hopped, sugar, some malts, a light chocolate note, tart citrus fruits, and lightly spiced.  Taste is well hopped again, the tart fruitiness comes through too.  The caramel maltiness shows through as well as this beer lingers around on your tongue.  Palate is nicely bitter and lasting.  I like this a little bit more than the oaked Arrogant Bastard, which was slightly overpowered by the oak taste.  Overall, Great beer.  Will buy more for cellar.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2007 22oz bottle, fresh bottle sampled next to arather fresh oaked bastard. pours a deep mahogony with fluffy head. identical appearance to oaked a.b. big malty aroma with PNW hops, nose of brown sugar, grapefruit, caramel, and toffee. very malty taste perfectly balanced with PNW hops. sticks on palate well. easy to drink, alcohol well hidden. every sip desires another. just an amazing beer, perhaps the oaked was a little more complex.3.8.  11/27/07, 22oz bottle. i still enjoy this but I find it a bit too much and overwhelming. theres nothing refined about this beer, the hops and malts are brash and it doesnt go down easy. i can see enjoying this from time to time but Id never want to drink it often.3.7.

Pine and caramel aromas. rubyish color with a tan head. good weight in the mouth plus some aromatic, the right carbonation. hops jaggedy, moderately resonant, near the edge but a clear honey malt signal  giving balance.

Bomber; pours a beautiful clear deep amber with a minimal off-white head that dissipates to a thin whisp that persists throughout; good lacing.  A floral hops aroma with hints of orange peel, caramel and grapefruit.  Aroma follows through nicely in the palate.  This is pretty hopped up with a crisp bitter bite aftertaste that lingers.  A bit like an IIPA; not overly complex but lived up to my expectations quite nicely; highly recommended.

22 oz bottle.  I am annoyed by beers like this.  Its yet another overrated, over-hopped Stone brew with no real uniqueness or defining character.  Appearance is pretty much perfect, though; pours a dark garnet with a big, frothy, tan head; decent lacing down the glass.  Aroma is heavily floral and hoppy; some caramel and nuttiness.  Flavor--not surprisingly--is hops, hops, and hops, with a little sweet malt and grassiness as an afterthought; its 7.2% alcohol by volume is not evident; an hour after drinking, brushing my teeth followed by gargling with Listerine wont get the bitter aftertaste out of my mouth.  Medium bodied with medium carbonation.  This drink is utterly lacking in the balance department and is drastically overrated, in great part because it says "Stone" on the label.
22oz bomber. Nice aroma, amber color, okay head. Flavors abound, although alcohol seeps through. Good American strong ale.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2008 Draught. Sweet hop aroma with some caramellized sugar. Deep chestnut colour. Light brown head, creamy and quite stable. The flavour is quite hoppy, on the brink of snapping the aroma hop flavour. Rather bitter aftertaste. Quite drinkable in spite of its ABV. 7 3 7 3 17

Bottle at GBBF08. Caramelly aroma, slightly rough. Nice clear dark chestnut colour. The flavour is also quite caramelly. Some hoppiness, quite bitter, and slightly rough. 7 3 7 3 19

Poured from a bottle, little middle brown head with a reddish brown cloudy body.  the aroma was that of citris and pine like not nearly as strong as the 2b bastard that I had in the past.  Pine smell was also present in the flavor.  This was a gift from  an elf that has been very nice, and that knows her beer.  Palate again not as strong as the double bastard however was strong.  Overall a very good beer for xmas night after a long long couple days.  Thank you elf.
On Tap at The Office in Montclair, NJ.  My usual there for the last few months along with Harpoon IPA and Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA.

Bomber.  Very dark red brown, nice lacing from brownish head.  Aroma is hoppy with caramel and alcohol.  Taste is citrusy and bitter, but more bitter.  Pretty hoppy, although this followed an IIPA so Im extrapolating.  Thickish mouthfeel.  All in all an awesome beer.

Bomber from Beers of the World share with a buddy.  App.: very reddish-brown, med. tan, fluffy head with good lacing.  Aroma: cherries, dark malts hoppy background (citrusy-resinous), chocolate and vanilla.  Palate: med. bodied with med.-low carbonation.  Flav.: hops!  some malt, drier than expected (based on nose), touch of sweetness, grapefruity hops, green (celery?) afterwards, decent bitter finish.  Nice.  Why dont we have more of this in Canada...?

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2007 12/14/2006:  I havent had one of these for quite some time and I still havent rated it yet, so I figured it was about time to.  I am going to taste this next to the Oaked Arrogant Bastard so that I can compare... 

Arrogant Bastard Ale is a deep reddish-copper color.  It has a very large, fluffy, and creamy tan head that has a nice lacing effect on the glass.  The aroma has a sweet maltiness and some fruity hoppiness that hints at whats to come.  This beer has a wonderfully balanced flavor of sweet caramel malt and fruit/citrus/pine hop bitterness.  The finish is also balanced between a moderate sweetness and orangy hop bitterness.  The bitterness of this beer is "aggressive", but quite well controlled.  There is no alcohol in the aroma or flavor; its completely hidden.  The mouth feel is a bit thicker than average, quite creamy, and very smooth.  22 oz bottle from Josephs Beverage Center.  Rating:  8  4  8  4  17 = 4.1

I gotta hand it to Stone...  All their beers are great, but its amazing that such a well made beer with an elevated alcohol content like Arrogant is so widely available and so reasonably priced!_________________________
Double Dry Hopped Cask Conditioned Arrogant Bastard Ale 
I managed to get a 0.3 L glass of this special beer at "The Most Arrogant Bar (Pub) in America 2006-2007" event at Bostons Bistro & Pub (Dayton, Ohio) on 2/22/2007.  This was supposed the the first firkin of Stone Double Dry Hopped Cask Conditioned Arrogant Bastard Ale ever made.  It was double dry hopped with Centennial hops...
When first pumped into the glass, the Double Dry Hopped Cask Conditioned Arrogant Bastard is nearly all head.  Eventually it falls out to reveal a mostly clear amber colored beer.  There is still a substaintial creamy beige head that lasts the entire time.  The head also some ring pattern lacing on the glass.  The aroma reminds me of sweet clementines with a bit of bitter orange zest.  The flavor was fairly dry and reserved.  The usual huge maltiness and obscene hoppiness of the regular Arrogant Bastard was replaced by a smooth, moderately dry and bitter flavor with a bit of earthiness.  Lighter mouthfeel than the original as well (medium to medium-full overall).  The palate was soft, smooth, and creamy.  Quite good, but why mess with the original?!  I feel privileged to have been able to try this rare beer...  Rating:  8  4  7  4  16 = 3.9.

Pours a red color into my glass with a thick lasting tan head. Smell is hoppy but sweet at the same time. Taste is really unbelievable, I honestly didnt think this would be this good. First thing that hit me is a touch of sweetness then instantly it is balanced out by a huge kick of hops but nothing overbearing. Grassy, piney, and spicy hop flavor with the sweetness being fruity and toffee. Thicker mouthfell is always appreciated. Wow, wish I could get this more easily.

This copper-colored ale poured with a magnificent off-white head. The flavor is initially malty, but the hop bitterness soon takes over, enhanced by some spice tastes. This is a well-crafted beer that is a pleaure to drink.

Nice reddish/brownish color with persistent head, leaves a pretty lacing on the glass. Smells strong, pungent, wonderful, tastes even better. Starts off as a sharp hoppy bitterness on the tip of the tongue, finishes as a deeper bitterness cut with a slight malty/earthy sweetness that you barely notice. Too many hints of flavor to count. Every drink leaves me wanting more. I did this as my first rating because its probably my favorite brew right now.

Man, I can get this about anywhere around Nashville, and I have never rated it. Go figure. Well, I bought this bottle at Frugal McDugal. Pours a beautiful deep cherry brown with a thick off white head.  Aroma of toasted malt, fruity hops, and a hint of alcohol.  Nice medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Hops take center stage, and have some grassy, peppery and piney notes. Malt backbone of dark fruit and caramel. This is the benchmark american strong ale for me. However, this bottle was a little past its prime. Some of the sweetness and fresh hoppiness was gone. Otherwise this is a 4.2 or 4.3. I will get a fresh one and rerate.

This is a real beer. Hops to the massif. Complete assult on your taste buds. 

A favorite, but typically not a recommendation.

What can I say. Arrogance is among the finest example of a well (very well) hopped IPA that I have encountered, even on regular trips to Belgium.
How can I buy it in Scotland?
The sentiments expressed on the lable are spot on- Were not Worthy.

Bottle.   Pour is a rusty brown color with a delicious thick off white head, that lingers.   Smell is hoppy with some toasty malt and dried fruit.   Taste is whamo, citrusy, piney, heavy malty, caramelly goodness.   Definte bitterness.   Reasonably dry finish on this medium to full bodied brew.   Super duper.   Prost to Stone for doing things proper!   For $5-6 this is Fanfriggintastic!
Bottle.  Poured copper brown with thick long lasting head.  Aroma of hops an caramel.  Flavour of hops, malt citrus and oat?   Long lasting hoppy finish.  I tasted the finish half an hour later.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Bomber courtesy of Secret Santa!  Pours Dark red, with a creamy, tan head.  Malty notes, chocolate, coffee, hazelnut, and some dark fruits.  Tastes malty, a good amount of hops as you swallow. Very good an another winner from stone.

Bomber, poured dark that look black til I moved it against a light, it was a dark red ale, lots of bubbles that fined out to a nice covering, nose of roasted malts, chocolate, hints of cherry, coffee, vanilla and hops, taste of hops, dark malts, hints of stout flavor and syrup, bubbly on the tongue, very nice, I have had this for a about a month in my closet, why did I wait so long to try?...

Wow. Went out a few months ago and got a couple dozen singles include this one. Why, oh why did I wait to drink this one? Pours a rich brown with a dark tan/orange hinted head. Malty sweet with a slight citrus aroma and flavor. Nice bitter that stays around.  Excellent.
Had this for the 1st time this past week. Great taste all the way around. This is a must have on anyones beer list. Can not wait to get more.  Arrogance is Bliss.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2007 Nice full bodied ale.  Small head, rich flavor with hints of citrus fruit and a nice bitter finish.  Cloudy brown in color.

Surprised I havent rated this one yet.  Aroma is malty, yeasty, dry fruit.  Pours dark brown, small but nice head.  Flavor is nice and malty, slightly sweet with dried fruits and yeastiness at first, then finishes bitter.  Relatively full body.  Gotta love this beer, its a classic, and available whenever you need it.

This is it...my favorite beer.  Stereotypical (for Stone) and delicious grapefruit flavor (isnt it perfect for citrus-growin territory?)...this beer is an enjoyment with every sip!  This flavor appears in their IPA and Pale Ale too, but is strongest with Arrogant Bastard.  Love this one.  Its not just the weather I love in San Diego...its the local brews too!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2007 22 oz bottle - wow.  pours a deep seemingly hazy almost plum colour.  Huuuuuuge piney hop aroma.....but there is a nice balance with a slight sourness that reminded me of the darker Trappist brews.  Amazing.  I just wanted to smell this all night.  Flavour is really lovely - big citrus/bitter hop hit to start, then theres a hint of malty sweetness and some dark fruit, even a bit of roastiness/smoke.....and then nothing...but wait, KA-BOOM - huge bitter finish, that goes on for a long time.  Alcohol VERY well-integrated........  There is literally a gap of a couple seconds between the last of the flavours and the the wave of bitterness in the finish.  Its like in a slasher flick when you think the killer is dead and then he springs back to life for one last scare.  Yeah, just like that.  So great.  When I realize this is not readily available in Canada, I cry.  Really, I do.  But it does make me appreciate these conjugal visits all the more.
Wow, this really is spicy, a bit caramelly too.  Has a long finish and lasting head.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2009 Bottle - Thanks to Jan (ØLbaren). Copper - white head. High hoppy - violent, resin, grass, straw, grape, grass, dry. Not as focused as I expected. - I had this again a couple time efter... wow what a beer. It dont get more balanced/focused, but just a lot better, still confusing. Bisquit, cookie, roasted, high hoppy, light sweetness... I love it !!!

Wow ... I realized Id never entered a rating on this classic.  Its big and dark red with a solid, cratered-like-the-moon head.  Big sweet raisin-bready aroma.  Extraordinarily hoppy, very sweet and citrusy, this is maltier and fruitier than I wouldve recalled.  Very smooth and frothy.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2008 My recent fling with stone eventually led me to the bastard.  if youve tasted and enjoyed a stone you will enjoy a bastard.

Aroma: A prominent to intense hop aroma with a citrusy, floral, perfume-like, resinous, piney, and/or fruity character derived from American hops.  Fruitiness, either from esters or hops, is also detected Some alcohol is noted.
Flavor: Hop flavor is high hop character is citrusy, floral, resinous, piney and fruity very high hop bitterness, although the malt backbone supports the strong hop character and provides the best balance.  Mouthfeel: Smooth, medium-light to medium-bodied mouthfeel without hop-derived astringency great example

The beer is a deep mahogany color under a creamy tan head.  Aroma is tons of grapefruit.  The palate is almost perfect  pleasing, refreshing, and not too heavy.  Some malty sweetness comes through in the flavor, but its mostly hop bitterness.  Im sure its been said before, but this is a great beer.
Great solid brew that looks very good,and also nice head. The taste is also very pleasing but I liked it better when it was ice cold then drinking it slowlyto let some of the flavors come out more.
One of my all-time favorites.  Deep red color and great balance.  Just received some 2006 Double Bastard and will be reviewing soon.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2006 22. A beautiful looking beer. Toffee, choc and fruit. Hoppy to the end. like other stones it hides its strength. will try again under better circumstances to re-rate with more detail as tonight i was not worthy.

22oz bottle - pours a dark burgandy/red, with a 1 inch (or so) frothy and foamy tanned head - beautiful really, almost like a trappist in its rocky appearance. Leaves a nice lacing in the glass.The aroma is quite hoppy, but not overwhelming, with a bit of spiciness in the back. The taste on the other hand, is massive! Really nice, frothy mouthfeel off the top, with a big huge hop and malt blast, though actually in good balance with one another despite the size of the attack. Piney, earthy American hops, with the thick malt character standing right behind the massive hop front. The finish is a bitter assault from The Gates of Hell, and it just goes on and on and on. The first few sips I took had me shaking my head back and forth, squinting my eyes and puckering my lips, going "Wahhhhh!", but throughout the glass I became more adjusted to it. All in all, this is very good. Strong and flavourful, take no prisoners ale, with the alcohol very well hidden. A little less bitterness and rounded, balanced flavour in the finish would push this to 4 or above.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2006 22 oz bottle.  Pours red with a tan head.  Nice floral and hops aroma.  Very strong hops bite, with long lasting hoppy aftertaste.  A good beer with a strong bite and a whole lot of flavor.  The taste just lingers a little long for me.
It live up to its name. redish in color with a creamy head. Lots of hops and malt. It is a little harsh the first time I tried it, but it grew on me.
Nice floral aroma.Pours a redish color with a cream colored head.Hops up front then a great maltyness.Finishes bitter and hot.A nice solid brew.

Bottle. Very dark red pour. Intense hoppy and spicy aroma. Strong bite with thick hops, spice, and a little floral note. Not smooth, but palate is what I expect from a strong ale. I love the commercial description!
On tap...Quite hoppy, as most "strong" ales are.  Very strong and malty...the 7.2% alcohol will really sneak up on you, if youre not careful.

22 ounce bottle.  Pretty dark Robitussin red beer, with a tan, very sticky lasting head.  Huge herbal, spicy hop aroma.  Notes of cara malts.  The flavor is very herbal.  Very aggresive, medicine,  grassy, piney flavor.  Im not really happy with this.  Astringant finish.  Bitter as all hell. Back in the day, this was A1 on my list.  The last 2 times Ive had it, it was crap.  I wonder what happened.

On tap: Ruby red with small creamy head which dissapated rather quickly.  Notes of cran, bannana, rasin, candied malt, slight coffee aroma. Lovely character with perfect mouthfeel. Slightly dry, complex but drinkable.

Served in my Arrogant Bastard glass.  A nice meld of floral, fresh and/or kind of spicy hops in the nose.  The color is a nice burnt red to brownish.  The head is a nice carmel/toffee color with great lacing.  The flavor is a good carmel malt flavor mixed witha nice hop bitter finish.  A damn good strong ale, and another fine brew from the guys at Stone.
Poured a red with a tan head.  Spicy aroma of hops. Very nice bitter citrusy flavor of grapefruit and piney hops. Excellent  Stuff!

This potent deep cherry-red ale produced a big, rocky light brown head and a subtle yet enticing aroma of perfumy hops, lemons, slight yeast, and apples. The flavor was bitter and dry with a slight sweetness in the beginning. The finish was powerful- a long rolling wave of drying bitterness accompanied by the warming sensation of the alcohol.

after after a few of these I thought I should rate this beer. from the bottle. poured a nice Garnet with a tan head that left some good lacing. aroma a nice citrus mixture of oranges, lemon, tangerine and grapefruit, sugar, hops, grassy. flavor all that nice sweet citrus with a nice bitterness and dryness I am glad that I can now buy this when ever I want
Garnet body, tan head.  Malt aroma with some hops.  Bitter, bitter flavour.  Frothy palate.
beautiful color and head. Sweet with citrus notes. very complet with a medium-body and drying mouth-feel.  Really nice.

Bottle from Belmont Station, Portland.  Ruby colour with lasting tan head.  Sour hop aroma is lovely.  Malts are sour coffee.  Sourish in mouth, astringent hop on end.  Cats pee aroma.  Rich in mouth, but slightly sour as well and then this astringency cuts in.  This is more a state of mind than anything else.  Take bits that are attractive, sour, astringent and here you have something arrogant.  It seems to say "Here I stand with strong statements of taste and knock me down if you dare."  Smells of a yeasty English bitter.  Yeasty like Harveys Sussex Best Bitter.  Some fullness in mouth.  Yeah, I liked it.

I cannot believe that Ive never rated this... huh... pours a deep brown with a nice and lacey tan head, floral hop nose, citrus, beautiful hop and ester notes, slightly chocolately and a little nutty, though this is an amazing and wonderfuly crafted ale I think the notes on the label are probably my favorite part, i think that whole schpeel should be on the brewery description, who agrees? come over here so that we can start the reolution!

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2006 Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale
22 oz bomber
Recent brewing, argued over 10/06
Medium pour in a tulip glass

Poured dark ruddy brown with a medium sized mostly lasting fizzy off white head.

Smelt of strong citrusy lemon lime hops, some light piney perfumey hops as well,   with light sweet caramel tones. Pineapple candy overall.

Taste was upfront strong grapefruit and moderate pine, with light nutty maltiness, followed by a dark breaded maltiness, somewhat bittersweet, followed by a second front of hops, this time harshly grapefruit in nature, followed by an herbal, tea-like bitter hops, licorice, and the same sweet gelatineous lingering finish.  Mouthfeel was medium-bodied, slightly creamy, fizzy and moderately astringent.

Overall, the nose is spellbinding, the appearance good. The balance of hops to malt seems such to enliven the hops, but to not let it get overly out of character.  Perfect in that sense.  The finish is rich with flavors, but I would have liked to see a bit more complexity on the foretaste though.  Excellent overall.

Everytime I taste this beer, I find something new to like about it.  The aroma is mostly citrus hops, and a barely detectable malt.  The flavor begins with a subtly sweet maltiness, which is then ripped to pieces by layers of visciously bitter hops.  One of my favorite beers in the world, which I luckily can find almost anywhere these days.

Mmmm hops, and lots of it.  Pours an amber brown with off white foam, creamy, thin and lasting.  Aroma is LOTS of citrusy hops.  Taste is hops, a faint cheese like taste, gives way to malt (doughy), and then right back to hops - white grapefruit like citrusiness.  If you dont like hops, "youre not worthy" to like this beer. Thanks to Jen for procuring this one for me.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2007 Bomber.  Pours hazy, caramel red.  Head is reddish.  Tons of malt up front, hops even a little earthiness in this one.  Creamy, good body.  Stone uses a ton of hops in their beers, and I love it! True masters.

pours dark red, brown frothy head that is mostly diminishing. Aroma is lightly malty, cookies, moderatly hoppy of flowers and grapefruit, with hints of yeast dough.  Flavor is lightly sweet and moderatly hoppy bitter and grapefruit dominates the taste and aftertaste.  Light to medium bodied, watery, and livley.  Also gave me a wicked headache.

22oz bomber.  Pours a slightly hazy caramel red with a two finger pillowy light beigeish red head.  Aroma is grapefruity resinous hops, caramel and toasty malts.  Do I also get a hint of peated malt?  Ah, yes, the toasty smoky malts come through more in taste, as does some earthy resiny woody hops.  Quite a bit of bitterness throughout through to a dry finish.  Never did get much sweetness, but thats just fine.  Moderate carbonation though very creamy, medium-full bodied.  The lacing consisted of a sheet with only a few breaks--nice.  Quite good.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: UPDATED: JUL 22, 2010 Pours a deep, dark amber with plenty of effervescents; head is full, creamy, lasting, and canvas-colored leaving nice lacing.  Plenty of hops, mostly resinous pine with white grapefruit supporting,and a good malt base, toffee and caramel and just a touch of dried fruits (raisins and dried apricots).  Flavor is fairly aggressive, but not overpowering in any phase.  Moderately high bitterness with mostly piney hops; this is matched by a sweet caramel background with some toasty bready notes and a nice woodsy tinge of maple wood.  Ends mostly dry with some maple wood notes with all the sweetness giving way to the bitterness.  Palate is superb, soft and medium-full, with a creamy, smooth mouthfeel even considering the hop level.  Not overly complex, but you really get the full spectrum of flavors, from sweet malt base to bitter hops and great harmonious melding of flavors.  Stone does it again, wonderfully done beer!

Pours a dark brown, with plenty of red highlights and a large bubbly and persistant head.  Aroma balances some caramel scents with some strong citrus hops.  Taste first attacks with coffee roast, but is sweetened a little bit by caramel and toffee elements.  Finishes with a strong delightful hoppy flavor and black coffee roast.  Some woody tastes show up as the beer warms.  Medium to full mouthfeel and medium carbonation.  Cloys slightly after a while, for whatever reason, even though this isnt terribly sweet or anything.  Very good beer, lots to offer.

Bottle. Pours out a deep blood amber colour with a nice foamy-creamy white-tan head. Moderate activity. Nose is hoppy, grassy and a caramel/toffee element. Taste is very full bodied and hoppy. Palate is relativily smooth and caramel. The overall character is very aggressive but the palate tones it down to a manageable level making it very subtle and complex.

served at NYC Brewtopiafest.  pours a light copper-brown body with a small white head.  smells of citrus hops.  tastes of citrus hops, grass, grapefruit and caramel and is slightly bitter. really really dries out your mouth by the aftertaste.  not overly complex but its crisp, refreshing and smooth.  one of the best at the beerfest.

citrusy and toffee in scent.  appearance is dark red maybe even light brown. by the story on the bottle i was either expecting something either really strong or really bad. but this isnt bad. Its defenetly a good brew!

Clear cherry wood color with a 1 finger foamy head.  Grapefruit, spice, orange and caramel aroma.  Big caramel and piney hop flavor with spicy hops lingering in the mouth.  Medium-full body but a bit syrupy.
Dark ruby brown. Aroma is toffee, and sweet caramel with some good citrus notes from the hops. Taste is caramelly, touch of bread and roast followed by massive bitterness. Very nice indeed.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2016 

Fresh enjoy by 1/13/17 16 ounce can. As bitter as any IPA, but with more malt sweetness for balance. Beautiful ruby color.  Superior brew!

Thanks to OhioDad "I think". Sampled at the Fall Crawl 2006 (our camping trip). WOW is this good. Pours a darkish amber with a large head. Aroma is floral and mild pineapple. Flavor has a mild bitter taste with hints of pine and grapefruit. Awesome stuff.
What can I say? The aroma almost knocked me on the floor, this is a great beer for hopheads!
Cloudy brown with almost no head. Aroma is a syrupy citrus. Flavor is balanced malts and hops with a dry, bitter aftertaste. Very enjoyable.
ahh the bastard, soo good but had soo long ago. love the amusing tales on the back and the beer lives up to it

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2006 Aptly named.  This is an in-your-face ale that isnt for the faint of heart.  Dark cranberry colored concoction with a bubbly, beige head.  Aroma is malt, pine and hops with a hint of citrus.  Nice dry, very bitter finish.  Well done.

This is a VERY good ale.  It has a wonderful flavor, good aroma and is VERY strong for what it is.  If you want a good buzz, good flavor and an interesting finish youll love this ale.  It has a good hoppy taste to it, tastes great and has a wonderful flavor with a bitter sort of finish that will make you want to only drink MORE of this wonderful ale.  The taste starts strong, has great flavor, smooth, crisp and finishes off actually somewhat bitter.  Pretty dry for an ale but definitely worth the buy every single time.  This has to be one of my favorites, always coming back to it, anyone who likes a good ale definitely should lool forward to this.  It is quite a treat.  The bottle isnt extremely appealing although the name is, the ale overall looks really good, clear, not extremely thick but tastes like its thick.

Bottle from Liquid Solutions.  Pours a reddish brown with an off white head.  Aroma is a syrupy citrus.  Flavor starts of slightly malty sweet before hop bitterness slaps you in the face.  This hoppiness seems to linger.  I wish it (and most of Stones beers) was more easily obtained in Missouri.

Nice rubby red color with foamy meadium head.  Tast  the citrus flavor with a strong bitter finish but my overall a bit plain.  I think I had a bad "flat" bottle.  Ill have to try it again one day but since it is not available in michigan it might be a while.
Dark brown and cloudy with a small thin but long lasting head and light carb. Caramel and pine aromas. Medium bodied with slight malt upfront and a long strong hop dryness in the finish.
Nice dark brown liquid with excellent citrus aroma. Considerable hops dominate the taste, and the malt is rather subdued.  The finish is dry, and tastes of grapefruit. $4/22oz
Hazy amber,lasting tan head.Citrus hop nose.Good malt backbone explodes into a citrus hop finish

i really like this beer, pours a dark brown witha large tan head. piney, resiny hop aroma that follows right into the first sip.  nice malty backbone that holds up well against the hops.  good finish to a great beer.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: I love this beer.  They are certainly telling the truth about people either love or hate this beer, but if you are worthy of enjoying this flavor, you have yourself a gem.
Over the years, this beer has become such a staple in my life, I actually forget sometimes that its around.  Its a unique beer, that never changes.  Solid year after year.  Truly a great beverage.

(Draught) Pours dark red to brown with a nougat coloured head. Fruity aroma with piney/rasiny hops. Hints of anise and some earthyness. The flavour is Fruity, Piney hops, malty sweetness that soon turnes to strong hoppy bitterness. Rasin with a menthol-ish touch. Great, dry grapeftuity afterbitterness.

Way more hops than you would ever expect from a beer this dark.  I defie the bottle, and say that I do in fact like it.  Is very intense with more flavors than you can taste with a single sip.  If youre feeling like a bastard, I suggest you try it.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2006 Ok the bottle is awesome , it says you probally wont like this, well they were partially right. It smells good looks good. but left a bad after taste in my mouth. Very very hoppy, I like hops but at some point you got to cut back to save the flavor balance. Its not bad a bad brew just not blended the way I like it.

Strong pleasant smell that brings to mind something metallic like...but in a good way.  There is a seductive red hue to this otherwise dark brown and generally opaque beer.  A strong hoppy explosion is immediate upon sipping that mellows out quickly with a slight but noticable tart aftertaste.  Overall the finish is smooth and refreshing.  A great beer.

Brown body, red shine, light brown creamy head, laces; Fat, bitter, hoppy, sweet; little creamy, little carbonation, balance, lacks depth; Very bitter, very long hoppy, little creamy, could easily be deeper.
This beer is pretty good. A good choice when you want a rough one. A good color as far as beer goes. Not a bad taste either.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2007 Bottle, Sept 2006.  I actually didnt hate or love this beer.  Color was a nice amber/brown/orange color.  Aroma was hoppy, but not overly strong.  Finish was very bitter, up front was fruity/creamy, nice and smooth.  Im not a hophead, but after a while the hops were not overpowering.  Would drink again, but not in love with it.

I can see how this seems to split people.  Despite its overwhelming percentile.  I get a feeling people who hate this brew REALLY hate it.  Its amber copper body with hardly any head lingers with smells of melons, mangoes, hops and the ever so faintest presence of medium roast malts.  A lot of times we find hop drinks on the heavy side end up tasting like the glue from scotch tape... but this beer defies that stereotype.

Bomber.  Dark orange/rust color with a thick tan head, mostly lasting.  Striped lacing.  Aroma of dark toffee malts, almost to the point of molasses, with candied orange peel and piney hops.
