UPDATED: FEB 11, 2005 Aroma is primarily hoppy, but there is some sweetness to it as well.  Reddish brown in color, holds its head pretty well.  Tons of flavor, plenty of malt and hops to go around.  Definitely not a beer for the Bud Light crowd, but if you like your beers intense, this is a good choice.

Love the hoppy aspect of this beer, but have to say that with all the hype, Im surprised its not *more*.  Have had (and made) more complex and tasty homebrew IPAs, which is the category that this beer really shold be in, though I have to admit that the character and consitency of this beer, from its chocolatey clearness to the delightfully tan head and pretty lacing would be hard to duplicate in a homebrew.  Good beer, but as with a lot of microbrews, too many bandwagoneers hopping on to laud its greatness.  Theres a lot of microbreweries in the US making comparable or better beers without receiving the accolades.

Wow. This is a hell of a beer, really ballsy and bursting with flavour. I love my hops, which this delivers in spades, as well as a plethora of other flavours, especially citrus ones. Though it is the little brother to the Double Bastard, it more than measures up.
A very masculine beer, fiery hops and an aggressive finish.  Much of its appeal is in the devil may care branding and the fierce taste.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2005 The hop-head in me loves this stuff... serious grapefruit, pine, & orange rind hop aromas attack you when pop the bottle.  Beautiful red color with fizzy (short-lived) off-white head.  Rough roasted malts support strong hop bitterness, fumes filling the sinus cavities.  Warming as it hits the belly.  Long, lingering bitter hop finish.  Great stuff.  But, does it live up to all of the silly hype?  NO.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Stop, Highland, IN<font size=-1>

Full head, beautiful red color.  Head has a very strong nutty flavor.  Beer flows down easily.  The only problem is that it has a very grainy finish, rough on the back of your throat and tongue; keeps it from being truly great.  It does, however, mess you up.

This beer..... has the wonderful taste of crushed asprin.  But towards the bottum of the bottle I started to notice the hops.  And it reminded me of a really crappy, watery version of my homebrew.  Its an ok beer.

well this is the best beer that i have currently ever tried...expensive.....yes.....cool bottle........yes.....taste great.... yes .....gets you messed up.......yes.....dang this beer has it all...and plus the bottle makes fun of you. good lord if you havent tried this go to the distributor and buy a case... im already there.
This beer is very Powerful. Hops are very present and noticable. I truly cant wait for the double. Soon enough. Get this beer now if you havent had it.

Deep copper color with ruby highlights.Nice rocky tan head and nice lace.The smell is sweet with  apples,grapefruit, and a light hint of malt.The taste had apples,hops, and a little malt.Hop bitterness in the finish.Well balanced.Medium-heavy body with lots of carbonation sting.Wouldnt take many of these to mess someone up.Seem to have more kick than 7.2%.Good beer indeed.
(draft) Roasty, malty, hoppy, weirdness. Id like this more without the bitter finish.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2006 Re-rate, the first Stone bottle I have bought in our Great Lake State. Transparent ruby red with nice off-white head that lasts awhile, revives with a quick swirl. Duvel glass is completely full of lacing. Huge bitter pine resins up front, very sticky, plenty of caramel and syruppy mollasses in the background. Flavor again all pine resin up front,  pine through and through, but surprisingly balanced in a way. Huge malt backbone really helps balance this out. Very smooth palate/mouthfeel. Bit of alcohol showing up for only 7.2%, still well done regardless.
One tasty, great beer. Not a beer for all, but well worth the try. This is one hell of a beer! Buy one, open one, drink it, and become a Bastard!
What is there to say...perfect.  Strong hops, no balance what so ever, just strong hops.  Dry, Crisp. Perfect

This beer comes out kicking.  Thick off white head stays a while on top of the beautiful red/amber pour.  Grapefuit is the dominant aroma here, although there is a hint of floral as well.  Roasted malts add a bitter chocolate base, which is offset by a very bitter hoppy finish.  I get a hint of grapefruit in the finish as well.

Bottle obtained from Trader Joes in Phoenix. Deep copper with a small white head. crisp citrus hoppy aroma, there is also a little bit of caramel? This is great, lots of bitterness up front, creamy body with lots of malt to back it up. Finish is bitter but doesnt last quite as long as Rogue Santa. Im looking forward to trying the Double Bastard that I have stowed away somewhere.
Pours a nice reddish brown with good head.  Malty, roasted taste with moderate hops.

My dad brought me a variety of beers when he went to california.  I had previously read reviews on Arrogant Bastard and had saw pictures of the bottle but being from South Dakota I didnt think I had much of a chance of getting to try this.  Extremely dark amber red with a creamy head that doesnt fade away.  It had a distinctive hoppy malty smell.  It had a powerful roasty taste and an aftertaste that lasts for quite some time.  I was totally impressed by this beer.  It is the first Strong American Ale I had ever tried.  I hope someday I will have the opportunity to try the double bastard.
Dark brown color, medium tan head.  Slightly sour aroma.  Dark malts and hops flavor collide and make it slightly sharp and astringent.   Bitter finish.  Decent enough, but I was expecting more.
a beer that commands your attention, very dark red/amber color, hoppy and bitter, but also very smooth, great beer
Frothy thick light tan head. Dark red body light  hoppy aroma.  hoppy tate bitter finish nice lacing

Over-hyped media blitz.  Good job Stone!  One minute it barely existed in a few bars, and then the next minute it was on the shelf in every 7-11.  Nice logo, great artwork and attitude, fancy silkscreened bottles.  Only available in 22s, from what Ive seen.  In the end the beer itself is another west-coast Cascade dry-hopped pale ale, with a little more character than Sierra Nevada.  Its definitely very tasty, just more hype and image than anything else.  You could say that Im arrogant and snobby about Arrogant Bastard.  Stone is a good brewery though, Id recommend Stones Ruination IPA over this one, however.

It pours with a dense head, leaving good lacework, has a deep mahogny color, with hop and nutty barley-malt aroma, follows through a little malt accented, with a robust balance of hop bitterness in the palate with an agrissive bitter hops finish.
Biting, strong flavor that is terrific for the palate and pleasing to the nose.  Hits you quick and hard with the aroma, and appearance is fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2005 This beer started out looking like just another nice small brewery beer.  Reddish dark amber color with small head.  Aroma fantastic, nice floral bouquet.  I don’t buy that this is really hop heavy.  It’s well balanced with enough hops kicking in to balance out the maltiness.  I loved it though I didn’t find it the most complex beer in the world, just a style I love.

Tasted from a 22oz bottle.  The label doesnt lie, this is a big beer, aggressively hopped.  It pours out to a really deep ruby color in the glass with a creamy off-white/tan head.  It starts with a sweet, almost chocolatey/caramely malt flavor before the real arrogance kicks in.  There is an intense flavor of american hops that is somewhat citrusy.  The alcohol isnt really detectable through all of the hops.  It is highly bitter in the finish, but has a very thick mouthfeel.  Good beer, but one bottle is probably enough.

bottle. who likes hops...mmm I do! nice tawny brown color with a half inch frothy head, great lacing! Initial sweet malt flavor quickly devoured by intense hops. hops hops hops. tiny smoky aftertaste, slight fruity orange subtilties...good, but you gotta love hops...the malt was a little syruppy for me, would have liked the malt a little less dark..just a smidge, all in all an amazing brew!! last bottle in the store! ( woodys see my review if you live in middle TN)

This beer is AWESOME!!..Beautiful deep amber with a delicous tan head. To me this beer smells somewhat fruity. Deliciously smooth but still with a bite. Awesome beer. Im lucky to be able to get this anywhere here in Phoenix..

I wasnt really a huge fan of this beer, was expecting a lot more out of it i guess.  Had a great dark amber color but the taste never quite felt right.  Maybe it was the high alcohol content, but it just didnt sit over well with my tongue.  Guess "im not worthy"

Had this beer on tap at a small place in northeastern Pennsylvania (dont remember the bar).  Rich brass pour w/ reddish highlights supporting a solid dirty white head.  Aroma of big hops with a touch of roasted malt and smoke.  Fantastic full bodied hops everywhere but with a little less bitterness than, say, Victorys Hop Devil or Hop Wallop.  Nice balance of malts.  This beer is more complex than amy of the other intensely hoppy beers Ive tried.  Unfortunately, its not available near me - or I havent found it yet - so Ill have to remember the name of that place so I can get another few pints.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2005 I love hops and I love this beer. Awesome strong hair spray burn on your tongue that I love so much. Hops galore, and good alcohol content.

Prime golden dark color, the perfect tinge.  Nice head, plenty of aroma. Hops & malt balanced very well, with fruity notes coming through traces of smokiness.  Tasted a bit strange at first until my palate adjusted and i could hardly put the glass down til it was empty.  Doesnt get much better than this. Too bad its so hard to get around here.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2005  Great beer.  Stone Brewing has been wonderful so far.  Bravo!  Very bitter, but I liked that.  Really quite good.  It was very easy to drink and the aftertaste is very strong.  The aroma is great.  Nothing wrong with this.  I would recommend not drinking this warm.  It is not good warm in my opinion.

Dark copper color; creamy head. The aroma is malty, hoppy but not fruity as expected; some roasted malt. Full body, very good malt, nutty. Immediately the bitterness takes over, for a bold final (again, not particularly fruity nor aromatic).

Cloudy brown color. Strong aroma of hop, fragrant, and roasted malt. Really bitter taste, some caramel and some sweetness. The final is very bitter but not enough fragrant. Good, but I dont go crazy...

Bottle. Deep amber color, gorgeous tan head that clung strongly to my glass. Great aroma. Sweet and malty, hoppy, some smoky flavor too, fits together well. I cant taste the alcohol. Aftertaste keeps everything melded together very well, wonderfully smooth for a beer this strong. The Double Bastard is certainly superior, but Ill gladly drink this any chance I get.

Its not even funny how many of these Ive had.  I decided not to rate this until I had another bottle of it.  Anyways, this has a very nice aroma to it,  and a great appearance and color.  Has a nice appricot like flavor and a smooth aftertaste to it.  For being 7.2% you dont taste the alcohol at all really.  Just plain a great beer.
For once I didnt have to change any of the rating drop down choices. I just left them all where they belong. All 1a accross the board.

Had this on tap at Dr. Dremos. I will mainly just comment on the differences in experience from having this in the bottle. This one came a deep crimson red with a medium to small head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma of hops, mainly citrus and a nice malt sweetness to round it out, more so than I remember from the bottle. The taste seems much more smooth and less rough. The hops make them selves known but are not as sharp as the bottle. The malts blend well and made for an overall smoother taste. Full bodied and more drinkable on tap. Great all around beer and even got my girlfriend drinking it.

Dark brown mahogony pour with a tan head and nice lacing.  Piney bitting hoppy finish with a smooth malty backbone and a slight sweet nuttly flaovor on the start.  Oh so tastey...I just love love those hops...this is an intense but balanced beer.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2005 This is a real mans ale, not for the faint of heart or bubbly urine drinkers.  The drink I revert to when I dont know what else to drink, and it never ever gets old.  Itd be nice if they would start selling these in 12 ounce 6 packs though..

Ive had this a few times over the last few years, but this bottle seemed very fresh or something.  Really about perfect for an IPA, a good amount of hops, but enough malt to stand up to it.  A real deal for $4 and change.  Worth the drive to Indiana for sure-next time Ill buy a whole case.

Body is a deep mahogany with lots of little white yeast particles and a fluffy tan head. Aroma is very active: pineapple and other citrus fruits, sugar, and hops. Taste is also off the wall: raisins, oranges, and a variety of other fruits, syrup, fresh hops, and, as it warms, a burnt coffee that leads to a dry finish. Very accessible and, at under $4 per bomber, very affordable.

This is brew is one of those types that i dont get to try very often due to always trying new beers, but evey now and again i get another sample and it always truely amazes me. Just a powerful brew with a thick sweetness up front that would be totally unacceptable alone, but is leveled out by a big hop finish. Great caramel malt taste upfront, with a sweet stick to you palate thickness.
This is obviously a very good beer. Dark apperance, rich taste, and good aftertaste.  Kinda heavy and sweet but still good.  Very full taste, would be a good after dinner beer with dessert.
One of my favorite beers.  Dark pour with decent head, an almost caramelish flavor.  Recommended to anyone, but you probably wont like it.

I guess I am indeed not worthy. It was solid, but not a top beer in my mind. Real dark orange with a off-white head with great lacing. Aroma was of sweet grassy hops. This one has a good hop character complimented by a caramel malt. The caramel taste is noticable right away, and then fades to a floral/grassy hop finish.
Finally got to try this.  A very good beer with an intenseful flavor.  Pours a really nice dark appearance.  So glad that I finally got to drink this beer after wanting to for a long time.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2006 Arrogant bastard, not for the weak. Huge hop with competing huge rich malt flavor with some grapefruit peaking through and a slight alcohol taste coming in. Maybe a little pine-y type hint underneath. 
Thicker than most bears, it is a concoction that puts most beers to shame and seperates the worthy beer drinkers from the yuppies with their fizzy yellow beer.
Beautiful dark appearance with a ruby red shine through it and a kick ass bottle top it off as one of the best accessible beers around. It is the measuring stick by which I judge all other beers by.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2005 A strong beer with a lot of flavor in there. I find it is best served just slightly chilled and appreciated slowly. Lots of hops in there, but they are balanced well with a creamy, almost syrupy sweetness and noticable malt. Delicious!

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2005 Very Tasty.  This beer pours with a lite brown and frothy head.  Very clear with a dark cherry wood coloring.  The aroma was not as strong as I expected but you could get mild hints of hops and malt in a nice combination.  I found the initial flavor to be sweet with nice chocolate, caramel/molasses, and cedar wood malt flavors.  The sweetness, however, is replaced quickly by a strong pine resin flavor that continues to grow and lasts long after beer meets belly.  An interesting mix of flavors and an enjoyable beverage!
Had a bottle that Ive been aging for about 2-years last night and I was a bit dissappointed.  It was drinkable but too oxidized for my taste.  Cardboard was a bit too obvious for me.  I think I prefer my Arrogance somewhat fresher.

Damn this beer is an asskicker!  I love it, my favorite beer, my favorite style.  Extremely hoppy and robust i havent tried the double bastard yet but it should be twice as delicious.  Not a beer for chugging but it is good to sit in front of an open fire or play a good game of billiards with and noe doubt you will be a saucy  suave Arrogant Bastard by the end of the night.

Another of the great Stone Ales. This one is intensely flavored but still fairly smooth. My first impression was that this must be the syrup that they make the other beers from. However in both bars where I imbibe, this one has started slowly but risen to be the number two seller after Stone IPA...even stomping Guiness into submission.

"Youre Not Worthy" - I most certainly am not.  Damn, this one deserves a special rant.  As I glare at Satan on the bottle, I cannot help but smile.  The title in itself is excellent, it encapsulates my entire personality in two words.  So theres a special connection right there.  Extremely strong and bitter but with such elegance / grace.  As I drink beneath the bottleneck, I cannot help but notice the complexity.  Upbeat hoppy and sweet flavors initially dominate, with dark chocolate overtones bombarding the palate afterwards.  Haha, through the halfway point, I turn the bottle around and read the back, and it provides an ignorant comment to the non-sophisticated beer drinkers of the world.  Good stuff.  It honestly gets better as you get to the bottom.  More hard and more dark, but never lets the alcohol intrude upon the rich flavoring.  An excellent beer, throughly enjoyed, one that will be definitely sought after in the near future.

Pours deep mahogany with light tan head.  Nose is of fresh cirtus, hops and a hint of malt.  Flavors are creamy, slightly toffeish but with a mild string of alcohol notes.  A marvelous beer.  AS it warms to room temperature, the flavors become more pronounced.  Nice finish.

Pine, coffe and nutty roast, citrus.
Red brown, creamy head.
Powerfull earthy and pinehop flavors.
Medium body, peppery aftertaste.
Well done.  Liked the rich malty aroma.  Definitely not a session beer for me.

Bottle.  Mahogany brown with reddish hues.  Medium head with a light tan color.  Aroma of hop oils.  Taste is more of the same, much more but with the perfect amount of malt to offset the intense hops  Long, delicious hops aftertaste for about a week.

Nice murky appearance with a nice head. Aroma was very nutty. The first sip was somewhat decieving. I  tasted nothing but hops and was quite dissappointed. Then once I had a few sips I could taste the biter nutty flavors that are in this beer. Was pleased all the way around.

Im just guessing on the aroma...cant smell today.  Wont come up with any details like you see in wine magazines...like tasting 18 different flavors.

Its just a damn good drink.

RateBeer? I dont get it. Shouldnt it be called RateAle. Does Stone Brew make beer now. That would be an absolute travisty. Anyhow... I was looking at how some of the "wussies" describe ABA... like its some kind of cheap wine. Check it out. Ive been drinking ABA since 1998. There is nothing "fruity" or "sweet" about it. It taste like it was filtered through an old sock and I wouldnt have it any other way. ABA [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ ROCKS! There is no way to really describe it. You must try it or you wont have a clue. I must say... if you dont like it its only because your wussy tastebuds cant handle it. Go grab a bottle of "light" beer and cleanse your pallet you wuss! Youre not worthy!

No one advertises better or more smartly, than Stone.  Lucky for them, their products are that good!  This is a terrific IPA that deserves to be called ARROGANT.  Citrusy, perfectly balanced, hoppy, delicious.  Hard to explain the taste and mouthfeel, because they seem to change from second to second.  Go get some!

Draft, Falling Rock Tap House.  Dark ruby coloured beer with a thin meniscal layer of tan bubbles over the surface. Lovely caramel, cookie dough, and vanilla malty flavor backs up an assertive grapefruit-citrus hop aroma. Flavour is fantastic, sweet toffee and caramel malts on the front fading to a strong alcoholic warming character before the citrusy and earthy herbal hops flavours make an appearance. These fade out leaving an awesome bitter kick in the teeth. As this beer warmed, you got even more citrus hop character and some spicy and fruity maltiness on the nose. Truly a first rate beer.  My wife ordered it again, and again, and again.....

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2006 Dark copper with a medium size off white head. Aroma of hops, citrus and
malt. Very hoppy flavor with just enough  malt sweetness to almost balance this beer out. Very enjoyable.

Thanks for the putdowns on the bottle. I like the sarcasm and in-your-face "are you down with craft beer, or are you pussy?"--attitude. 
Take a sniff...Spruce resin, orange flowers, malty malt, WOW! This is like taking a hit from a 6 foot bong! Its an aromatic orangatuan climbing up my nose, and playing my ole-factory like a jungle gym. The dryness outta shrink my head fast enough to make a headhunter cry with joy as he decorates his tent post with my shriveled, devil-puckered up mug. Astringent but not aseptic; this big beer has plenty of expression. In a Barry White voice this beer says to my taste buds, "Hello taste babies, Im gonna make love to you." The taste babes are passing out all over my mouth. What a hit! Theres a little smoky, and a lot of sweet malt. A citric rind-like burn on the top of my mouth. This brew is so warm, feels stronger then it says. Man its taut in the mouth like a live wire with all those hops. Theres enough malt to fill your mouth though. Dont be worried about being bored with this munster. The beautiful thick, velvety, steamed milk froth is clinging all over the glass like sex juices after intercourse. What happened in that mug?  I suggest:
Sip and chug your way through 2/3 of a bomber, then kick back and let it warm up. As it warms up you should find yourself contemplating all the naughty things you want to do to satisfy your lover. Sip the last third of this brew saying those things with your eyes. This is a McNasty beer that will have its way with you, and you should share that feeling.

Smells like heavily roasted malts- with a long lasting coffee colored head.  Burnt amber color throughout.  The roasted flavors taste like an uppercut- and a good one at that. Lots of flavor and one to enjoy over and over.
Very rich and distinct flavor.  Beautiful in the glass with a nice, but not overbearing head.  Difficult to compare with anything else, this brew stands on its own.  I look forward to my next glass!

Pours a rich redish brown color and makes a thick offwhite head. Head retention is great and laces the glass nicely all the way down. Smell is rich and inviting. Heavily roasted and malty aromatics fill my nose. Flavor opens up bitter and spicy, and then the rich and roasted character appears again with a nice layering of hop flavor and finishes with a malty sweetness. This beer is so unique, the flavor profile is really unlike any other beer I have ever tried. Mouthfeel is medium to full and leaves a slight sticky coating on the throat, warming as it goes down. Arrogant Bastard is incredibly tasty, drinkable and in my opinion a nice session beer... cause frankly you cant drink much else after the havok this wreaks on your pallate.

I finally experienced this on draft last Friday (thank you, Tuskies)!   Both versions reek of hops and malt (the way a good beer should) and hold their heads well, the bottled version more so.  Both have a clear, antique gold color.  The draft version allows one to better appreciate the complex malt recipe, including a sour mash flavor (the old Guinness trick).  Both have deep, well extracted hop flavor, the draft version has less aromatic flavor, again favoring its palate.  I give the draft version even higher marks than the bottle, and bottled Bastard is on my short list!  Three cheers to Stone Brewing!

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2005 Pours burgundy in color. Looks like a beautiful sunset when help up to the light. Long lasting white head with a sticky lace that clings to the glass. Exceptional looking beer.

The nose was full of prunes, vanilla, alcohol, floral hops, citrus fruits and a malt undertone.

Sharp hops at first followed by flavors of prunes, apricots, caramel and light toffee. Hops are dominant but the malt presense is very high too and balances well. Hops still take over this beer and make it very bitter. Excellent mouthfeel as well. 

All around an exceptional beer!

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2005 Listen up, you filthy maggots!  I will teach you the ways of beer-loving whether you goddamned pussies like it or not!  Because inside every fizzy yellow macro-swiller is a beer-lover trying to get out.  You, whats your name?  Bullshit!  From now on, your name is Yellowbelly.  You like that name?  Good, cause from now on, youre gonna be down lickin up the floor of my head until you learn to love good beer, you miserable little piece of shit!  You, wipe that smile off your face!  And you, wipe that fizzy commie yellow-deer-drinking bitter-beer grimace off yours!  You make me sick!  You make me want to vomit, right in your fizzy yellow beer, just so you have something of flavor in your drink!  You little worm!  You bottom-fermenting ass-eating scumbag!  Ill kick your ass!  Ill shit in your beer just to give it color and aroma!  Now drop and give me 25!  You, whats your favorite beer?  Guinness, eh?  Really sophisticated, huh?  I admire your honesty.  Hell, I like you.  You can come over to my house and fuck my sister. *WHACK!*  Now get back up on your feet!  Why did you join my beloved corps?  So youre a drinker, eh?  Lets see your beer face!  Bullshit, you didnt convince me!  AAAAGGHHHH, thats a beer face!  Work on it!  And you, whatre you looking at you ugly fuck!  Youre a yellow-beer-drinking wussy too, huh?  I dont think I heard you correctly!  I think I just heard the level of class in this entire platoon drop by 200 points!  I bet you drink beer like old people fuck!  Here, have a splash of some real beer in your eyes!  Here, gag on this!  You happy now?  You like my bottle?  Do you think its cute, do you think its funny?  Bullshit!  Ill kick your ass so far up between your shoulder blades, youll have to stand on your head to take a dump!  What, you dont like your head in a toilet boil?  Then get your face out of that macro bottle, swillboy!  Do you suck dicks?  Are you a peter-puffer?  Thats most unfortunate, because youd sure as hell get better mouthfeel and flavor with that than with the pisswater you imbibe!  You like real beer?  I cant hear you!  Bullshit, I still cant hear you!  Sound off like youve got a pair!  Okay, then.  Goodnight ladies, and repeat after me: This is my bottle.  There are many like it, but this one is mine...

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2004 (Draft) The first time I tried this beer I enjoyed it so much that 3 days later I drove 3hrs to get it again. The heady aroma of hops is the first sign that they have done something right. A malty backbone for some ballance and a nice finish with some lingering bitterness to make you thirsty for more.

Smells of American hops and caramel with a slight milk aroma. Clear red color with a beige head that I wish all ales had. Beautiful lacing. Big tangy and bitter flavor. Somewhat malty with hints of smoke. Finishes a little tart. To me the taste is murky with no dominant feature but not quite balanced either. It has what I would describe as a "homebrew" flavor. Good but over rated. Their reverse marketing get a more fanatical following than direct.

Dark amber colored beer with a foamy light tan head. Hops and caramel in the aroma. Sweet and fruity and a typical Stone aroma! Very nice and inviting! Flavor is dominated by bitter hops on a sweet malty and caramelly base. Very flavorfull and complex with a perfect balanced bitterness. Dry in the end! Excellent!

Deep reddish brown.  Big aroma of dark fruit and citrus hops.  Flavor is much bigger than the aroma.  It is thick and malty.  Starts with some sweetness then goes to hops and then some hops.  You then get some spice and then something umm yes hops.  Go west coast. Long finish.  I have drank this beer numerous times but I keep forgeting to drink it out of thr 22oz AB glass.  I guess Ill have to open another.

Bottled 5-7-04.Well here it is..Aroma,chocolate vibin centenialish hoppage,touch of the finest grain.Nice red amber color,nice off white head.The taste is very good if you love hops(and damn good beer) of the west coast variety(which I do).The palate could be a little bit more full,but the hops are resiny and lingering(I like that)tease of honey and tea in there.A very nice beer,just a tad overhyped,but I also agree with the current average.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2006 Bottle:  Aroma is very malty.  Berries, chocolate, and caramel.    Pours a mostly transparent but slightly hazy reddish-brown with a small off-white head. Not much lacing.   Flavor is berries , caramel, and  chocolate.  Real bitter finish with coffee notes.  Overly long bitter aftertaste is a bit much.  This beer is good, but I had such high expectations that I am a little let down.
<pP
Had this a second time and must say it is much better than the first time and Im improving my original score of 3.4.  Everything is pretty  much the same except the hops arent over the top nor is the aftertaste.

Had this on tap and not all like my previous ratings, which leads me to wonder if I had any idea what I was talking about.  Nice fruity sweetness up front with hints of peach and apricot.  Light caramel as weel.  Huge grapefruit hop finish.  Seems to have a better balance on tap.
On tap.  Very powerful. The Arrogant Bastard is one tough mother to deal with, but is so worth it in the end.  I cant wait to take on its big brother, Double Bastard
This is a BIG beer!  It aint no slamin beer either.  In a nice glass, out on the deck, with some time to enjoy it, it is GREAT!
This one gets up and grabs you right out of the bottle. A very strong ale the way I like them. First the malt grabs you, then the malt. A sweet taste with carmel tang and a hoppy finish. Enjoy!

Hmm ... Im a little stuck at how to describe this srtong ale.  A very heavy dark thick body with the tones of the alcohol quite apparent, complex array of flavorings ranging from cramel, coffee to peat, starts with traces of malty sweetness and finishes big and bitter.  Very interesting - definitely for slow sipping.  Proceed with caution.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2004 22 oz. bottle.  Ruby amber in color with a medium off-white nose.  Really a beautiful color....you can barely see through it.  Strong aroma of sweet malts, hops, and fruit...perhaps cranberries?  Well-balanced between the malts and the hops.  Definitely tastes spicy, sort of like a winter brew, with strong notes of coffee.  Heavy mouthfeel.  Very bitter, but a little sweet too.  Definitely a very complex ale, and one I will try again.  Stone never fails to impress me.

Amber Coloring. No Head.  Like the Ruination, Starts off Very Hopy on The Nose and Palate.  Some Spice in This one As Well.  More in The Glass Then I was Able to Pull Out.  Would Be Worth Trying Again.  But Very Good Overall!
Interesting tasting beer.  Hoppy.  Sour taste.  Not as good as I hoped it would be.  Bla, after a while, the aftertaste gets really bad and annoying!  I can't even drink it all.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2008 Original Rating, September 13, 2004:  (Thank you SDbruboy for getting me the Cali brews!)  Pours a dark amber or brown color with a medium head.  Very hoppy and spicy aroma.  The taste has a lot going on: malt, hops, fruit, alcohol, maybe a touch of leather.  Weird.  I need to snag myself another bottle of this.  It was good, but I need another sample.  7/4/8/3/16  Re-rating, August 18, 2008:  Deep , dark red color with a medium head.  Extremely piney aroma.  Strong pine bitterness in the taste.  Caramel malts and a little roast.  Alcohol is hidden.  Still good, but definitely not as awe-inspiring as when I was first trying good beers.
THIS BEER IS EXCEPTIONALLY GOOD!  IM NOT SURE I CAN DESCRIBE IT, BUT I REALLY, REALLY LIKE IT.  IT IS A VERY BOLD FLAVORED BEER THAT IS A PLEASURE TO CONSUME!  THIS BEER IS AS GOOD AS THEY GET!

This beer pours deep dark brown; held up to the light it presents itself as dark, opaque amber. Develops a rich, bubbly head that swirls as if it were the portal to whatever hell the label character has come from. The head itself is a yeasty bread colored cloud of bubbles that lasts acceptably long and leaves a lot of intricate lacing behind. Aroma is sweet and malty with hints of yeast, alcohol, sweet fruits, hops, maple, and cherries. Port like characteristics and notes of apricot brandy fill the nose of this fragrant ale. Just before tasting I noticed a spiral of yeasty foam in the center of the glass; it looks like our galaxy, or maybe a hurricane. Whatever else it may look like one thing is for sure, it looks inviting! Flavor? Okay, this is a bitter beer; the aroma is deceptive because the smell and taste of this beer are two very different things. While sweet malt dominates the aroma hops and alcohol dominate the palate. Flavors of grapefruit, vodka, pepper, tobacco, and HOPS!!!, stand out in violent opposition to the sweet aroma. It only takes a moment to get used to the bitterness at which time you realize how perfectly the aroma and flavor compliment one another. The alcohol hits you with a giant sucker punch about 1/2 way through the glass and then all is truly good. As the beer warms the flavor profile changes and more subtle malt flavors begin to emerge. This is cigar beer 100%. Some piano jazz, a fine maduro cigar, a box of dark chocolates, and a few bottles of Arrogant Bastard sounds like the perfect evening to me. Overall, after drinking this beer I am left with an intense urge to try a bottle of Double Bastard very, very soon. This beer is, in one word, outstanding!

My parents snagged this for me at premier gourmet. This was a great beer. Poured a somewhat hazy reddish brown colour with almost no head.  The aroma is mostly white grapefruit while the taste is more balanced. Great citrus hop flavours with a decent malt backbone. Any bets on the LCBO importing this?:)

Pours medium brown or copper, cloudy with a decent head.  Aroma is fairly strong and somewhat hoppy, though not truly distinguishable.  Initial taste is somewhat bitter with definite hop flavor, but still maintains a good balance with malt.  Body is fairly full with good carbonation.  For the more refined beer drinker, this tastes like it could be a good regular anytime beer.  Overall, the taste is somewhat similar to Stones IPA, though not as "clean".  Also, it wasnt as "aggressive" as the hype prepared me for.  Perhaps Im already becoming desensitized...

Dark coppery brew has the cloudy appearance that i love.Deep aroma of fruit and some hops.Almost a caramel apple aroma,found myself wanting to take a bite.Flavor is big and rich.Full in body with a blend of dried dates and caramel.Alcohol isnt even present.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2005 This is one of the first beers that I tried when I turned 21. A truly excellent beer. Pours out dark and with a healthy head, depending on your pour style. Has definite hints of citrus, coffee, alcohol, and a whole bunch of other delicious things. It packs a nice punch that a lot of other beers just lack. The overall flavor is bitter and slightly sour with a very refreshing sweet aftertaste. The marketing on this beer is as aggressive as its flavor. A great beer.

Drinking this to fast has proved to make my stomach turn so i suggest you relax and sip on this.  Not in the sense of its alcohol content just the contents that make up its body.  Flavor consists of orange, honey and notes of raisens and is hard to detect much more for me. The whole bottle label and versus match this brew well making it even more stronger of a American atrong ale

Dark amber-brown in colour topped by a thick, light brown head. A good 
amount of lace was left behind from the top to the bottom of the glass. This 
is an aggressively hopped ale with a sharp bitter hop taste, balanced by a 
sweet and fruity malt flavor. Malty, bitter and peppery this is an 
aggressive in your face beer.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2004 Dark crimson coloration, thick'n'rich'n'cloudy, under a perfunctory whitish head.
Aroma: a big hit of juicy fruit, deep, dark ones, grapes and berries and cherries and more, a rich elixir..definitely got the barleywine thing going on, zesty, spicy, loaded with flavor...'bout time I taste, eh?
Big, chewy, grabbiness on the palate, full and thick, powerful, and omnipresent, digs in and in, climbs and clambers about the senses, not trying to dominate, but doing it anyway, through virtue of the fullness of flavor...zing, zing, zing, again, I sing, this is deliciousness pressed into service and doing double-time, brothers,...Lordy, it's loveliness, indeed, thick and full on the palate, wow, rich and tasty, sets the senses a'spin, leaves the soul reeling...mine is, I luxuriate in the pleasures of this brew, and they are aplenty!
I'm drooling of the day I can visit San Diego and try it fresh on-tap, maybe other versions, the Oak-Aged, as well?
As it is, this is a supreme brew, a just king, who wisely judges the imbibers from his throne...if thou art not worthy, tarry not 'round these vessels, seek a softer, sadder brew for you..let only those who can claim worthiness hoist a chalice of this finest ale!
Got to be one of America's best barleywines, bar none!!!
I could rant on some more, for the bottle is not yet finished, but let it be known, that this ale has powers over me, bewitches and bewilders, and all in the best sense, for I leave the normal earthly realm to visit sublimer planes, all courtesy of this San Diego-bourne bottle!
Good Lordy-Lou!
I am sent, in the most sensational way, lifted, aloft, delivered, dropped beyond the heavens into a metaphysical stratosphere beyond human reckoning...
Yes, I proclaim it "good"....and will merely melt and luxuriate at the rest of the consumption of this rare delicacy...I envy you Cali types who can snort this back with the ease of an ordinary day....

Rating no# 100. Pours a dark brown with a thick tan head. Aromas of hops (pine, grapefruit) dominate with some malt in background. Yep its aggressive alright, massive piney, grapefruit hops and plenty of malts, caramel as well, thick mouthfeel. The alcohol is well hidden, great lacing. Nice beer!

By far the most Complex and interesting beer I have ever come across.  I had Drank the Ruination right before this one so my tongue was still a little puckered.  I will have to drink another next week and gave a more suited review

Nice crisp, clean citrusy aroma, mainly grapefruit, with some hops.  Pours deep brown with a  fluffy beige head that left good lacing.  Strong hoppy flavor with definite grapefruit flavor.  Very citrusy with subtle, almost non-existent, sweetness.  Good palate but the grapefruit is very prominent with bitter finish.   Seems better than it did 6 years ago.

Complex brew...definite burnt malt/caramel flavor with a hoppy/citrus finish. Kind of a war of the taste buds, between the malt and hops. Unfortunately my only chance to try this beer was at a temperature slightly colder than 70 degrees or so. Im going to re-rate this one once I get a nice cold sample.

Pours a dark muddy copper color, with a decent tan head. Spotty lacing.
Citrus and pine dominate the aroma, with some raisin hiding in the back.
Flavor starts off malty sweet with a grapefruity finish.
Appealing citrus aroma.  Awesome complex taste, cant identify much except for a slight pineapple/grapefruit flavor and a bit of alcohol (masked well).
Pours dark copper with a respectable head. Aroma is dominated by hops which kick you in the ass when you have a taste. A nice sweetness somewhat balances. Great beer.

Strong burnt caramel with plenty of pine/orange hoppiness in the nose. Finger of large-bubbled but lasting tan head recedes with rings of lace atop dark copper-amber body. Aggressive bitterness with underlying thick, sweet malt base, though the resinous hops definitely have the spotlight. Lasting bitterness on the tongue and in the back of the throat. Medium-full body and chewy mouthfeel. It just gets better and better with each sip as the hops build on your palate. Bottle. Thanks, Dorwart!
A nice dark reddish colored beer with a rather small head. It has a nice balanced, yet complex taste that isnt overwhelming. A very nice beer that is a lot different than much of the stuff out there

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2004 Aug 24-04: Redemption! Similar body, appearance etc. Malt is far more present than previously, and bitterness is more pleasant and less astringent. Very nicely balanced yet still aggressively hopped, a substantial chewy enjoyable beer. Touch of alcohol and grapefruit in the back end.

Aug 16/04: Dark red brown body with a moderate tan head. Resiny hops in the aroma, hint of caramel and alcohol poiking through. Flavour is fairly bitter with what lots of a quality I attributed to humulin but I am not sure. Not as hoppy and bitter as I expected. Heavy aftertaste seems a bit off at first but is less noticable after a few belts. Nice mouthfeel, a bit thicker than average. This is a bit of an adjustment. I had high hopes for this one and while good it was a bit of a disappointment. I have a second bottle so we shall see how it compares. Thanks to Callie for the pick up in California, and to the Ratebeerian who brought one to Dougs place. 7/3/6/4/15
Another great brew from Stone, smooth but also bitter. Poured a brownish body, with a light head, and a hoppy aroma. Litely sweet beer but not too much, a very nice ale.
well the above description is correct about the quality and agressiventss, but i did enjoy it.  at times thick and mollasses tasting.  well hopped, some apple.  a great beer

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2004 finally found this son of a bitch in Illinois. It was crazy good, though not exactly what I expected. The hops are uber, but you dont realize it until you try to drink something else afterwards. Beautiful blood red color with a brown head. quite sweet and fruity with a matching hop profile. Lighter in taste than expected, smelled/tasted of apples and some syrups. Very good.

Draft at Flour City Brewfest.  Wow, I was blown away by this beer.  I could not describe all the flavors in this complex beer.  It has alot to offer with a suprisingly smooth finnish.  I went back for more samples of this brew.

Bottle: Poured a deep opaque brown colored beer with a medium head with standard retention. Aroma is very powerful and consist mostly of what I think to be hops, a sweet and bitter type of hops though. Taste is quite unique for me (I think this is my first foray into the strong American Ale type) and consist mostly of some strong bitter hops and underline by some very subtle sweetness. Wow, this is like being hit on the head with a brick  plainly lots of malt and hops are included in here. The alcohol is a subtle but complement very well.
UPDATED: OCT 5, 2006 Very dark reddish color. Very hoppy and bold. Lots of flavor from start to finish. You can never go wrong with a bomber of AB.

Poured reddish brown with a nice off white head...smells sweet alcohol with lemony hint...tastes very rich and complex...very sweet at first then turning bitter and sour...definately a good one to have once a year...
One of the best beers ive ever had. The marketing accentuates the taste and fullness of this beer. Shell out the bucks and taste it for yourself.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2004 (Draft: O'Brien's in San Diego, CA) On tap, this beer tastes and smells surprising floral and sugary, but in this tasting session, it is being compared to pints of an oak aged version of Arrogant Bastard and Double Bastard; However, the strong hops bitterness and bite is still prevelent, even after sipping some Double Bastard; The mouthfeel also seems a little thin; Off-white head has average retention; For comparison's sake, some notes from previous bottles: Medium to full bodied, malty and very aggressively hopped, moreso than a typical IPAs; The malt is fairly sweet, and quite strong in flavor; Dark and brownish amber in color; Somewhat cloudy from fine sediment suspended in the beer
A very great tasting beer.  Strong alcohol content yet is covered up beautifully.  Finally got my hands on one of these at Isaac Newtons in newtown.
Beautiful reddish/brown color. Pretty aggressive end and quite bitter. Dry and malty flavor. I truely love the philosophy about this beer.
Had this on tap, it was great, very tasty, darkish hue...smoothe w/a great bitter finish.
Red-brown with nice head and lace. Malty-caramel and hops in abundance. Dried fruits (raisins) and vegetables. Finish is bitter, grapefruit and strong tea - it lasts for hours.

Appearence: Beautiful dark red, pours a larger off white head. Aroma is sweet and a slight scent of alcohol comes through. a little citrus present also. 
 Flavor is dominated by alcohol and hops. A slight malted taste comes through towards the end.  Overall a very strong flavorful ale, not for the weak of stomach. 

 Many thanks go out to Indiana_Red for my first Stone brew!

22OzBottle Pours a dark coper brown with a nice hefty off white head and dence lacing.  Aroma is malty, carmel and plenty of hops. A dark roast taste and a unique flavor I cant place. Spicy, slightly sweet.  The alcohol comes through pretty strong..and this just in....quite hoppy.  A strong lingering hops bitter at the end.  Feel is nice and heavy/thick with a slight sense of sediment or chalky imed after swallowing. A complex, strong, ale.

Best name and persona in the biz.  I had this on tap at the GingerMan in NYC.  A hearty pint hit the spot.  Hops were the first thing that I noticed, but over time I noticed much more.  I will have to rerate when I try a bottle as I cannot describe this properly right now.

Nice clear brownish ruby color. Small off-white fzzy/soapy head. Aroma has alcohol, and some caramel cherries. Taste seems sweet with some bitter orange, wood, and other fruit. Nice mouthfeel; sweet oily stickiness. Pretty good overall, although nothing really dominated the aroma or flavor. Ive sat on this a while, and would like to try a fresher bottle at some point.

Been sitting on this one for a while. Finally time to pop the cork and tell the world what I think.  Dark Ruby colored liquor.  Cherries and hops make a unique flavor.  I like this much better than vertical epic040404. Again, hoppy, potent elixir that gets your attention.  Stone you make great beers. Cant wait to try the Double Bastard.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2007 Deep ruby-brown beer with a thick off-white head.  Aroma is lovely, biscuity malt, caramel and toffee with a sweet grapefruty citrus malt.  Bitterness is much more restrained than the last time I had it.  Sticky with a soft resinousness on the back.  Palate is good, but the sweet malty aroma doesnt really come through on the flavour very much.  Not as good as it used to be, but still excellent.

Dark ruby coloured beer with a thin skin of tan bubbles over the surface.  Lovely caramel, cookie dough, and vanilla maltiness backing up an assertive citrusy hop aroma.  Flavour is fantastic, sweet toffee and caramel malts on the front fading to a hint of coffee/chocolate character before the citrusy and earthy herbal hops flavours make an appearance.  These fade out leaving an awesome bitter kick in the teeth.  As this beer warmed, you got even more citrus hop character and some spicy and fruity maltiness on the nose.  Truly a first rate beer.
8 4 9 4 18

Rich mahogany hue with a nice creamy light brown head.  Ive met some arrogant bastards in my time but they dont smell this good!  A fantastic citrussy hopped nose with a healthy dolop of spice.  This theme follows through to the taste which is equally fabulous.  A malty toffeeish caramel flavour with a sublime floral hoppy backbone and a long finish.  A magnificently well balanced beer.  Wow what a great beer!  Normally these beers that have novelty names are bland, but this just isnt.  It is a great beer in a fantastically humourous and ironic bottle.  It certainly has a right to be arrogant about its own brilliance.
Not as powerfull as its bigger brother the Double Arrogant Bastard, but still a great drinking brew in its own rite for when I cant get my hands on the Double.

Thanks to my friend, Peter, who brought this to me this weekend. Man, a Clubber Lang right hook of a beer. Great balance of malt and hop with plenty of fire behind both. I am convinced if this was local and offered cask...I would be in serious trouble. Fantastic beer with a cigar on my deck reading Tolstoy....yeah.
Good beer says my girlfriend and I must agree!  Beautiful dark color with a big tan head.  Very tasty.  I must get more.

Most drinkable incredibly good beer for most other artisian crafts to be measured by.
I would love to try this on tap.
Crisp palate and very well balanced flavor. One of my favorites.

Its amazing to me how many times Ive had this without giving it a proper rating...

At over 600 ratings, theres really not much I can add, but I will highlight: Awesome head and very nice lace. Fantastic taste that is very well balanced and hides the alcohol content. This beer is a standard against which others should be judged: Not the best beer in the world, but a damn good bell-weather.
Sweet with hops and malt. I thought the taste would be confusing but all of the flavors have the same weighting. Great beer.

Tasted in NYC.  Tasted at brewtopia 04.  Aroma is of bitter hops with a slight hint of sweetness. Floral.  Appearance is a deep copper colour with a small tan head. Laces well in the glass. Taste is a blend of malty backbone with a big arrogant bastard bitter finish.

Great beer.  Incredible aroma and appearance, looks like it should: dark and menacing.  The flavor is heavy on the malts but enough hops (duh, its stone) to balance.  Its a bit heavy on the tongue, but thats understandable I suppose.  This is a strong ale I could drink all night.

Now thats what I am talking about -- tastes like they took SNPA, Dogfish 90 Minute IPA, and hyped them up on roids.  BIG flavor.  Had at Steamers Bar in Ketchikan, Alaska on draft.  Nice red/brown color with tan head.  Explosive hop flavor with pine overtones.  Head stays with your till the bottom and trails its way beautifully down the glass.  Aftertaste is a little much in the bitterness dept, but its worth the price.  WOW!
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: Nice reddish-brown color with a bountiful head.  Pleasant citrus, pine hoppy aroma.  Taste is fairly smooth ,flavorfull.  Malts are understated which bring out the true hop character until the end. The aftertaste can be a little bitter and lingering but still a great beer. Havent had Buffalo Butt but I would think this is better.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2004 Rerate 09-17-04. still from a bottle. the hidden power of the bastard is apparent to me, i can now appreciate the overwhelming flavor of sweet rich caramel from the malts and the tangy hop attack on the finish. i only discovered this by accident when i had another taste at my fantasy football draft. this is so much better when it has a chance to breath and warm, that said it still ain't my favorite
Original rating 6-26-04 original rating 2.4.Bottle. nice pour. mahogany color with a tan head that laces down the glass. aroma is interesting with a cinnamon smell. I had previously tried this a few years back, and i did not like it. i am pleased that it tastes better than i remebered, but it still has a flavor that i dont enjoy. i like the malt flavor, but the hops in this do not agree with me. leaves an unpleasant taste. i guess this is too strong for me. Im not worthy.

Finally time to rate the one and only.  Deep ruby reddish brown ale, off white head.  Nose is full of citrus, light pine, florals, and some sweet buttery caramel to boot. Hoppy is an understatement, but really it comes through with a nice sweet malty balance.  Medium to full-bodied,  medium carbonation, lengthy bitter dry finish.  In my book, Stone does no wrong....ever!

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2008 I appreciate good beer.  Ive had over 500 different kinds since I became a SERIOUS beer drinker.  However, this concoction is just a bit too over the top for me.  The label warns of its "aggressiveness," and touts that anyone who is not a REAL beer drinker "probably wont like it," thereby, subliminally at least, making everyone like it for fear of being called a wimp.  Well, I  can tell you with certainty that I am no wimp, and I have had much better beer than this.  The taste is not what bothers me; rather, its the pungent aftertaste that reminds me of Robitussin that appalls me.   I had to eat an apple while drinking this thing to keep from vomiting (and remember, I have had Buffalo Butt), so that should tell you something.  (And after paying almost 5 bucks for a pint and a half, youre damn straight I was finishing it.)  So, go on and tout your love of this potion; I will go on enjoying my more mellow blends that have less to prove in terms of how "manly" they are.   Rotten vegetables, and putrid fruit dominate the flavor.   Thats all.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Definately worth the wait for this. A nice deep red/ dark amber appearance with a good tan head. Strong hops, spicy aroma, good malts too. Over the top hop, malty flavor. A little bit of caramel too. SICK beer.

Very unique strong ale.  A classic for real beer drinkers.  Pours a dark redish brown.  Punishing hoppy and spicy nose wish creamy head.  Has a strong malty taste, very rich and up a notch by a also strong hop presence.  It finishes with a great spicy bitterness which kicks this beer onto a whole new level. Good stuff

Bottle.  Well, first off, the bottle was pretty damn funny.  But once you get passed it, youre left with a pretty solid beer.  Citrus hop aroma from a ruby red body.  Strong alcohol taste, but thin enough for the hops to get through and bite you, while giving a smooth malt taste.  A unique balancing act for sure, but I thought it tasted stronger than the 7.2%, which distracted me a bit.  A fine beer though.
Great mixture of malt and hops.  Quite possibly the best American Strong Ale Ive had.  Really looking forward to experiencing more Stone products.
No doubt, this is a big beer.  Do they use H3O in this, too. This is not a brew for the timid, but dont be scared.  How do they do it, balance such huge flavors? Its the yin and the yang of beer.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2010 This is one badass beer. The flavor explodes in your mouth.  A very nice balance of sweet and bitter flavors.  Starts off with a malty, slightly citrusy flavor, finished with a silghtly bitter hoppy aftertaste.  They hide the alcohol content well!  Excellent!

Someone got me an Arrogant Bastard Ale shirt, so I had to try the beer.  I had it mailed to me in Kansas (shhh!), and had a six pack with my father-in-law.  I was very pleasantly surprised with how flavorful this was.  Very good!

Excellent brew on tap at the Ginger Man in Dallas. Poured a very dark orange and brown with a tan head. Has a subtle orange peel and bread aroma. The taste is strong orange peel hops with a nice malty balance. Sweet and bitter finish. Lots of lacing. My first beer from Stone and I am impressed.
On tap. Poured a dark brown color with an averaged size head. Smells of molasses, piney, and some citris. Sweet and bitter tasting (nicely balanced).
Pretty nice hefty brew. Dark, strong appearance and flavor. Lasting malty flavor with equally lingering bitter hops taste to it. Overall well rounded beer.

This is by far my favorite beer. Medium/Dark pour, slight head, very hoppy aroma. The after taste while stong is yet strangly pleasant. Seems to have a touch of citurs....I am worthy, mouth watering typing this. Started on Stoned IPA got hooked on the ole Bastard....

Poured into a goblet; Dark amber color.  Light brown head that quickly dissapates in the middle forming a halo.  Large cells of lace that last.  Fruity aroma with some hop character.  Good taste.  Tastes like grapefruit and charcoal.  Coats the palate with a bitter and a bit sour aftertaste which I also like very much.  This is a good beer.  Reminds me of a lighter porter in some ways.

A deep amber brew with a tight, long lasting head. It has a strong, robust flavor followed by a bitter hop taste. The bitterness had a tinch of sourness to it. The label tells me that I probably wont like it.  I did like it, not much but a little. I had to clear my palate with some bland yellow beer.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2011 I have long been fond of this beer. Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle ( I love the bottle - must admit that I am a sucker for their attitude/ad campaign). It has not remained as high in my esteem as my tastes have developed but I still grab one now and then. +++Pours a cloudy brown color (same color as the bottle in fact). No light shines through. Small tan head. The aroma is of grapefruit and molasses. The flavor is sharp and bitter with a strong grapefruit presence. This beer really slaps you in the face with hop presence. Some sweet maltiness comes along as the beer warms up a bit, but overall this is a really unbalanced beer. The hops really overwhelm any other flavor present. The sweet grapefruit flavor sticks to the tongue and lingers forever on the aftertaste. I have had this frequently on draft as well, and found it to be much less sharp and a little better balanced when on draft.
Had this on drought. Well blended mix of sharp hops and smooth malts.  Seems think for an ale.
love the beer, thought it had a very good flavor,but i must say i love the bottle more
A good , solid beer, nice flavor, does have an aftertaste, but a nice one to me! A Savory beer

I never thought something from my hometown could be so good.  Very smooth, tastes similar to a Sam Adams with a nice bite.  Dark amber color.  Only flaw is the slightly harsh aftertaste.  Nevertheless, the beer of choice for feeling loose quick.
Well done! Great hops and malt experiment.  A strong ale that is not overly astringent.
A GOOD looking brew, nicely marketed. I found it with a big head and all the grapefruit tones you could want. It shows better as it warms.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2005 I think this beer is great!! as i drink it now,it has adark red amber color and a thick light brownish foamy head with thick lacing down the glass.
strong enough to know your drinking a real beer with just a bit of bite at swallow.
good good beer,will buy again!!

22oz bomber. 05.24.04  Deep mahoganey pour with minimal halo of a head.  Reeks of grapefruity hops, alcohol, citrus grove.  Its hoppy.  The taste is mostly hops, abusive, numbing hops.  Almost totally linear like chewing on the pith of an underripe grapefruit.  Maybe some raw, earthy, grassy barley at the finish.  Pithy, ridiculously astringent, dry.  Interesting, but not something Id trip my grandma for to get the last bottle on earth.
This beer is so impressive that it has a god named ABA in a Pantheon of Mantrip golf gods.  Lesser beer drinkers should go have a Bud Light with their tail between their legs.

It pours a dark ruby with little head.  Flavor is dominated by sweet caramel and butterscotch, with only a mild hops presence.  I was expecting a hop assault, but this was smooth and pretty drinkable.  Maybe Ive just been jaded by the many super-hopped beers out there.  Not really what I expected, but good nonetheless.

This was my first beer rating. Ive had a few beers in my day, but have been stuck with the normal, everyday bar beers. My friends have talked me into expanding my adventures. This was my first. Very impressed with their choice. This beer had a flowery aroma with a stong hops presence. Full bodied, and a very impressive start.
quality. nice rich malty caramel aroma.  deep amber color with thin head.  nice and malty, slightly dry, but very smooth finish.  great palate.  the hype is well placed.  this beer is pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2006 the bastard ale!the name says it all....thick,strong,and well,arrogant!
re-rate:nice hoppy aroma with a good malt backbone.i have not had this in a long time and im glad i picked one up.
GOURMET PIZZA???? BAH!! Arrogant Bastard goes best with... um... well... another Arrogant Bastard!!!!

Very faintly hazy orange brown under a small shortish lasting pale beige head. Big hoppy passionfruity malty burnt caramel sugar and estery tropical fruity aroma. Becomes even more aromatic hoppy as warms. Big smooth chewy butterscotch like body. Medium strong short malty sweet start. Softer lightly spiced dryer middle before back to strong smooth bitter hoppy finish. Went down very nicely with a quattro giusti gourmet pizza from the local pizzeria.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2006 This beer is very good.  Pours out dark brown with a slight beige head.  Flavor is intense and the name rings true.  very good brew.  I rated this thing a 2.0 about two years ago, but I was wrong.  This brew deserves much better.

Hazy medium amber brown with a lasting frothy medium light brown/straw head.  Very sweet aroma of grapefruit, pine, plum, toffee, apricot, and a hint of spice.  Medium thick syrupy body with soft carbonation.  Flavor of resinous pine, oak, toffee, grapefruit, apricot, orange peel and ginger.  Huge thanks to footbalm for this one, which he generously provided for free.  I owe him a few.  Excellent!

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2004 bottled from happy deli-Wow ths is one bitter bastard. Smells of citrius/grapefruit,rich red color.The frothy head sticks around for a while.Crisp clean goin down. very diffrent Very good , not for everyday conspution

clear red-amber colour with a fine creamy, slightly brown-tainted head, nice lacing, strong hop presence with aroma of cream, apricot and flowers, full-bodied with a very creamy mouthfeel, robust bitterness, the finish is dry, malty and very bitter, filling the mouth with tons of hops - very pleasant and not too extreme
this beer has excellent malting, with a nice bit of bitterness. Just excellent flavor. Starts off a bitter and and finishes smooth. One of the best ales Ive ever had. Nobody is worthy.

Jesus, it is a bastard! The bitter taste stays in your mouth forever! But all though it seems so hardcore, it is actually a good beer too! It is beautiful and has a nuanced taste of herbes (besides the huge amount of hops and malt!) A special beer, nice to try, but I wouldnt drink it more than a few times!

Nice dense light beige head which lasts for a while.  Very interesting aroma.  Very fruity hops with hints of sweet grapefruit.  I like it.  Color is a dark ruby brown.  Good $hit.  Flavor is excellent.  Perfectly balanced.  Good malt backbone with a generous helping of hops.  Citrus fruit present with a little bit of roasted grains.  Finish is pretty bitter but not too much.  More grapefruit and a nice alcohol warming.  A top quality beer and one that will find a permanent home in my fridge.  Bonus points for the great bottle and description.  Worth buying just for that.

Dark ruby-amber colour with a foamy white head. Aroma is remarkably hoppy - I was afraid to inhale too deeply lest the fumes burn out my nose hairs. The flavour is big and bitter, with some great coffee & chicory notes to balance the citric hop explosion. Long and lingering grapefruit finish. While it wasnt quite the life-changing experience Id been led to believe it might be, its still a damn fine beverage.
Very ppowerful beer! Great aroma, followed by a mulititude of flavors for the tounge. This beer ended with a wonderful bite. The bottles comments had me rolling on the floor.

Stone, you are my hero! Probably one of the best beers I have ever had, hands down. Body is dark amber, almost a red with about a half inch of foamy white head. Aroma is incredible. It almost made my eyes water. Hoppy to the max with some citrusy notes present as well. Taste is a well balanced hops/citrus/malt mixture that leaves an interesting sweet and sour bitter aftertaste. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. This stuff hits the nail right on the head. Aggressive indeed!

First, I gotta say, I love the comments on the bottle.  Great beer with great sarcasm!   Deep ruby red/orange brown coloring with strong hop aroma.  Some minor alcohol in the taste but very strong good rich grapefuit hops taste and some creaminess near the end.

Aggressively hoppy. Fruity, roasted malt aroma. Bitter hop, mild toasted carmel/malt flavor. Seems a little unbalanced. Warming and chewy. Overall, pretty decent. I just wanted a little more malt strength.
This really smells like bud to me, but i really like it. A magnificent deep red color, with a nice tan head. Dry, bitter, and oh yes, hoppy.

A deep red beer with a beutiful head. The aroma is sweet with notes of alcohol and berries. The flavor is very complex with notes of cowberries, grass and enourmous amounts of hops which makes the end extremely grassy and dry. A wonderful beer. Thanks to Mads Berg for sharing this bottle.

HOPS! HOPS!!!! HOPS!!!!! A very interesting beer. Did I say hoppy, yes.. it delivers as advertised a dark red/coppery pour with a small tan head.  And yes.. it tastes of hops. Not sure Id drink it again but definately worth tasting.
user_location: New York, east village, New York, USA

text: This is my favorite beer, after Stones IPA.  It is EXTREMELY Hop-y.  Very good aroma, very fruity.  In flagstaff they have the 10th Anniversity edition, which is even better, but sadly sold out.

Deep dark red with small persistent head and lacing. Lovely, lovely, precious aroma of fruit, berries and fresh, fresh hops.

Mentholy fresh flavour with nice soaring hops. Coffe, or very dark chocolate, on aftertaste.

yes!!! ... this is me in a bottle! wild berries and alot of hops in the arome. Taste is very hoppy with a nice tingering malty bitter hoppy finish!!  this is THE stuff! thank you Stone, if I lived in Cali then my fridge would be full of this... Iceland sucks!!
As stated, very aggressive. Highly hopped, but also quite malty. Darker than expected with a somewhat clingy and plummy sweetness. Sort of splits the difference between IPA and IIPA.

On tap at the Yard House, Rancho Mirage. Boy oh boy! This was a big, harsh experience. Initially intense and flavoursome like brandy, but once it hits the back of the tongue this gives way to the biggest hoppy hit Ive yet experienced. The climax has moments of smoothness and then of sweet, cloying, throat-grabbing brashness. Appears to be a quality product, but its too much for me.
Awesome, just plain awesome! If you think youre worthy(and you are!)give this bad boy a try!

poured a beautiful mohagany color with a thin tan head. aroma was sweet and malty with hints of citrus and alcohol.  Flavor was mostly sweet with a spicy alcohol bite.  Its hop flavor was full and pure.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2004 22oz Bottle.  Am I worthy??  My nerves were a their peak as I put my opener to the imposing bottle.  Pop!!,I was on my way to meeting this so called Bastard.  It poured a slightly hazy orange/brown/red with a large towering head.  The beer seemed to stare at me as much as I looked at it.  Initial aroma of a freshly opened sour grapefruit slapped me in the face.  Alcohol and a full richness lingered in the nose of this noble beast.  As I put my lips up to the glass the beer bit my tongue. The grapefruit tartness runs throughout the beer as its strong backbone.  Carmel sweetness lingers in the background.  Spices and other unique flavor round this beverage out wonderfully.  Mouth feel is medium, and the aftertaste might be the most impressive thing of all.  I found myself smacking my lips, and wanting to drink more of the tempting and delicious elixir.  I started out thinking "AAAAAHHHHGGG what is this" and ended saying MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!! I am worthy!
I loved this one, its got a ball tearer of a flavour, wicked punch after a couple and very drinkable, overall a dangerous one if you get too many at once, easy to keep drinking!!

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2006 I must not have been drinking the same thing as the rest of you guys.  The color and head were beautiful and the texture was nice, but the actual flavor was very alcoholy and bitter.  I didnt like it at all.  I couldnt even finish it. 8/4/3/3/9
RERATE: Dark color reddish brown color. Delicate ring of tight white creamy bubbles.  Aroma is bitter hops.  Dark, resiny. Also as the beer warms up, the malt starts to show up.  The flavor is very bitter with an abundance of hops. Fresh, rough, Arrogant.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2005 This is the bastard ive been waiting to rate. And it is aggressive... and beutiful too. Lots of malt and then a shitload of hops in the flavor as well as in the aroma. The bastard keeps sitting in your mouth lon time after youve had it... I love this brew...  wish i could drink this as my every day beer!

Upd. I have now tried AB stoemped with Spunk (no, not that kind of spunk, small danish licorices), and i must say that it makes this beer even better!
Nice deep red color with a creamy beige head. Very tangy grapefruit hops, sweet caramel and malt aroma and flavors. One of my favorites!

Nice very dark red color with generous white head.  Aroma of hops, toffee, and alcohol.  Malty, hoppy flavor with very prominent alcohol.  Very disjointed, chaotic flavors: just tons of flavors and booze crammed together with little finesse or balance.  Just cause it tastes A LOT doesnt mean it tastes GOOD.  22oz bottle.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2004 Real hoppy,
lively. Fun before dinner as tad bitter and dry aftertaste. Citrus and
spice. Cannot finish by myself. Two or three on this bottle. Beer to
have once a month but cannot find in Ontario. Redish brown with foamy
head.  Had also on tapp at Blue Tusk and works.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2005 22 oz.  bottle:  deep ruby color.  smelled like sour apples, and hops.    huge beer.  pure joy. Very complex taste, all of the different flavors hit you at a different time in the sip. VERY drinkable for a well worked in palate. Smoothe in the mouth, and it goes down fruity and hoppy. Fruits galore with every sip, you feel like you notice another thing about the brew each time you taste it. Really excellent brew. All the flavors blend really well together. pure bliss in a tulip glass

Tap (5/03/04): Pours nicely, with a nice tan head, that is slightly diminishing.  Aroma: urinal pucks (my friend came up with that, right on), not in a bad way, raspberries, strawberries, mint.  Flavor: grass, alcohol, hops, bitter raspberry, strawberry.  Finish: bitter, hard to describe, berries, alcohol.  Will try again.

I am not sure why this one is so hyped, probably the graphic and relative difficulty to obtain a bottle.  
Its solid for the style, but not one that would motivate me to the liquor store...

Ruby body, big tan head, sweet nose: malt with citric hops. Quite hoppy with a strong, medium-sweet malt backbone. The smack talk on the label is amusing and all that, but by todays standards this beer isnt that aggressive.

Bottle.

Garnet colored with a great big, fluffy tan head that has solid staying power and drapes the glass is brussels lace galore.

The nose is full of malt, hops, brown sugar, pepper and toffee.  I was hoping for more fresh hop nose from the opinions Id gotten from others.  Maybe my bottle isnt quite as fresh as some.

The flavor is big.  Hop bitterness forward, with an acidic wang on the tip of the tongue.  Then malt comes pouring forth in a tidal wave of molasses, toffe, caramel, cinnamon, and brown sugar.  Crystal malt in quantity it seems, always with a vegetal, acidic hop presence.  I guess Id say this beer is 60/40 hop vs malt split with both sides of the equation off the scale!

Finish is tannic/acidic with a crisp hop bite to top it off.

For my own part, I prefer maltier beers of this class (Strong Ale/Barleywine), but the Arrogant Bastard is a solid offering and nothing to be trifled with!
nice not spictacular but nice and strong with a good heady taste u can really feel the booze as soon as ur finished half a bottle..im hgetting shitty as we speak
I am not one who usually likes an overhopped beer, but this bastard is just plain good! Gives a very nice first impression, but alcohol taste may be overwhelming for some wimps!

UPDATED: APR 28, 2004 Nice amber red color, hoopy aroma and taste.  After reading the bottle, i expected a much more oppressive beer, but instead found one that actually had pretty good balance.  Very intense hoppiness right off the bat, but then it mellows nicely at the end.  Good beer!

OK, no real milestone for a 650th beer but still good to be able to try one of these bastards. In Australia there is an order of the old bastard which requires every member to greet one another as one, or buy a shout. No one is arrogant here, just bastards. Anyway this bastard decided to wait until the very last beer of the night to present his credentials. Arrogant indeed given that this was the 23rd of the night. Lucky he isn't a subtle bastard as we would have thought the finesse had been bastardised by numbers 1 to 22. Looks fabulous in the glass and so it scores very well for that. It has a pine needle type of hop resin nose with a hint of caramel. The taste is quite an experience, yep sure is bitter but for my palate seems to be a little unbalanced. Slighty OTT, as is expected of one so sure of himself.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: A great pour. Nice deep copper hue. Hint of hops in the smell, but a stronger taste of hops in the drink. Great aftertaste which stays long and a solid alcoholic punch. Knocked me on my ass.

Can't get too far in beer life without rating the bastard eh?  I really like this beer... I pretty much always have a bottle or 3 in my fridge.  It pours a deep red color with an off white head of medium size.  Head dissipated too quickly, and seems to leave little lacing.  Pfeh, who cares, let's get to the good stuff.  Aroma is pretty hoppy but strong alcohol and sweet crystal malts.  Taste is much the same!  The malt complexity is pretty impressive and hits right away, but with plenty of hop bitterness to keep things in line.  Mouthfeel may be a touch too carbonated, but the effervensance does serve to move the flavor around quite a bit.  Finishes dry and clean with a good alcohol taste and burn lingering.  Great beer Greg, thanks :)  (note, I've been drinking this at ~55 degrees lately, really brings out the malt tastes more, give it a shot if you're getting nothing but hops from the bastard!)
Very nice beer.  I love to drink and brew hoppy beers and this is that and more.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2004 Pours a clear reddish brown, nice ligh brown head. A lot of hops on my first whiff, a little alcohol.  Amazingly intense flavor!  Hops, hops, and some alcohol.  Bitterness is prevalent, but fits in with the whole picture quite well.  Very strong and intense experience.
Like most Stones, prevalent hoppy taste. Mouth feel is thinner than one would imagine given aroma and appearance. Nice fruit taste to offset a good bitter experience.

The ales appearance was clear and dark crimson brown with a thin head.  It had a hoppy, but sweet scent to it.  The taste was overwhelmed by hops.  To me it was very bitter and all of the hops overpowered some of the other less prevalent sweet flavors.  The mouthfeel wasnt anything special, but it was fine.  This wouldnt be my first choice for this style of beer.  Although drinkable, I wouldnt drink much of this at one time.  Overall I was a little disappointed; I didnt feel it lived up to its arrogant label.

Bottled: Fantastic burgundy colour. Brownish dense head. Hops, malt, alcahol and light cocoa notes in the aroma. Hops, swetness, fruit in the flavour. Complex and balanced. Nice long bitter finish. Intense beer. Thanks again to raindog.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2004 A bastard?  No, this beer is quite true.  Though the taste has the whip-tail of the devil on the bottle.  A really great beer, hopsy as anything, purges away all other flavors in your mouth.  A great, flavor-loaded round.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2006 Bottle.  Poured a deep red-brown and clear.  Tannish head that fades moderately quickly to a ring/layer and leaves great lacing.  Malty aroma with a bit of raisin and chocolate.  Moderately malty for just a brief instance and then a long hop bitterness.  Well balanced, just on the bitter side of things without being overtly a hop bomb.  Medium bodied, a bit thinnish with mouthfeel.  A decent beer but after re-rating this clocks in a bit lower than my original rating.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2006 Burgundy coloured. Nice aroma of cascade and malts. Bitter and fruity flavour with a slightly sourish touch. Very funny label.
Deep copper in color. Malty and hoppy. Well balanced beer. Rich beer. Smooth flavors. Great beer.

2002 I had this one from a cellar and found it to be a good cellaring beer. AB fresh has a somewhat coarse hoppiness that puts many people off. The hops in this one were subdued allowing the malty richness to come to the front. It still poured a deep clear chestnut brown with deep red highlights. Thick head that laced the glass with each sip. Rich complex aromas and a smooth, rich flavor that rememinded me of a better Barleywine. If you found this beer to be a little much, try putting one away to mellow for a year or so.

WHOA! a little strong! I was surprised this beer only had 7.2% with the strong taste to it. This beer was a bit overdone, and with the name, it seems like that was their goal. It's a great beer to try and talk about, but not one to but on a regular basis.

Hoppy, caramel aroma, also treacle and spice(nutmeg?) Ruby, with a small toffee head. Fine hoppy bitter almond flavour, and a bold malty aftertaste. Full bodied, dry and bitter. A Wonderful Offering! Thanks Radek and a special Thank You to Carolyne (Radek's Sister-In-Law.)

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2005 OK, I am typing this as I try this beer, so here we go. Aroma is God F*****G awful. Smells like rotted fruit rinds and cheap perfume. I cannot stress this enough. First sip: Initial thought "So, this is what badly fermented orange juice tastes like." Second sip: Ok, a little more mellow.  OK, burnt orange taste, VERY bitter acrid aftertaste. 3rd sip: Am I rating something that is an overall 4.03? Did the fine folks at SBC accidently bottle dishwater in the bottle? 4th sip: Ok, the aftertatse from the first 3 sips is killing me. I wonder how many people buy this shit more than once? 5th sip: No more. As I finished this beer, it got a little better, but was still not plesant. Everything about this beer is overproduced.
