Though Im not a fan of heavily hopped beers like this, Ill try to be objective and put myself in the shoes of someone who likes a heavily hopped, aggressive ale.  The bottle was nice and the label was amusing.  Otherwise, it is not my thing.

A veritable cornucopia of flavors and aromas.  Exquisite roasted and caramel malt flavor and aroma perfectly balanced by the intense hop flavors and aromas.  Medium to heavy body topped by a long-lasting creamy head.  Possibly the richest ale Ive tasted in my limited sampling.

its like theres a party in my mouth and everyones invited.  that being said, i liked this beer even before i took a drink. that redish brown crystal clear color was like looking at a work of art. and thats exactly what this beer is a work of art. complex, hard hitting and not fearing your petty opinions about it
The beer is BIG... extremely complex and hoppy. Very close to a Barley Wine in flavor. Possibly the best name and bottle on the planet..
Nice and hoppy and malty just the way I like it.  As others have stated, I thought it would be a little harder to handle, but nevertheless a great beer.

Hops, bam!  Malt, bam!  Hops, Malt, Hops, Malt, (alcohol), Hops, Malt....This is one seriously cool beer.  I couldnt tell which I tasted more or which assaulted me more, the hops or the malt.  I liken this to the Thomas Hearns vs. Marvin Hagler boxing match from back in the 80s, while not a lengthy fight, it was a 3-round war which led to a a knockout.

I cant call this a fine beer or a good beer.  Its an attitude.

Thanks to legion242 for sending this my way.

I loved it without opening the bottle.  Beautiful complexion.  Very dark amber, Complex sweet and somewhat fruity flavors, finishes nicely although this is not to say it is overly gentle.  Two is my limit and then Im feeling quite happy and ready to relax and watch whatever sport Im in to on the tube.
Dark Amber color.  Off white head.  Sweet slightly fruity nose.  sweet start, medium-full body, complex bitter finish.  Hmm....warm tummy.

This beer will knock you down! I cant handle more than one 22 oz.A rich dark amber color with a fruity nose.Very hoppy with a nice bite of alcohol.The beer needs to warmed enjoy the complex palate of flavors.Definately worth a try if you can get it.

Poured a beautiful dark amber with a full off white head.  Hoppy / licorice aroma was very nice.  A very complicated palate of flavors that became very smooth as the beer warmed.  Be warned, even a 22 oz. of this really packs a punch.  Probably not an every day beer for me, but definately worth a try.

strong fruity aroma, wonderfule dark amber color. the flavor is strang with hints of lambic style. id have to agree the others that have rated this, it is truely a complicated brew, but doesnt appeal to my taste.
Arrogant Bastard, Guinness, Arrogant Bastard, Guinness, Arrogant Guinness !!!

UPDATED: APR 29, 2003 My original rating of this beer was in my RateBeer infancy - before I became enamored by hops. Now ... great aroma - grapefruit and tang. My wife calls it sweet cat urine. Slightly hazy copper red beer with off-white foamy lacing head. Medium carb and medium heavy watery body. A light sweetness and fruit before being hammered by a huge bitterness. My taste buds shrivel is response. Huge grapefruit taste with bitter finish/after. Awesome. Alcohol/vapory. Malts and citrus. A really great beer.

sugary, candyish aroma that I thought was Licoriche.   Dark reddish brown.  starts with some sweet malts then some slight alchohol.  this is all nicely balanced by some nice tangy hop bitterness.  Very interesting.
Different inital tast, but really enjoyed the after tast, great color, plus at 7.2& it kicks ass!!!!
Very complex, but not really my style. Very forceful, with a bit of a tangy taste. A little too much for my tastes.

If size matters, then this is your beer.  I had a duce-duce of A.B. with my bacon & eggs on Saturday morning and it was the best damm breakfast I had in a long time.  Amber brown color with a thin reddish tan head that dissipated into a lacy film.  Strong hoppy (citrus, floral, Cascade), sweet aroma with a hint of coffee.  When the stuff first hits your mouth, you think its an IPA because of the intense bitter tea/grapefruit hoppiness.  Once you acclimate to the hoppiness, the stuff transforms into something of a heavy barleywine/Belgian ale: intensly malty, sweet, toasty, woody, and caramely taste.  This is truly clash of the titans (huge hops and huge malt).
The bottle made me think of my best feind and what is inside is even better.  Strong good taste made me glade that i am able to enjoy such a fine beer. life is not the same now

Poured a beautiful red/mahogany color. Produced a head that could have raised the Titanic. Hops everywhere. I really enjoyed the hell out of this. Thank God I still have 2 more in the fridge. There is life after IPA.

If you desire a beer with personality then drink arrogant bastard ale.  Very hoppy, the hops they use are probably quite acidic, like 8% or something.  Clever ad campaign.  Drink two 22oz. beverages and it will treat you right.  I usually drink three and it gets me where I want to go.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2008 I am not worthy. They are not kidding about this one. It is overpowering and devastating. It had immense flavor and strength. It is very dark, and the AC will knock you over. I must say that although it was too much for me, I could see why it is raved about. I am just not good enough to drink it regulary (a low A tolerance doesnt help either). Serious attitude...

This is IT. What a beer. The intense hoppy bitterness of the initial taste hits like a hammer, while still being elegant and balanced; and the finish is beautiful and lasting. I can see why some people warn beginners away from it, though; its power could be overwhelming for the inexperienced.

Definately a good beer...memorable.  I dont think I would have been able to have more than one of these in one night...not because of the alcohol content, but because the taste is really stong.  Too bad its hard to find here and so expensive =(

Mmmmmmmmmmmm: I am Norwegian, so I am already an arrogant fuck, and on that note, I found this beer to be very drinkable! (note, hops dont scare me).  What a joy from start to finnish!  Beauttiful head, wonderful dark red color, lovely lace, aroma that clung to the air until morning, and a thick bodied drinkability that that left my friend and I grinning with arrogance for hours!

I finally got to tangle with the bastard.  I shared a big bottle of this with a good friend today.  This all natural brew pours a clear ruddy red with a large creamy light brown mostly diminishing rocky head that has good lacing.  The nose is bold but clean with sweet and toasted malt balanced by grapefruit, flowers and light spice.  The big warm taste is spicy and balanced with no shortage of complexity and bitterness (a plus - right up there with Alpha King).  The medium chewy and creamy body is  outstanding with a soft carbonation that finishes clean.  One of the best Ive tried so far.
Nice hoppy ale that leans toward the bitter end of the spectrum.
this is my fav beer of all time i drink this beer every weekend to get my drinking started, i even got the logo tattooed on my forarm.
Hops, Hops, bitter...all should try, interesting!  Dont think I could drink on a regular basis though.
My all time favorite beer.  Nothing compares to the bastard.  Try it if you think youre worthy

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2007 Re-rate:  Murky deep orange color, with a nice sized tan head.  Huge pine aroma, starts and ends very bitter.  Very aggressive and tasty. Old rating:  22 OZ bottle:  A sweet cascade smell that is enchanting.  Nice bitter, malty taste, yet very smooth.  If you think that Molson is good beer, you arent worthy.

Hah! I finally found it, and it was definitely worth the wait and travel.  Really, enjoyed this brew, and its heavy, hoppy, punch definitely came as a pick-me-upper.  Not only that I would stock my fridge with, but certainly one Id get again.
A nicely hopped, well - balanced English Strong Ale. Beware after drinking 2 or more bottles !!!

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2004 3/14/02 I like it !!! Very bold, but good for a change of pace. 1/30/04 Deep mahogany color with a frothy mocha head. Rich barley wine like aroma with a touch of grapefruit. Flavor starts rich and caramel sweet followed by some intense hop bitterness that is well balanced by the malt. Finish has a dry stout like bitterness. Palate is rich and smooth. By GOD, I am fucking worthy!
good beer except for tasting so hoppy and it also has a great name

I went to the Stone last weekend and sampled their beers.  Well worth the visit for anyone visiting North County San Diego. The staff was very friendly and showed us the entire facility.  This is a great beer.  I bought a case!
Sorry.. too much bite, too much bitter, too much hoppy taste.. sorry guys just wasnt impressed!
Great artwork and text on the bottle!  The back is hilarious.  Inventive taste, a must try.  I couldnt drink it every day.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2004 Clear, ruby red. Soapy, rocky head and lace. Huge nose of caramelly, crystal malts and resiny hops. I also detect some peat and chocolate as well. Very rich. sweet flavors of malt, caramel and brutal, bitter, piney, resiny hops swimming in a medium-thick, rich body. Very hoppy but has wonderful sweetness throughout  that provides the balance. Finish is hoppy and pretty dry. A damn fine beer! Thank you Gusler!

This stuff is awesom.  There is an increible quntitity and variety of flavors packed
into this amazing brew.  It has a wonderful hop beginning and a beutiful chocalate malty finish.  
Amazing!!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2006 Thought I would re-rate now due to my personal affinity for this brew.  Once again, very deserving of the 5.0 rating I originally gave.  A Hall of Fame brew that turned me on to the joys of all other beers being different than Miller or Anheuser Busch.
Absolutely gorgeous color on this one.  Excellent transition with the hops, it all went smooth.  Finish of roasted fruits, raisin.

This beer just doesnt do it for me.  Maybe I have something against hype, as this beer is hyped a lot, but it just tastes harsh and unpleasant to me.  Sorry, guys.  I do like your IPA quite well, however.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2003 Rerate 05/08/03: Tried this on draught at Barley's Smokehouse. This is just one of those beers that is so unique and difficult to categorize that it is always a pleasure to drink. Pours a deep dark reddish brown with a thin and foamy beige head. Thin lacing. Aroma is alternatingly floral, fruity (citrus mostly), and malty. Medium-bodied and tart, with flavors of citrus, caramel, malt and pine. Complex yet easy to drink, with a nice strong and bitter finish. I have grown to appreciate this beer after having it so many times. 02/21/02 (3.7):I have to admit I didn't like this one on the fist taste, but at ounce 5 or so it started to taste really good. Not sure if this is a beer you want to spend the whole night drinking though, as it is expensive and hard to keep up with. Perfect color and different from the norm, which always scores points with me.
Horrible after-taste.
Slightly leafy/grassy aromatics. Deep amber hue. There is a nutty taste that settles in after the head on collision with the hops. Man, this is one huge beer! Thanks Gusler.
This is the appellation of kick ass beer.  For connoisseurs, a zenithal paradise.  For novices, however, a nadiral hell.
I am Barely worthy of such a fine brew .... a BIG beer - definetly NOT for wusses.  Party on Garth !

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2003 Dark copper body topped by a small creamy tan head tinged with orange.  Aroma is intense grapefruit, medium sweet.  Taste is grapefruit, chocolate, finishing alcohol-tinged grapefruit and light chocolate.  Medium-full body.  I could see this as one of my "Desert Island Beers" -- it's very satisfying, though not enough to stop you from wanting another one or two or six.

Wow this is quite different than I remember.  The english strong ale is quite apt, I would almost label it an old ale.  Attractive dark amber.  Thick rich body with a sweet finish.  I am not a particularly big fan of sweet finish, but this beer has a blast of hops that counteracts and nullifies the sweet finish.  Superb.

That is a gargoyle Huge_rat.
This is the best beer ever brewed, period.
this beer just flat out kicks butt!! I havent found a beer yet that kicks this much butt and tastes this great.
Whatever that guy on the label is, he definitely has a right to be arrogant about this beer.  Complex malts with a hint of spice and a very bitter hop finish, outstanding.
thought this was a local microbrew at my favorite pizza place, but hell, good beer wherever its brewed!
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2008 Hoppy nose and it is caramelly and chocolaty with a roasted coffee aftertaste. Gorgeous fruity/bitter Chinook interplay. Straightforward, but challenging enough, ASA.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2004 Stone Oak Aged Arrogant Bastard - Cask @ Real Ale Fest
Oh my grannies bustle, this was my second most favorite at the Real Ale Fest, just a tad behind the Russian River OVL Stout, in fact I had several samplers of this to be sure I was able to judge its character lol.
A somewhat hazy brown, the head a tan crown that was creamy in texture, the lace a thick coating upon the glass, with the nose sweet with the aroma of malt and Oak, hints of alcohol and bubble gum, yummy is a good description. Start was ambrosial, thick with malt, the top moderate to full in its feel. Finish was moderate in its a acidity, the hops delightful, quite dry and a bit of a tummy warmer, one damn fine beer in this old dawgs book.


Re-Rate 01/16/02: Been a while sence I had this bad boy, and it is a beer that 99.9% of the beer drinkers will not like? But I believe if you 'Can't Run With The Big Dogs, Stay On The Porch'. Pours a deep dark ruby brown, large beige head and lots of lace. Nose is malt, some what toasted, hints of hops, the start is malt, the middle full, robust, the finish is hop bitter and dry. Very hearty, a 'Beer Lovers' beer, not meant for the Palate Challenged Lite Beer Drinkers'.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2006 Bottle. If youre a hophead, this is the one. Its not over the top as some beers can be and tries to find some balance with the malt, but its the hops thatll keep you coming back. This is one of a few beers I miss while living in the UK.

Rich dark reddish brown/amber color with a big off-white head. Rich flavor and body. Caramel backing. Grapefruit and tar

UPDATED: APR 3, 2003 Re-rate bottled.
Known in the Middle-East as Bush Beer this is a soft little mild and unassuming beer... No. Let's be serious. Reddish ruby in colour with fine, firm head. Aggresive citrusy aroma. Short blast of reasonably soft, clean firm maltiness. Very bitter finish, and (ha!) there is this celery salt flavour. 
OK, you win... 
This IS a good beer. Much better than I first thought (and thanks for the beer).

Old rating:
Nut brown. Dry, big weird celery aroma, very bitter. A love/hate beer. Must probably taste it again to decide which it is for me, but that is easier said than done on this side of The Pond... 5/4/4/3/8

Arrogant indeed.  This brew is arrogant before you even open the bottle.  A nice toasted malt flavor yields quickly to an aggressive hop finish.  That word seems to get used a lot with this one, and its the right choice.  Very enjoyable for those who are Worthy.

A very aggressive taste.
If you like hoppy flavor, youll love this one.

Despite the label, I wasnt ready for the taste.  Its really quite good once youve grown accustomed to the aggressive flavour.  I really enjoyed this beer, even if my wife said it was the worst piss shed ever had!
Excelent Hoppy flavor and a cool bottle. Good beer. In my top 10 list!!!
Another excellent beer from stone!

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2010 12/22/01: A complex but possibly overdone and overrated beer. I enjoyed it but found the burnt malt flavor and lack of balance in the finish (a lot of alcohol flavor in only a moderately strong ale) to be a little displeasing. To its credit, a complex hop presence and an interesting malt flavor, and it did get better as it warmed. Well above average but not world class. 3.8. 

9/23/10: Nearly a decade later, my palate has gained wisdom. I was correct that this brew is very aggressive, but wrong about its balance on the palate, which nears perfection. Burnt caramel malt dominates above dark berry fruit and banana, with hints of grassy barnyard adding complexity. The long finish is wonderfully hoppy and creamy, and mingles beautifully with the dark malt body...anything but overdone.

I would love to taste this beer without the hops, just out of curiosity.  They seem so, well, harsh and distracting, from what is probably a nice blend of dark goodies.  Ill say one thing, though, this beer has one hell of a silky mouthfeel, creamy even.  I suppose the extra attitude of the hops is the point theyre making, a kind of rebellious war cry lest the warm dark heart of this brew lull you.  Anyway, thanks, Michael, for the gift!

Ruby, garnet dark; very little head; great plummy, orange nose.
Dry, not nearly as aggresive as the label advertises, though still would be hard on novices maybe. Gets hoppier as it warms, with lots of burnt malt at the end.
The best beer ever, period.  The perfect blend between overaly bitter and overly malty, best of both worlds.  The label stands true, beware all you yellow fizzy beer drinkers!!
Stone kicks ass, the only thing other than meth to come out of San Marcos
hopped up in taste and logo
Wow, an attack upon your taste buds. It brings a ton of hops with an interesting malt flavor. Good stuff.

A big, buff beer for men who like their beers to have a lot of character. The text on the bottle is a riot, and it makes you feel tough just to be drinking the beer. Dont drink this beer to cold, or the flavors are too raw and unmelded. Served coolish, the main flavor is a burnt caramel malt streaked with strong, course hops.   Is it just me, or have they toned done the hops in favor of malt complexity?  If I had to pick 10 American beers as favorites, this would be in the mix.

I really dont see whats so special about this beer, Its very good, the bottle is an excellent read, but I swear the taste is not very unique. I swear Ive had a half dozen other beers that taste very similar.
This beer lies, it said I wouldnt like it, but I did.  It was very complex.  I dont think I could drink more than one though.
Its ok to be arrogant when you can back it up.  Arrogant Bastard does a fine job of that.
Just the bottle could kick my ass!  Pair that with unbeliveable complexity and 7.2%, and you have one hell of a tough brew.
I enjoyed the bottle almost as much as the beer.  Great name.  Nice head.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2003 It was harsh at first taste, but then it proceeded to become one if not the best ales i have ever had. The solidist of tastes, balls to the wall. The picture says it all, this is one bad ass beer and it can back it up.
Intense Hoppy aroma and flavor balanced with roasted and caramel malt. Medium to heavy bodied with a creamy long lasting head. This is truely an ale with an attitude! Well done!!!
Excellent Beer-Well worth Trying! Good Job Stone!

Awesome - 7.2% - Hard to believe the beer isnt  stronger than that.  Loads of malt & hops.  More malt in a single bottle (22 oz) of this than in a 12 pack of Bud.  Loads of hops.  Loads.  An amazing beer, overall.
Lovely caramel maltiness with a lingering kick of alcohol.  Its strong, agressive, and has one of the best dang labels around.
First sip is strong, but it helps you forget this as you go along.  Great party beer if you like drunken wrestling matches with buddies.  = )
Im not worthy!!!!!

Wow is all you can say about this beer.  I tried with two of my homebrew buddies and we are still trying to figure out what hops they are using.  Course hop nose and spicy.  This beer is not for the faint at heart but if you are brave and arrogant give this beer a try.
Very nice. Hoppy & spicy.
Nice brew.  Tons of hoppy flavors and aroma, but balanced nicely with its maltiness.  A definite must for hopheads.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2003 Malts are thick and chalky, but also soft & smooth. Rich, intense hop profile seems to tingle the tongue. Alcohol nip. Huge aroma. Roasted-toasted nuttiness in the finish. Bold. Tasty Beer.
Are you moving your lips?

UPDATED: APR 30, 2003 The best I've ever had brought some wonderful citrusy, leafy hops overtop of the crystal malt.  This trend carried through the earthy body.  If it's not so fresh, and doesn't have a fresh, rich hop aroma, it gets dominated by that malt and is not nearly as impressive nor enjoyable.

Okay, Im not too proud to admit I bought this only because of the name.  But I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor.  It one of those beers that would definitely take some getting used to, but only beacause its unlike other beers Ive had.  I think the best way to describe it is meaty.
